The only thing I can say that is good about this game is the framework for the concept.

-Optimization is absolutely awful. Sub 60 fps, and if you play in multiplayer as the game was designed it stutters and lags even worse.
-Open world... two separate maps... and it feels barren. The vast majority of the houses and buildings you come across are not even accessible. The ones you can get into feel boring and bland.
-Balancing within the game is not fun at all. Its actually just boring combat wise. A.I. just dodge spam and teleport behind you. That is if the don't just spawn behind you in the first place. Also if you play in multiplayer it just become unbelievably easy. Vampires which are supposed to be "super threatening" become stun locked by at least 2 players.
-Safe house quest-lines are literally 1 mission and then under boss. That's it. Side quests in general are also just unbelievably boring.
-$70. For an unfinished, not optimized, unbalanced garbage piece of a game.

My honest opinion if the developers actually, you know, finished developing their game it could actually have been decent. But alas, yet another product in the trend of the modern gaming industry. Unpolished early access pieces of garbage, that should spend more time cooking, but developers now a days do not care at all for their products.

Edit 1:They released the first patch for the game... 1 week into launch...not day 1.
-they patched fast travel bugs.

NOT optimization, NOT A.I. behavior, NOT balancing, NOT COOP.

Nice to know this game will stay dead :)

Edit 2: May 23. still only 1 update on May 8th. Been a month and we still don't have any further updates...from a AAA company/developer.

Edit 3: June 2nd. There has been 1. 1! update since launch on May 1st. Game is garbage DO NOT BUY IT. DON"T EVEN PLAY IT FOR FREE. It's just brain damage.

They need to fix PC performance issues, + possible memory leaks.

They need to fix and provide Xbox players more than a locked 30 Fps experience.

They need to reduce the price.

They need to provide an apology for the false advertising and lies they sold us. 

They need to issue a statement for upcoming fixes / road map on what to expect or provide a refund scheme.

They need to do better.

They should be embarrassed.

::Initial Thoughts::
My opening impressions of the game before playing were the teaser and the controversial gameplay showcase, and neither impressed me. But as a passionate fan of Arkane, I bought the game on release anyway. And to my relief, it was better than I had been led to believe. I would like to point out that I have only played the game single-player so far, and that‚Äôs the perspective I am using in this review.

::Gameplay and Story::
- The vampires in this game give it a surreal, campy, and semi-spooky atmosphere, not unlike Buffy or an 80's horror. Every nook and crawlspace has the environmental storytelling that Arkane's known for, making it fun to explore even the most unassuming tool shed or bathroom. Overall the town feels well crafted and (recently) alive, like it‚Äôs worth fighting for.
- The gunplay feels weighty and responsive and the fights feel satisfying - when approached correctly. There‚Äôs a Borderlands vibe with the gun collection and sorting, making the looter-shooter label fairly accurate.
- The powers are visually interesting while adding an entertaining depth to the combat and world navigation. While it is fun playing alone, there‚Äôs the sinking feeling that the powers could be used even more efficiently and creatively together with other players.
- The story is just fine so far. There‚Äôs a high air of charisma from the player-characters that contrast quite well with the "quietly surviving" tone of the NPC's as you assist them. There's an overarching story that unfolds as you progress, but as I haven‚Äôt finished the game, I don‚Äôt know where it‚Äôs leading. Overall there‚Äôs nothing trailblazing from the story, but it seems perfectly suited for a game of killing vampires and soaking in atmosphere.

::Thoughts on Multiplayer::
Marketing for this game enthusiastically promoted this as a multiplayer game. I was concerned there‚Äôd be a hollow feeling as I played the game alone. As if the game would always pressure me to invite friends or frequently promote co-op only features. This was NOT the case, and the choice seems to lie solely on the player‚Äôs preference.

::Critiques::
- When you're not fighting something spooky, you're fighting a human cult/gang member. I figure this was for variety‚Äôs sake, to not overuse the beastly things and have them lose their sense of suspense. But they certainly are less interesting, and it feels like you fight them more than vampires.
- The default ADS is not 1:1. It's much lower than the mouse sensitivity making it quite cumbersome to counteract. As of now there is no option to adjust this.
- The overall game difficulty is relatively low. I'm playing it on 3/4 difficulty just to feel threatened. I'd probably insist on playing it on 4/4 difficulty if I were playing with friends. But to play on 4/4, you first need to beat the game on any other difficulty. If I wasn‚Äôt planning to play solo my first run anyway, I could see this being frustrating.

::Final Thoughts::
- When first starting the game, I picked the author, but didn't really vibe with it. So I started over as the psychic college student and enjoyed it more. This just to say, you might want to try out a character or two before settling in for a playthrough.
- I haven't read any of the other reviews yet as I wanted my first impression to be formed in a vacuum. But I do know the price is kinda steep and the reviews don't seem very positive right now. If that worries you, you'd probably only regret your purchase. Better wait for everything to cool off or wait for the eventual sale.

UPDATE 2 - 14 hours in
Game is still going strong. No technical problems at all.
BTW, I'm using a GeForce RTX 3090 and running on max settings for a 34" ultra-wide with G-Sync turned on.

UPDATE 3 - 23 hours - Finished Game
Although the game ran fine and I had no technical difficulties with it, I can't believe I finished it after 23 hours. I would say at this point the game was worth about $30-$35.
The game was good but not good enough for me to want to replay it on higher difficulties.
I'm going to change my rating from thumbs up to thumbs down based on the game's value. I don't think it's a $70 game. I would have gladly paid $70 for a game like Skyrim or The Witcher 3. I've replayed those games because they were so good. But not this one.

I can 100% understand the criticisms of this game and why it is currently so unpopular and poorly reviewed. 

My thoughts on the game: The performance problems it is having give it fun retro vibe; the low-density bad-guys honestly keep me spooked and on edge - crouch-walking around the entire map and praying I don't run into any of them; the controls are a little weird compared to some of the other (similar) games I play, but that adds to both the retro feel and to the adrenaline feeling because I'm already terrible at the game, and it feels like I'm constantly in danger.

Again - I get the criticisms and don't believe they're invalid. My experience playing the solo mission has been a blast! Enjoying the story and being spooked out of my mind everywhere I go. It isn't a 10/10 game, but I'd give it a solid 7 or so. I expect to keep playing this for quite a while!

I'm running a 3080 and ryzen 9 5950x and I'm lucky if I can hit 80 frames on medium graphics in an area with nothing happening... Not to mention the frame drops to 30 and below half the time with massive lag spikes.

Is it bad in terms of coop? not really. is coop VERY buggy? absolutely.
is it bad gameplay? .... eh? It's not bad per se, just pretty repetitive.
Not the worst thing to be but since singleplayer works better than coop, it can get lonely and boring. I bought it, might as well keep going. Simply there wasn't the most love with this game it feels like. More like it was an experiment. I feel the next game will be very good but till then, wait for updates and you know ... don't expect too much.

other problems I have with this? leveling feels ... lengthy. there are a lot of nice upgrades for your characters but it takes a while to get the exp. for it. if you did nothing but quests then maybe, but I am very explorative, and I feel I should get more exp. out of searching around and doing a good chunk of the side stuff.

characters? great. I was iffy on devinder (i think that's how the name is spelled) but he actually has some very nice abilities. if you wanna mess with coop, he would be a good pick if you are against a horde of vampires. assuming you have the 3rd ability available. 

if you are going solo, be careful. Though the game is kind of easy on even harder difficulties, it doesn't mean anything if you get overwhelmed by over a dozen vampires. If you get a UV light weapon, keep it equiped if you feel something is wrong about an area.

Loot? very easy to get once you understand how it works. [most of this was observed in singleplayer] The highest level weapon you can get will always be your level at the time of getting it. The grade (color) of the weapon can be anything, simply RNG. Gold weapons are always special but you will eventually have to salvage those too, as you level up more and more. There is all kinds of boxes and laid about gear to find what you need. But also check shelves and closets closely, there can be something small but useful like a gold gun on the back of a shelf above your head. There are also random items that is basically money, like in dishonored. 

... I forget, was I writing a review or writing a guide ... well regardless these were my thoughts.
I'm off to die another 20 times to a horde of vampires cause im impatient.
Pretty decent, i wish there was a way to upgrade weapons that you really enjoy instead of having to get rid of them when you level.

TL;DR: I assume 95% of the reviews posted thus far are by people who got through the "tutorial" mission and decided the game was trash so don't trust most of the reviews here with "0.10 hours on record" because that's nowhere near enough to get a fair feel for the game. Maybe wait for a Steam sale to pick this one up, it seems like a $30 title rather than $70 but overall, it's been a decent ride. Gameplay is smooth, open world fills out as you unlock more content, and the open world is very vertical, so maybe try climbing before assuming there's nothing to do. 


Let's rip the bandaid off. Not sure this is a full-price game. I'd say wait to get it at a decent discount from what I've played so far. The AI is not fantastic, and that's my biggest gripe, but in general I'm having a lot of fun exploring the world and making my way through the early missions. Also, to be transparent, I'm not having any performance issues. I have a very high-end rig, and the game runs just fine, but that may just be a little "ivory tower" syndrome. 

I feel the need to step up and defend this game a little, however, from all of the smoothbrain takes here. 

People are complaining the "open world is empty" then have like 20 minutes in the game. Did you even try? As you complete progression missions, there's more and more that is being added to do in the world. There's also a lot of verticality to most of the world. There's a lot of buildings you can't just walk into, but you [b]can[/b] parkour up to the rooftops or climb scaffolding and get into a lot of places via a higher floor window. I've finished roughly 5 main missions, and the world is starting to fill out with more side-objectives to complete, so it takes some time to "unlock" those features. Sure, this is a little linear than most people would expect from an open-world title, but them's the breaks now and then. 

Secondly, I've seen some reviews of people who have 4 - 6 hours in the game and their review claims they have beaten the whole story and I find that dubious. Now, I'm not speedrunning the game, and I'm not sure how long it is, but with around 4 - 5 hours myself, trying to see more content than just the main story, I'm only - as I said - about 4 or 5 missions in. 

Maybe the game's main missions are super shallow and if you just bust your way through only story missions, you can finish that quickly, but I expect the story missions will take probably 10 - 20 hours to beat, at least? I just seriously doubt that - even at breakneck paces - you could beat the whole main story so quickly. There's no published speedruns of the game yet, so there's no fair frame of reference, so I just may be overestimating the length of the story. 

Ultimately, I feel like this is just a bandwagon "review bomb brigade" where people spend 10 minutes in the game, decide that progressing to unlock features is for chumps, and refund the game because a lot of the takes so far are hot garbage. 

Thanks for coming to my TED Talk.

This game really is not as bad as people are making it out to be. I had a pretty decent time just going solo through the story and messing around with builds. That being said, however, it is still absolutely not a 70 dollar title. With the state of which this game was released, it should have been priced as half as much. I think I speak for just about everyone when I say that I wish it was a 70 dollar game. But quite frankly, it just isn't, that's just the sad truth. Arkane is capable of much more.

Most of the negatives I have towards this game are not even that major and it really just needed more time and polishing overall. I would have loved to see more variance in the weapons or even had somewhat of a workbench/crafting type system to customize weapons. I feel like the idea of jury rigging guns to fit your needs fits the post apocalyptic overtones the game has already and would have been a nice touch thematically and also mechanically speaking. It also would have been nice to have more fleshed out skill trees for the characters. It should have more meaning as to which path you wanted to specialize in rather than just slightly enhancing an ability and getting a few generic perks. The npcs also have little to no variation and their AI is honestly pretty abysmal. It feels like you're either being absolutely lasered by an enemy while behind cover or you're watching them run slowly and aimlessly in circles with no in-between. And, as "open" as the world may be, it also feels so empty for a majority of the game. 

Gunplay overall feels alright and I don't mind the "cartoonish" graphics some people have commented on. To me, it really is a style choice. The story overall was also sorta okay despite having the cop out comic book style "cutscenes" from npcs that have little to no depth.

In short, if you can play this game for free through game pass or are getting this on sale for at least half off, it's decent enough to sink a few hours in and forget about it afterwards. I would not recommend buying this game full price unless they really make some major changes. I sadly doubt they will though and will more than likely just take their cash and just take the L.

This is not really a review about how the game is just bad, though it was clearly rushed on Bethesda's part. The game is still fun and for you people that DIDN'T get performance issues. Fantastic. I enjoyed playing the game with my friends and the Co-op is pretty unique. I felt different play styles with each of the different characters and their dialog exchanges are pretty entertaining. The world is interesting and the layouts and puzzles are pretty much what I would expect from a sort of "Left4Dead"- eske style. HOWEVER; My friends have nicknamed this game, "A steaming pile of Jank". Because that's what WE experienced. The lobby kept crashing, we were kicked multiple times before start up and we often found ourselves lost in the dark void of nothingness between level loads. My game personally kept render lagging to about 4 - 5 seconds of just stillness and sadly all though I love the art-style, it doesn't graphically wise look ANY better than Left for dead. For 70 dollars, that's sadly PRETTY JACKED UP. and 100 for the bite back edition? NOT. WORTH. IT. Is it fun? Yeah, If this type of game is your cup of tea. Should you pay this price tag for it. Nah. Wait for it to maybe go on sale or something. There are some complaint's about the AI but i personally haven't had issues with that, but this is my perspective on it. From my experience the problem with the game lies in it being virtually unplayable due to bugs and graphic issues rather than its Story or lack there of. Maybe wait until Steam Summer Sale or something.

I definitely wanted this game to be good. The premise is great, a vampire hunting game with 4-player co-op and an open world created by Arkane (Dishonored, Deathloop) so I thought: Count me in.

However, the launch is HORRIBLE. I tried to ignore the IGN reviews of the gameplay being shoddy. Optimization is horrible. I have decent hardware (3070 RTX, 9900K overclocked to 5.0 GHz) and I had to fine tune the settings to see 60 FPS, and even then it's very unstable - you can tell the game is loading enemies because of the hard stutters I experience.

The gameplay is NOT smooth. Playing this game with a controller and even M/KB is crap, aiming and fine tuning your crosshair is not existent. In order to get better feedback, you have to use a higher sensitivity with the input speed set to low. Why isn't this the default?

There aren't any cutscenes in the game either. Everything is a slideshow with dialogue. Hell, there's not a single interactive NPC in the game. For $70 in 2023? No.

This game is NOT finished. It had potential but I do not see them bouncing back from this one - will probably take more than a year to get this game to a finished state, and that's being optimistic.

How did this get released?

While I did get the game for free and the cost is 70 euros (which is pretty high among games), I am too early in the game to be able to define its replability, its overall size nor if the cost also intends to cover some future unannounced content.

I'm merely leaving a positive review with the reminder that Steam the past year has been plagued with fake "poor optimization" reviews or reviews of that kind that were fixed within 24h of game release and thus not relevant any longer yet not adjusted. While games can have issues, the added army of fake reviewers on Steam the past year has gotten out of hand and even highly praised games get hit by this to the point that I'm not entirely certain if it's coordinated malice or just bots targeting everything. So take optimization reviews with a massive grain of salt.

I'm also leaving this review as a reminder to look the game up yourself through content creators you find trustworthy, rarely if ever trust Steams user review system as it is incredibly flawed and neither positive nor negative is necessarily a good measurement of what the game truly is.

But for what it's worth: I had no issues playing it, smooth and fun gameplay and eager to play it with a friend at some point. Hopefully others get to have that type of experience to! Only thing I'm hoping to see is improved AI down the road of this release as it does not feel particularly difficult even on higher settings atm. However, the devs may not have intended the game to be a challenge in the first place, so I don't see that as a minus as much as a personal preference.

Now I've seen most of the reviews already and don't get me wrong, the game does need some work. But I really do enjoy playing. I love the concept and once they release some bug fixes then I truly believe it can live up to the price. Honestly, I kinda like how empty it is. It adds to the "a vampire can attack me at any point" feel and plays into how bad the vampire infestation is. Just try the game for yourself. Or watch some gameplay on Twitch or YouTube to see if it's your style of game before buying.

What a great concept.

This game was hyped from when it was announced and I was all here for it. I bit but this game did not bite back. On top of paying $70 plus the bite back addition DLC pricing this game wasn't even close to that tag. 

The largest problem this game has is it's identity, it has no clue what it wants to be. It had this great lead in with vampires restricting a Massachusetts town and wreaking havoc on it's inhabitants. The problem comes in the lead in when you start the game! It feels non existent, it doesn't set up the story at all, even if it was trying to make it mysterious like you need to explore and figure out the story for yourself it doesn't entice you to do so, Between large areas of the empty town and poor AI enemies that are few and far between, and aren't positioned well like they forgot to load them in. Its overall poor delivery. They took a great concept and hype and came up seriously short. 

I feel like this game shouldn't be open world, like it just wanted the tag to be a selling point. The game feels like it's wants to be a mix of Days Gone/Dead Island/Borderlands. The story is so weak trying to force the open world concept and not guiding you through or setting up the game well at all. I feel they should've played more like the Left for Dead series, multiplayer co-op with Vampire enemies and a clear story set through mission levels. One of my other biggest gripes was not being able to take multiple quests from the mission table, you have to take one at a time when being displayed multiple. Upon quest completion, the next quest you accept you're going right back to the same location to do something else. Entice the player to explore your open world you created! Also, all of the levels ups and completions give this red text like an old Ghost busters game/Stranger Things text. That was just nitpicking, but I will say the level up jingle does tickle my fancy, most likely my favorite thing of the entire game.

There are so many different directions they could've taken this game and the concept was so promising. I really really wanted a stake melee weapon (right off the bat when you receive the stake in the firehouse) instead of a stake bayonet on just a few guns that you're basically forced to switch to, it feels wrong. I don't really love the characters either. The NPC's story feels like they're just there and not very involved. I don't want to force this game into Left for Dead or L4D2 but the Cola Guy who unblocks the highway to the mall has more charm than any NPC I have met in this game, you never even see the dude too! Maybe I wanted this game to live up to that game, which still plays phenomenally btw, considering it being a four player shooter PVE with a revive system against Vampires (much like zombies).

There's a famous staple in immersive sims: even if it doesn't do anything, the toilets should be able to be flushed. It's part of showing the player that the gameworld is meant to be a real place; that it doesn't exist simply as a combat arena. Ironically, flushing toilets is just about the [i]only[/i] ambient interaction you can do in Redfall. There's no clutter to pick up and use to distract enemies, no drawers to rifle through, no bodies to search. 

In my first hour, I tried to shoot out a streetlamp so I could move under cover of darkness, and my bullet ricocheted off the bulb. I tried to pick up an obviously-explosive bottle so I could throw it at a vampire, but picking up objects is apparently beyond my ability. Maybe the flushable toilet feature is a small act of defiance from the one person on the team who wished they were still working on an immersive sim. 

The Dishonored games and Prey are among my favorite games of all time. I was super excited for Redfall and didn't even bother checking out the near-launch media coverage before I dove in. Maybe that was a mistake, but with the excellent reputation they've built up -- up until now -- I had no reason to doubt that this game would be worth my money. Unfortunately I feel like my best option at the moment is to refund it. Without serious, fundamental changes, it's not a game I could see myself giving any more time to.
This game would be good. If it wasn't so bad...

Optimize it for minimum and recommended spec systems, patch it for stable fps, fix the frame rate drops, populate the open world with POIs and allow drop in co-op over internet and I will recommend and change this review.

To preface I'm running the following specs:

Ryzen 5800X
32GB DDR4-3600
Gigabyte 4070Ti Gaming OC
Samsung 990 Pro NVME 2TB and a WD SN850 2TB
2x 1440p dual monitors 1 @ 165hz, the other 144hz

I don't understand the negativity surrounding this game. The game runs fine for me, outside of a few frame drops, usually happening when loading into new areas and only lasts about 1-2 seconds, with Epic settings/DLAA + Frame Gen I'm able to maintain 140+ FPS with no issues. I might be more of the exception and not the rule though. Also, I thought games were supposed to be about fun, from what I've read a lot of people are having fun with the game, so why all the negative reviews?

The game looks fine to me. Graphics are fine for the art-style they're aiming for. Yes, I know there are missing textures and reused assets, but if you're more worried about things that don't even affect game play, then I don't know what to tell you. Seems like people forget that a lot of open world games face these issues, it's not new, it's not recent, and it's going to continue to happen.

This game is basically Borderlands with Vampires. Gun play is fun. It's gratifying when unloading into a bad guy,  and there's tons of guns to find in this game. I've only played about 2 hours so far, but from what I've seen and experienced, it definitely seems like it's going to be an enjoyable experience all around. I'm also loving the environment it's got a creepy, Stephen King small town vibe to it, and when you're up in the high areas like the mountains overlooking the town, to me it was a sight to see. Lastly, the co-op, now I've never been one for co-op, but the option is there, and from what I've read is actually really fun.

Could this game have used a few extra months in development? Sure, extra development never hurts, but for what they released, to me at least, is a good product, a product in which you can see the developers put their hearts into it, just a few minor bugs to be ironed out like the frame drops, and enemy pathing, and some AI issues, and you'll have yourself a very solid product.
This game is about 25% finished.

Texture updates needed ASAP the road texture phases out constantly, Blurred trees and other objects while still within 5 - 10 ft

with all that being said I still had fun 7 hours in, can wait to customise my skill tree more and try some other chars, levelling is a bit of a grind but I'm fine with that.


EDIT 19.2 hours in textures have gotten worse (i was staring at a bus for like 30 seconds at one point before the  texture loaded in) 

Play this game on Midnight mode (solo) made it really fun and a bit challenging when i had lots of different enemy types attacking

Skill tree is still really cool! Having fun seeing what i levelled come to fruition.

all in all i wont ask for a refund but don't buy this game for full price and if you play with a full lobby its going to be the easiest game ever.

Payed $70 for a game worth $20 max.

I should note I have played this game solo so I am not versed in coop issues.


The game has its issues, sliding enemies, junky ai that gets itself stuck in random little spots. 
I've encountered some ai that at point blank couldn't hit me even when I was standing still, but also had them turn into super snipers and pelt me unmercifully with bullets.

None of which has made me think "wow game sucks", if anything it made me enjoy it more.


I've had a few issues of stuttering and lag, mostly when loading into new neighbourhoods. And the occasional "You have 0 medpacks" only for me to heal and the number actually reflect what I was carrying.

The open world can feel empty at times but when you've played the likes of Bannerlord or Fallout you are used to the fact that yes some areas will be devoid of life.


My robot companion also disappeared somewhere during my play, no idea where he is or what he is doing, so to that I say, go live your best life little dude, you being gone wasn't noticed.

feels like level design hints at the map being built around pvp / b royale before a downsized team decided / was told to make it singleplayer/coop last second. the voice acting is good, but had me asking myself "why is it so narration emphasized when the story is so lame?" . thats when i realized this project is a frankenstein's monster. falling short in all aspects of gameplay besides an eh gunplay and oh so cool new engine (which runs poorly from what ive heard) im on a 3090 and have beautiful performance besides an occasional stutter while exploring the neighborhood. dont buy until sale or huge patches. coop broken on launch also total buzzkill

I know this review is against everyone is saying. Just get it on game pass. Spend the 15 dollars. I have been playing this co-op with one of my buds and we are both having a blast. Sure there are bugs sure there are goofy ahh things constantly happening. I can tell you this for sure the AI within the first 3 hours is horrible. It's toned down to fit the low level player so you do not get sheet on. I am about 7 hours into the story with my friend. We have enjoyed all of it regardless of the hate and the bugs. It's a chill vampire shooter. Now is it worth the full 70 dollars I cannot answer that yet but we've encountered hours of fun and it keeps pulling us back and has been giving us the enjoyment we seek. I also get the game is not for everyone. It just has been awhile since I've played borderlands 2/3 and this is fulfilling that desire with a new feeling. The frames have been pretty stable 70-80 with my 2070 super and I have also been streaming the game to my friends over discord. I do recommend to play through the story with a friend but solo is still an option. Each character has an interesting kit and their own personalities like whether they can play the random instruments found around the world.

I don't recommend the game. I wish I could, but this is nowhere near a finished game. The person who approved to release this should be hold accountable seriously. This is a disgrace to the name of Arcane studios. I am not used to this quality and I don't think I can look forward anything in the future with the same enthusiasm as before. It is clearly management issue.

This game needed like a year more in production time to fix all the bugs and AI, optimize performance and make the world feel not empty. At this state I can't recommend it to anyone, as it is one more game that the publishers forced the developers to rush out. It has some potential, but I doubt it is going to be anything beyond mediocre game.

Its a Good game. But for this price, it should be a Great game. I like it, I the 'Dishonoured' look, I understand you couldnt keep all the mechanics AND make it Co-op.. I like the 'Far Cry' style world, and the undertone of menace. When this goes on sale, snag it definitely. ON SALE.

- (3 hour review) Been having fun so far, and I will probably enjoy it more with co-op. But otherwise it's a decent game.

- Update after approx. 6 hours (3 hours of co-op, 3 hours solo): Game is still decent. I would say that there are definitely some areas where the A.I. is often lacking and making dumb decisions, and there are bugs/issues in co-op such as letters becoming unreadable if someone else interacts with them first (though they still get added to your log). Overall me and the gf are enjoying it and taking our time to just explore and do missions as we come across them. Hopefully the performance issues and A.I. are addressed in patches sooner than later, and I would personally like some quality of life tweaks such as the little robot companion not being so obnoxiously loud (actually that's probably the #1 thing that has particularly bugged me since it's so annoying to hear stomping around all the time).

I honestly don't know. I think it has lots of potential. most of my issues were the same as others out there. Enemy AI is dumb and boring. I think I passed up 50 med packs over the course of an hour and had used 2 the whole time, and once was my fault. The first vampire mini boss died in less than 10 seconds and hit me once, with white lvl 1 weps on and no skills yet. We like a challenge! 

Speaking of, why in the heck does leveling up take so long? My whole time I only hit lvl 2? out of 40! I've read that beating the game only gets you lvl 20/40 and that's ridiculous and not worth it. No one wants to do 2-3 full playthroughs of the same guy, just to get max level. 

There's some bugs but they all seem fixable. I didn't encounter as many as others have, nor did i have any FPS issues on 2160p Ultra. 
I took my time and explored every corner of everywhere I could and man... There's just nothing there besides currency items, med packs and the occasional pistola that I had 7 of already.... even after I found a lockpick and went back to a locked box, was junk inside. The next 3 lock picks were the same with one giving me a shotgun, which was cool, but then i got one about 2 min later as part of the story.... smh.

Again, these are all things that can be fixed and patched and I really hope they will be, because I was and sorta am excited to play this game. I love Borderlands and Destiny, Division and Diablo and any Looter and/or Shooter. I Frakking LOVE skill trees and builds. I think this game has the potential to be a lot of fun and much better than it is and ill be happy to purchase it again at a future date, for a cheaper price. I already thought that the "new" $70 price tag they're trying to shove down our throats is ridiculous to begin with and 99% of the time, I simply won't get it on principle, with the exception of something like FF7R2, which is not only my fav series, but if its 2/3 as good as FF7R, then it's worth it and I believe its gonna be even better. If you wanna charge $70, you better make sure it's worth it and up to the standards of "better than a $60 game".

That all being said. My first 2ish hours was decent. I played 30 min with a buddy with no hickups and then a fresh guy up to level 2. I was ok. Way too easy, Not enough loot or interesting or rare either. Stealth was ok. Guns were fun. Graphics are fun. The lore seems cool and excited to see the story. The characters all seem great with varied skills and lots of builds to try. Coop. Lot's of positives to go with lots of negatives that hopefully all get fixed. 

Last thing i forgot was something I watched cause I didn't get that far, but you HAVE to retool the perks on the weapons. No one wants a bunch of lazy, passive stat boosts. Especially if there's not a good amount of gear to play with, which there's not. So you have to make the weapons that much more interesting!!! Perks that augment the skills in the skill tree. Power up, change, whatever, but I wanna pick up a legendary that has a perk so good that it makes me wanna change my build around to try it out, or boosts my current build to make me OP feeling. You can even steal ideas from Borderlands and Destiny n such, but anything is better than passive stat boosts like acc +10 or DMG +20 or add 2 rounds to your mag. 

Ok, sry for the super long rantview... But I've been really excited about this one for a long while and broke both my rules of, "DON'T PREORDER" and "DON'T SPEND $70 ON A BASE GAME" 
and I'm just really bummed. Please read this and everyone else's and fix it so I can change my review and I'll/We'll  be back!!!!

Redfall is a game with many issues. Enemy AI is fairly bad, and the graphics look like a standard xbox 360 games. Guns have a weird iron sight realignment after shooting (Which is actually really cool once you notice it, but very frustrating if you don't realize that it's there.) Enemy difficulty is also non-existent in the start. Playing through on Midnight difficulty (Highest you can go for first playthrough), with a group of three including myself. I have never felt remotely threatened. Performance is also really bad, I'm dropping to 20 frames from 60 on a regular basis. In spite of these issues, the game is still fun. Definitely Check back in six months to a year to see if they have fixed the issues. If these issues are fixed, Redfall can very much be an amazing game you wouldn't want to skip. But until these Issues are fixed I cannot recommend the game.

I'll start off by saying... If you have people to play with, or enjoy just solo stuff and shooting things, this is an "eh" kind of game. It's a game. It's fun to play a game. That's all this is. It's not terrible, it's not great. It's not like it hurts me to play it, I've actually been having an alright time with the game so far, but... I got the game for free, so... If you can get it for free too, go wild. I would recommend trying it out if you can get it without paying 70 bucks. If you just have 70 bucks that you want to blow on something though, sure, why not. 

If you don't have friends that want to play this with you, and don't want to just play solo. Well... Just forget this game exists. There's no matchmaking. That already is a complete interest killer for a ton of people.

I haven't had any crazy bugs, crashes, or anything, and the AI is... I mean, the AI is about as threatening as any Far Cry game, it's not very smart. You can snipe a dude's friend's face off right in front of him and he'll just stand there like nothing happened. If you're looking for difficulty, yeah, not here. I've tried the game's settings on easy, medium, and hard, and I see very little differences. I have yet to see what the super hard option is like, but hey, considering what I've seen so far, and what I've heard other people say, I doubt it's going to be that much harder.

This game... It's not worth 70 dollars. I will say that for sure. It's a alright game, but it's a 20 dollar purchase, easily. As it is, at this current price, without matchmaking... I'd give it a pass. If you can get it cheap, or on gamepass, cool. If not? Pass on it. Go play Vermintide or something.

I like this game's concept. I'd like to see it work. It's just not working right now.

It is a shame the game had potential to be great and the bones for a solid game are there but I doubt they will fix a sinking ship.

A few notes on Redfall:

1. I'm running a little under spec, and it runs fine on Medium settings
2. My friends are above spec, and have no major issues.
3. They are playing it on XBOX Gamepass

  I am having a blast. Occasionally the game will have a hiccup, and co-op is a touch buggy. But overall it is fun time to be had. The occasional lobby crash is annoying ,and I'll admit that Singleplayer is kinda lonely, especially if you don't search EVERY nook and cranny. Despite all of that, it's still a good time, and I don't see all the reasons that people are disliking it. So I give it a solid 8/10.

Seems very targeted to non gamers .  Definitely not for experienced gamers, at least on medium (normal) difficulty.

Every time that I play Redfall  when I click on the play option then the game launches but it WILL STOP at the Redfall banner and will not continue loading, so I ALWAYS have to launch task manager, kill the Redfall task and then I can relaunch the game again and it will load successfully. This happens on a 4090 and Intel CPU 13900K  so its not like I am running this on a potato but instead a high end gaming rig and the current Nvidia driver. 

Both Bethesda and Arkane should be very embarrassed and with both of them delaying Redfall in the past  they still delivered a massive bug ridden game is pretty dismal, how the hell did they not fix these bugs before release? Was the QA team asleep?

Finally if Bethesda released Redfall in its horrible state then this gives me HUGE concern for the upcoming Starfield game and if its going to be a massive failure as well.

it becomes VERY repetitive near end game content...you will have to grind grind grind quests to just get to the last boss which is beyond stupid for a FPS game

This game actually had potential to be great, they rushed it tbh terrible company if they let it out early like this 100% they knew all these issues before releasing.

it's a decent 1 time play through type of game nothing memorable from this game though

you know what baffles me the most though and why i give this game a thumbs down? because everything i've said so far is something you can overlook tbh if you're into stories...but what i really found dumb was...it took 4 years to create this FPS game and they only have 7 different TYPES of guns of which you will more than like use 3 types of guns only! such a rushed game not sure why...but it got ruined from it's potential...not a terrible game but nothing memorable either.

Extra hot garbo. I can't believe I paid 70 bucks for this and spent too long going "maybe it'll be better a bit further in" just to exceed the 2 hour refund time limit. Don't buy this. Just look at the many reviews on youtube and see for yourself what you'd be paying for. You deserve better for 70 dollars, I promise.

Purchased on a "bundle" platform. Performance wise, the game ran just fine for me. Epic settings at 1440 with DLSS on stayed pegged at my 140 FPS limit. Even ran it upscaled to widescreen 4k the first couple hours and it hovered around 110 FPS. Micro-stutter was barely noticeable for me.

The game-play and the world however are far from what I would expect from Arkane. The AI is very noticeably poor, making hard difficulties almost laughably easy. The gun-play just feels... off... somehow. The world is empty and dead, and at least in the first few hours all there is to do is either the target fetch quest objective, or collecting random junk that instantly turns into cash in your bag when you touch it and/or excess guns laying around, which you then scrap for cash in your bag. That actually felt fine initially, but it didn't take long to realize the only benefit of looking through anything in the world was, A.) to find another flavor text note someone left, or B.) to hope you might find a better gun laying somewhere. Which I already had two top tier shotguns two hours in and nearly every gun I found was just a pile of coin in the shape of a gun. 

If this were maybe a $20 game I probably wouldn't complain and would just take it for what it is. But this is coming from a triple A company, and is up there among probably the top five or ten most expensive games I've purchased in the last few years.

I've refunded my purchase. Might buy this again someday down the road when it's on a very deep sale. And hopefully they've improved the game some by then. It's got the bones to potentially work with and make something good. But I certainly wouldn't recommend it in it's current state at it's current price.

Your scope just stops doing its sole function. Its almost like they are trolling us at this point. I was thinking this could be a vampire The Division or something. I guess I overshot my load!

I never write reviews but on this particular occasion i felt it is a must for anyone thinking of buying this game. I have played most Arkane games including the old school Dark Messiah Might & Magic, Dishonored 1 & 2, Deathloop, Prey even Wolfenstein Young Blood. So with that said..

Graphics: Not something Arkane is typically known for in my opinion. Most of their games are artistically beautiful not graphically (except Deathloop and Wolfenstien even though it wasn't their engine). But Redfall just looks very dated and somehow looks worse than their previous games.

Gameplay: Its not good enough to be a looter shooter (which i personally love) and not really a good Far Cry game or Arkane immersive sim game. It doesn't give you any choice of approaching each situation different except a different entrance into a building, interesting gameplay loops or interesting character powers to play with. It be fun to run around and shoot vampire as that idea is still novel but the AI is dumb as a bag of bricks.

Sound: A step back from again Deathloop in every way i think but guns do sound punchy

Story: I know this will piss people off but i don't think ARKANE is particularly good at telling a traditional story in any of their games except maybe Deathloop or Prey. But what they are masters of is environmental story telling, awesome worlds, lore and setting and again in every way Redfall falls to live up to that legacy. Barely any story, world is boring to explore, minimal environmental story telling and so on.

Overvall: After many patches i think this game will be decent enough time to spend with friends or solo to run through this when there's aren't a lot of games coming out. Otherwise i would strongly to avoid this game. Even as a hardcore Arkane fan. I will beat this game but will be waiting for patches.

I think the negative hype may be somewhat unwarranted. It reminds me a lot of the Borderlands games, though with a Arkane art style. As such the story isn't as compelling as it might otherwise be, but it is funny and entertaining. Is it groundbreaking or incredibly compelling? No. Is it a fun time? It can be.

Performance for me is high enough I turned on Vsync to keep from needing to run my GPU to high, though it does drop to 60 fps in some places. This is without using DLSS or other techniques. Though my system is on the higher end of the spectrum. It hasn't crashed on me so far either. It does have graphical bugs at times like floating baddies, but It's no worse than many other games that have had such issues at launch.

They needed waaaaaay more time to get this in a playable state because as it is right now i cannot recommend this. I can see they tried making this game good but it's nowhere near ready for release... Arkane somehow made vampires boring just how Marvel achieved it with Morbius.

Bullet-point list of all the stuff I encountered in my one-hour co-op session:

- Flashlights are local-only and seem to work by increasing brightness in a cone of vision like how they do in Half-Life 2. This would be fine, but because this is a co-op game you can't use your friend's flashlight to your advantage.
- The characters have psychic powers but they were almost never as useful as simply shooting enemies in the face to kill them.
- Shader compilation stutters were constant and made me think I was playing a game on a Wii emulator. This is a problem endemic to Unreal Engine 4 games on PC from what I understand, but it was too frequent to be ignored.
- Many "distant" objects Z-fighted until we got close to them and then the higher LOD models were able to resolve that.
- Nearly identical weapons are impossible to tell apart on the inventory screen (a model of shotgun with a red dot sight and the same model of shotgun without a red dot sight have the same icon).
- At one point my character was running around pantomiming holding a gun but wasn't actually holding one in the eyes of the other player. Really wish we got a screenshot of that but I don't want to put any more playtime on this than I have to.
- If you hide behind a car, the enemy AI can't pathfind its way to you.
- They do the horrible pretend mouse cursor thing on controller instead of just using normal menu navigation. I know why they're doing this, because Destiny and Project Wingman does it, just to name a few. I hate it there and I hate it here. If I'm using a controller I want to navigate around the menu directly, not pretend I'm using a mouse.
- Tree pop-in that makes Pokemon Violet look good, seriously.
- Loot is instanced, but if someone is looking through a chest another co-op player can't look through it until they're done. This has lead to my my partner mentioning guns that we can't see ourselves or get a hold of. This confused us both greatly until we realized loot was instanced.
- Your player characters will frequently fail to pick up ammo. No matter how many times you press the button. No matter how many times you walk away from the ammo and come back. Similar to the previous issue.
- Having two nearly identical weapons makes the weapon switching button Y fail to switch weapons on a controller,
- The inter-character dialogue is very uninspired and overall feels quite forced.
- The cutscenes are ken burns effect vignettes of dramatis personae doing actions like cleaning the firehouse. It reminds me of the kind of animation quality you get when you need to finish the TV season but you ran out of budget, just like the last episode of Evangelion. THIS IS NOT A COMPLIMENT. The last episode of Evangelion is much better made than the cutscenes here.
- Alt-tabbing out of the game gave you a 2% chance that it will just lock up. It made having a second monitor for replying to Discord messages irrelevant.
- We didn't choose to end our playthrough, the game just disconnected us after we finished rescuing hostages for a mission.

This needs two more years to be actually playable. Another AAA game dropping the ball once again.
Finished the campaign. This game is bad and the developers deserve all the mocking they get.

This game feels like a low effort Unreal Engine asset flip. Could've been decent with another year or so of development but game devs nowadays don't do that I guess ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø

Despite being verified, game is unplayable on Steam Deck in its current state
- Framerate is all over the map even with tweaks to settings
- Controls cut out intermittently, sometimes shifting to trackpad
- Not unexpected, but heats the Deck up at a rate comparable to Cyberpunk, you MIGHT get 35 minutes of play on a full battery

Outside of Steam Deck specific issues:
- Gun play feels incredibly awkward, on par with Timesplitters 2
- Overall game is incredibly glitchy (vampires and cultists getting stuck in terrain, delay on item pick ups and interactions).
These two issues alone make the game feel like work, hoping they are able address some of these long term but refunded for now as this just isn't an acceptable product at it's current price and state.

I'm having a lot of fun with this game playing with a friend of mine that being said the game has issues. There are a lot of glitches, the AI is dumb, and IMO the worst part is the game is too easy. My friend and I while doing side missions eventually came to the point where we one shot most enemies including bosses of each region. We are playing on midnight (the hard difficulty) and are just tearing through enemies like a hot knife through butter.

For the pros I really like the games aesthetic with a backdrop of vampires and an ocean suspended around the town preventing people from leaving. You can approach most buildings in a classic Arkane kind of way to a slightly lesser degree. The world also has small details sprinkled throughout to learn more about the town of redfall and how it got into this mess. 

Finally, I felt this issue had to be addressed separately I don't think the game has enough content atm to justify a 70$ price tag if they release free content updates and areas then maybe but I think arkane is gonna be fighting an uphill battle to fix the negative press around this game.

Okay, so.. I bought the ultimate edition of Redfall. I played it for two hours on stream with my friend. I rarely, if ever, refund games, even bad ones. But with this one, I refunded it and got my money back. It is NOT worth 70 dollars.. I enjoyed what I did play, but what I played.. was perhaps, the most.. ungodly newbie ass shooter ever.. I liked a lot of the mechanics and design of redfall.. but the ai was boring as hell, NONE.. and I mean -NONE- of the enemies were a challenge, not even close. idk what version IGN was playing but that was -NOT- what we got. 

 We were playing on normal and nothing was a challenge, everything died in a couple hit. We were getting the top guns dropping left and right.. half the time the ai would just sit there and let us kill em. Most of the missions we played were simple go here, kill x I think eventually itll be good, but.. it needs a lot of work.. the characters were very interesting and unique.. but their abilities broke the game. 

My friend had the teleport ability and -any- terrain design was negated instantly due to the low cooldown rapid nature of teleporting.. any tactical reasoning was just negated instantly. Stealth is a joke, completely not even necessary whatsoever.. the shell of the game is great, but I refunded that shit.. and I don't do that lightly. If AAA publishers think, that we are just gonna pay 70 bucks for broken, bullshit fucking games, they need to pull their heads out of their asses. Cuz I can go and buy a game from an indie dev team at a tenth of the cost and get far more enjoyment, longevity and willingness to financially support them, than the f'n crap we are getting from triple A publishers.

Essentially, wait for an extremely deep sale and just wait and see if they do anything, cuz the game right now is not even remotely worth the price tag.

Overall 8/10. Weapons are clean and with a good computer to handle the stress a game like this brings for smooth gameplay‚Ä¶ you will have a blast. Its a new experience for sure.

I'm not one to do reviews in general, it seems to me that steam reviews are very broken. On the other hand, being also a Dev, it hurts me to speak ill of the work of another, of which I know how difficult it is to do something like this.

I'm going to be fair with the game without falling into the review bombing.

The game is in a Beta state. It has performance and balancing issues that can only be achieved with player iteration and time.

There is no matcking for coop op. Only by invitation you can play the multiplayer. The AI needs to polish its behavior. The stealth mode is pretty bad in its mechanics. The shotting is also poorly achieved. For an open world it feels a bit empty. The class builds are not very dynamic, to unlock the ultimate ability of a skill you have to have all of the above. They are 40 lvl max and getting to the top of a skill takes about 12 points.

I think many things can be improved with time. For those of us who pay for the game without the game pass. It's not worth the price. If you have it for the game pass and you have nothing else to play, go ahead.

I hope the game will improve but its current state does not show anything that motivates or helps me recommend the game.

I have played 8h+ and I must say this is a swing and a miss sadly.
Broken AI, broken animation, under-par AI detection, unsustainable FPS, hitboxes that works one time and not the other.
Controls are ok (ish), world that feels empty and uninspired.

I don't mind the cutscenes being images, got a bit (YES, I said a bit) of a Max Payne 1 vibe, yes this game feels like it came out in the early/mid 2000.

BUT the big question is, does this game truly hold up to the 70$ or even the 100$ price tag?
My answer is a HUGE NO, not in this state, not a chance, 30$ sure, 70 not in this life time.

It will not matter to most people if they fix the game down the line and try to do a no man's sky.
The damage is done for most, but maybe I will be wrong.

It truly feels like a very undercooked game.
This game should have been delayed for at least 6 months, maybe more. 
But as it stands atm, I could not recommend this game for any price higher then 30$
But try it and play for an hour and do a refund.

You can cheese fight way too often. There are menu glitches. Skill points are stingy. Lots of areas missing life/undead. NPC interaction and voice acting is awkward, rare, and not engaging. I do not write reviews for games, but this game is so bad that it compels me to write one for it, This game isn't any fun at all, the whole game feels sloppy in terms of characters details such as bags with no straps, looks like the bag are glued to the characters, no animated cut-scenes, nice but empty environment, you loot whatever you can and they are just in-game cash. There is no matchmaking for cooperation and you need an online connection to play as a single-player game. And last but not least, I am afraid of playing horror games, especially with dark rooms, etc, but this game has dead bodies that look like they are sleeping on the floor and blood and bloodstains that look like red paint that the darkness in areas doesn't trigger my phobia. Oh and ya the NPCs are stupid to the point that they are hilarious, plus if your gun happens to be somehow weaker than the human enemies, shooting them in the head doesn't kills them straight away, might as well be making all the enemies into vampires, at least that would have made better sense. I wouldn't be disappointed when they dare charge 70 USD for this lazily crafted game and also blame myself for being such a dumbdonkey...

70$ USD? Absolutely not.
60$ USD? Significantly lacks content and has too many issues, bugs, and optimization failures.
50$ USD? Lacks content and has too many issues, and optimization failures.
40$ USD? Too many issues, and optimization failures.
30$ USD? A fair price for what it is.

Wait until the game is 30$ USD or less imo.

Is it the best Shooter or FPS there is? No! Is it fun to play? Yes! I dont regret buying it, an will have a lot of fun with it.

True, the open world feels empty, but to be honest, I nowadays quite expect a game to be unfinished on release. Would I have liked a more populated world? Yes! But basically I like the game.

EDIT: I still have fun in the game, it is just overshaded by the flaws it has. I wrongly presumed that the first missions are just a kind of tutorial where they take you at the hand and go easy on you. No, the later missions are in no way better, or harder. The lack of cut scenes is beginning to get on my nerves. Not that there is no place where a cutscene would be, there are just stills wilth naration.
Opponents are easy (even on hard difficulty), they are incapable of wayfindingso you can sometimes just "stun"lock them behind objects. The only time when vampires are a problem, is when they swarm you, then they can basically pile on you and you are dead, but in all other cases, especially bosses, they drop like flies due to a non-existing AI.

[Update]: I still stand by my statement that this is a "turn off your bran and have fun" type of game, but it's definitely not worth the full price that's charged - with how repetitive it is. I did have fun playing through it (even before the optimization patches came out), but this game could and should have been so much more... It's honestly a shame.

Buy when on a major sale, if you think this is up your alley. Because you can have fun with it. But, just be sure to know what you're getting into.

See my full playthrough here:
https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLqYmzOS0dk34xDTt0mN2O_upMmX3ZSV7Y&si=gIQOgP7Ns1WG6tHL

This game is not an "Experience" like Dishonored was. It's a simpler "Just have fun" kind of game, and if that's the kind of gameplay you enjoy - this is up your alley. Optimization is a bit wonky as of launch, but devs have already stated it's going to be better sooner than later.

If you're on the fence about it, and have gamepass. Try it out there first, and then buy it if you enjoy it.

I got this game with my Gigabyte 4080 OC card. Overall, the game runs fine on my system. I crank everything to Epic at 4k resolution with DLSS set to quality. I then lock my fps to 60 a since I stream at 60. Game runs amazingly well, but there are issues with frame generation where I get weird flickering so I leave it off. My Current system is 5800x, 32 gigs of ram, and RTX 4080. I also use a 4K HDR 2000 NEO Mini LED curved 165hz display that is 32 inches. Every now and then I get a tab bit of stutter that is hardly noticeable.

My biggest complaint is not performance at all, it is the fact that multi-player is invite only. I don't know anyone, but myself who games on PC so having a game with no public servers so we can match-up with randoms is dumb.

There is a lot that needs to be fixed, but my biggest problem is that there is no takedown prompt. All you can do is crouchwalk to a human enemy and melee them in the butt to instakill them. 
The game has some fps stutter, it should have had more time in the oven and a more alive feeling enviroment, but its not a bad game.
The idea is nice and with a squad its really fun to each do your own thing while you move on to your next objective. 
Arkane dropped the ball on this game and I hope they'll recover it like we had with Cyberpunk and No Man's Sky.

I was looking for a solid coop story campaign in Arkane's engine, and I  cant wait till they smooth it out.

Gotten this game for free with my videocard purchase and played this on a 4080 paired with the 5800X3D cpu on all maxed out Epic settings. Here's a couple of things I can list that would make me not recommend it:

Very low quality 3D model work and low quality animations, pushes your pc like next-gen but looks like a 2012 game, very low quality AI reacting either slow or seemingly glitched, a ton of strange graphical oddities e.g ambient occlusion continuous artifacting or pitch black looking garage interiors when its light outside, confusing storyline where your character knows more than the player leaving me play catch-up, lackluster cinematics (if you can call them that), boring environments where nothing notable happens most of the time, enemy design appears unimaginative, weapons don't feel good shooting and their design appears uncreative (don't just add stakes to everything...), characters are uninteresting to deal with although I've stopped playing about 2 hours in as of this writing.

I've not had performance issues like most others aside the occassional hiccup entering zones/points of interest, it's everything else about this game that's a head scratcher. I'll be honest: you're better off getting Dead Island 2 for less than this on another platform or wait for when it launches on Steam.

Sorry Arkane devs, I know you've been pressured by your publishers to release this as-is. played for 2 days since launch, i can safely say i can't currently recommend it in it's launch state.  i'm over spec and there's fairly constant performance issues, and there's a ton of things that are dire need of rebalancing to be any sort of fair to the players.

the angler's move being unbreakable is ridiculous considering how much health she takes with the move, and the rook mechanic straight up makes no sense.  you basically fill up a piss-em-off-o-meter til a rook storm occurs, and he comes down to fight you.  you die?  well, respawn and go fight him again.  there's no real penalty for severely pissing off apparently old vampiric gods, so why have this at all?

i constantly experienced chop and lag when fighting vampires, often causing me to end up shooting just behind their path for a full clip.  the damage radius of vampires and explosions seems a bit larger than it feels like it should be.  let's not even talk about how touching fire can knock off a third of your health bar, but a half second in the death mist does nothing.

i also feel like mob fighting vampires was very much designed for group play, and not geared down for solo play at all.  i've died way too many times fighting 4+ vampires, forget introducing the special ones into the mix

tl;dr - wait for patches, probably a lot of them.  maybe on sale.  i'm still playing it anyway as it scratches the looter shooter itch and it's fun/playable enough, but there's probably 40% buyer's regret on this pre-order purchase.
Mediocre story, repetitive gameplay, and frankly just too many bugs and issues. Why was a game this unpolished allowed to be published?

Following the Nvidia driver update, the game is running much more smoothly across the board with some minor fps drops here and there. Definitely a "Better With Friends" sort of game once they get a handle on the crashes which may occur while running co-op. Either way, it's worth a play through at least. As for me, I think I can see myself 100%'ing the game while still having fun with it.

Update: Getting close to 100%'ing at this point, and the crashes have gotten much better, though still occurring every now and again. It seems they improved some of the movements of the enemies since launch day; they don't seem as blocky/choppy as they were. Sticking along with the notes from my original post, I would have liked to see more variety with the enemies, both basic and special. Additionally, the limited variety and customization in our weapons left a lot to be desired. Finishing up the game overall, I felt like the ending was a bit underwhelming. None of the major bosses felt particularly difficult nor did they require much adjustment to the standard mechanics. Despite all of that, I hope they continue to give Redfall more love and build on the content. I enjoyed my overall experience with the game, but I would like to see more built into it going forward.

First and foremost I am playing on a fairly High-end PC so have not seen the framerate issues others are commenting on.

I have been having lots of fun with this game and I feel like it is getting review bombed by players that have their OWN expectation of what this game should be. No one seems to allow for any creative change in art style or game design. This is a fun open-world Borderlands lite game. Once you get out of the first area (town of Redfall) the density of NPCs and difficulty increase a lot.

The game is not perfect but it is fun, campaign progression being limited to host is inexcusable these days, there needs to be drop-in co-op and co-op matchmaking and potentially a denser starting area so players don't feel like the world is so empty.

Is this a $70 game at launch? Sadly, No. If the the few items listed above were included at launch then absolutely.

Is it worth playing? Definitely, but wait for a sale.

P.S. The A.I. really is bad but it actually seemed more aggressive in the second game area.

If I could summarize for people that don't like reading, just look up a gif of someone sighing and leave it looping for awhile. That was me the entire time I played this game.

Seeing this happen to Redfall and Arkane is kinda like when I watched the Seahawks, my favorite team, throw the ball at the 1 yard line and get intercepted instead of running it and winning two consecutive superbowls in a row. 

Arkane has an *amazing* catalog of games, Prey 2017 was probably one of the most genuinely great games I have ever played, and yet here they are, pulling a Ubisoft and releasing an unfinished, half baked game that barely runs on solid hardware. 

To start with, if you have any interest in this game, I would NEVER tell you to go spoof an email to get gamepass for a dollar and play it there. That would be morally wrong, and you shouldn't do that instead of spending money here on steam ;)

Lets get this out of the way at the top. I have an RTX 3070, 10700k and 32 gigs of ram. I should be able to run any functional modern AAA release at ultra settings with at least 60fps on 1080p no problem, and I normally do. I feel like my rig is fairly representative of what most people playing new AAA games are gonna have, and Redfall absolutely CHUGS. The main problem (a few people in my chat surmised) was my 3070 only has 8gb of VRAM, whereas everyone saying the game runs fine has a 3080 or newer which all have 16+ gb of VRAM, hence the game runs smoother. Performance is dogwater for me, and for a lot of other people, not because our hardware is lacking, but because this game isn't finished in a myriad of ways, the least of which being optimization. As an example, headbob detracts from frames because there isn't a headbob in the game, but there's a setting for it, so its a script running in the background calling for assets that aren't there lol

EVEN IGNORING PERFORMANCE

The game is wholly and irrevocably half baked. I can't even try to name all of the issues I encountered, but to start, the AI is one of the worst I have seen in any game I've ever played. You can make an enemy into red mist and their patrol buddy right next to them won't react. They don't pay attention, they funnel down corridors, and thats just the human AI.

The vampire AI are either far too lethal, or far too passive. I don't think the devs found the right middle ground with them and it feels like the hitboxes on their attacks are smoke and mirrors. The game decides when you get hit, and dodging around doesn't do much. I did manage to get one accidentally stuck on some garbage cans between me and them and they just sat there attacking the garbage until I killed them. Its *bad*

The story is yet another part of this that might've been interesting but ends up being horrible. The town itself is actually pretty cool, but it feels empty and lifeless (not just because all the people in town are pretty much canonically in one building the vampires mysteriously won't attack).

All of the cutscenes are these weird, in-engine still frames with voice acting over the top, and they have these unengaging missions where you watch ghosts of people talk, but the music is always too loud to hear them? Subtitles don't even help because enemy NPCs talk outside and it covers up the subtitles for the pseudo cutscene. Atrocious. Its also abrupt and incoherent. They do a whole lot of talking and yet still say nothing, the people praising the "lore" of Redfall are missing brain cells. 

I chose Layla for my hunter, and I am VERY annoyed with the writing staff for having a black lady as a main character and then deciding that her ultimate ability is to call up her ex boyfriend to fight for her. Seriously lol, her ultimate is calling her ex to come beat the shit out of people. You don't even meet him, he's just an ability. There's no storyline where you save him and maybe start to rekindle your romance, nothing. Just "I'm too weak, call my ex" and that sends a super lame message about an otherwise badass character. 

The gunplay ends up being a worse version of Destiny, the powers aren't very interesting and the upgrade trees are absurdly boring. "Ability does more damage, carry more ammo". You don't get any new abilities to pick from, its the same all game and they just hit a little harder over time. 

The game, even in singleplayer is "always online" so you cant actually pause it (or play without internet, I assume), and I got sent a code for the game + dlc from Arkane (I was surprised too) but let me tell you what you get for the DLC. 

4 shitty outfits, one for each character (the regular character design for Layla is better than all the unlockable outfits) a skin for your stake and a skin for your gun. The gun skin looks like rust, I put it on and genuinely thought it just made my gun rusty. You also get 2 DLC characters down the road :) You know, after you've beaten the game and don't care to play anymore? ALL OF THAT COSTS 30 DOLLARS

Charging 70 bucks for this mess is already a crime against humanity, and maybe the beginning of the end for Arkane.

We're seeing a lot of the legacy-once great dev teams fall, and this feels like another. I have a feeling that Microsoft acquiring Bethesda and therefore Arkane has something to do with this being put out OBVIOUSLY not finished, so don't jump at the devs just yet, but absolutely don't buy this game. 

I'm gonna finish it tomorrow and will update if there's anything new, twitch link in my steam profile if anyone would rather watch someone else play it than buy it themselves, but I'm not expecting anything to improve. I was surprised to see there was at least one more section of map (so Redfall is just the starting area), but I'm only expecting 3 total zones at most.

Seriously disappointed in this. One of the biggest wastes of potential and quickest falls from grace I've ever seen.

[code] Follow my steam curator page for more reviews: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42143664/ [/code]

First impressions:
Played for about 5 hours now. and I LOVE it! There is a surprising queer feeling going through me why so many have said negative things about this game. EA workers writing that negatively maybe!? Or another company. Without being too negative toward them, I found almost nothing that was bad about this game. Here we go, right from my direct honest thinking of the game:

What was good?
Everything!
1. The guns and rifles kick ass. They remind me of Borderlands + Deathloop together. The guns that glow blue and other colors are not just nice looking, they have special abilities to help with more damage and rate of fire for that particular gun. 
2. The characters are unique. They play and feel similar to the different characters in Borderlands. They have special abilities and with that, weaknesses. Just like real heroes from Marvel do.
3. Playing Online with close friends = more fun. Without a friend, you can play offline in Single Player gaming (SP). In Redfall SP is the same as Multiplayer (MP) however, with MP you will have MORE Damage! Use your abilities together to play like gods.
4. The sound is the best I have heard in many years. Yes, really. I have never heard this well done sound with glass breaking, explosions, and more. Compared to Death-loop, it is a little bit higher quality sound, and it is fucking scary.
5. Scary. Did I mention that already? I never get scared from a game, ever. Never had been, didn't think I would be. This game scares me like hell. One building where a vampire was above me - it came down and started scraping me with its claws, and I almost had total problems with breathing. I am writing to you from a man who thinks most horror movies and scary games are boring. Not here. Here it is a 10/10 fear enjoyment ride!
6. No FPS frame drops as of yet. Hell, no loading time! The game runs nearly perfect, except for a few minor glitches which are to be expected at week-of-release on my system without any problems, even with 10-15 enemies at once fighting them. Sys is: Windows 11 on Ryzen 7, with 8 CPUs / 16 logical processors. I'm running it at stock at the moment at 3.6Ghz. Game card: nVidia Geforce RTX 2080Ti 12GB VRAM. Sys mem: 32GB. Running on an SSD. The game loads in about 5 seconds for me from new launch, and levels don't have a feeling of loading at all - like .5 second wait.
7. The game is Realistic on Midnight difficulty level. The game will feel like you are in a real world trying to stay Alive. Good luck! People mentioned it's easy? Yeah, well then play more and see how long you can survive. Let me tell you this. You will need your friends to win. Without them, good luck on Midnight difficulty.

What was bad?

1. It is a little glitchy. Remember this is version 1.0. Don't expect perfect gaming.
That's the only bad part I could find so far.

Remember: Steam has 14 days to give you 100% back for your game if it wasn't what you expected from the commercials. So try it, read what I wrote, and I hope you agree!

Despite a negative reviews, I would say from the gameplay aspect It is an pretty soild game. The world building have a pretty nice 1980s B movie vibe. The atomsphere is on spot.  Arkane still able to put many small details into this game. Possibly not in the same level of Prey and dishonored, but I can still see people are putting works in it.

The fighting come with some pretty satisfying details, like the execution of the vampires. The weapon is a combination of traditional FPS and some sci-fi ghostbuster technology. The enemy AI is a huge step back compare to the dishonored and prey.

The Bugs are noticable, but it is not on the game breaking level. However the server seems to be unstable.

All in all, it is not a regrettable purchase for me. I hope this game will get more polished in the coming weeks.

Redfall is a 5-7/10 (50-70%) game. I've recommended it to offset its 32% rating as of writing this. I wouldn't pay more than $30 for it in its current state.

Positives

- Skill Trees (I enjoy them over not having them)
- Large World
- shooting is responsive enough...
- not laggy for me
- Lots of "clutter" Items and detailed environments
- different weapons, levels and designs

Negatives

- Terrible AI (VERY EASY) (VERY)
- Cartoony Graphics
- Huge empty spaces ( while these areas were amazingly full of interesting things to look at... I spent 30 minutes without even seeing an enemy.) This made the game feel very unfinished.
- The characters aren't really interesting.
- The story is not super interesting either.
- gathering supplies is becoming very repetitive
- alt tab caused mouse cursor to always be in way.
- gun play seems a bit pointless. a sniper rifle is too slow, most of the time its better to use the assault rifle like a pistol and headshot enemies. you wont run out of bullets this way. could use balancing.

There are so many other points, but these are probably the most jarring.  This is one of the games you feel like there was a HUGE opportunity lost in its development and needed some outside perspective before release. you can tell some peoples souls went into this. it just really sucks to run into games like this. Deathloop is another classic example of this problem.

This game should have stayed in the oven for a while longer. I will consider playing again when the performance issues get fixed.

Redfall is a game that promised a lot but ultimately fails to deliver. From the outset, it appears to be a promising open-world FPS action game with a unique storyline. However, as you progress through the game, it becomes apparent that the gameplay is shallow and uninspired.

One of the biggest issues with Redfall is the lack of variety in the missions and activities. There are only a handful of missions, and they all feel repetitive and unchallenging. The combat system is also lackluster, with only a few basic moves and attacks that quickly become boring. The Vampires, which should be the highlight of any action game, are poorly executed and lack any real sense of excitement.

Another significant issue with Redfall is the graphics and visual design. The game looks dated and unpolished, with low-quality textures and character models. The environments are bland and lack detail, which makes exploring them feel like a chore.

Furthermore, the game suffers from technical issues, including frequent crashes and bugs that disrupt the gameplay experience. The controls are also clunky and unresponsive, making it difficult to perform even the most basic actions.

Overall, Redfall is a game that falls short of its promises and fails to deliver an engaging and entertaining experience. It's a shallow and uninspired game with repetitive missions, lackluster combat, poor graphics, technical issues, and unresponsive controls. I would not recommend this game to anyone looking for an exciting and immersive open world FPS game.
