It's not such a bad game like people are claiming, but I've got to say a couple of things in order to support my opinion:

-Im playing on high end computer, and I didnt experience any issues performance-wise.

-I got this game for free.

-AI has good aim and vampires are diverse. However, a higher difficulty would be more enjoyable IMO.

-The price is too high for such a game. 40 bucks would be enough for it, more people would buy it and that would make a healthy player base, at least during launch considering that this game is more fun played with people.

-It would be good to have AI partners to play with when you don't have any friends ready to pay the game prize.

-Yes, it has some bugs, none of them are game-breaking (at least for now) and not too annoying to make me angry or anything

-The economy system would use some improvement, while I would reduce the amount of weapon drops making them better (=less but better gaps between weapon levels).

-Missions are a little bit silly but I think thats not something they wanted to put effort on. The game has great visuals and combat is not bad; again, it could be improved by increasing the difficulty.

Conclusion: Wait until the game has a 50% discount and you'll have some fun with friends. I wouldn't have paid 70 ‚Ç¨ myself for this game and without that huge barrier, I am enjoying the game

Having a lot of fun with both single and multiplayer!
Some issues with multiplayer disconnecting randomly a few times, but mostly very enjoyable. 
Didn't get very far in the story yet, but I love the characters and their backgrounds, there's so much cool lore in the game, things to find while exploring, and the team has some cool chatter when there's more players around. 

The skill trees and abilities are interesting but not too complicated, and the gameplay with guns feels entertaining and fun. Headshots are extremely gratifying. There's plenty to choose from with equipment, skins and playstyle. The world is cool and there's so much to explore!

Game looks gorgeous and runs great at constant 60 frames on a Win10/Ryzen 9/RTX3080 on Ultra video settings. Some funny graphical issues here and there with shadows and some effect shaders, but I didn't encounter anything game breaking or actually buggy that would've stopped me from enjoying the game.

Main issues:
- Shadows look blocky, pixeley and atrociously silly even on Epic quality setting and it takes away from the otherwise gorgeous aesthetic. Maybe some shortcuts were taken to get the game running smoothly before launch day? :3
- Sometimes vampires just, like blank out. They're there, floating, but they don't have a collision and they don't aggro so you can just walk up to them and admire them :D
- Occasional disconnects in co-op

All in all, the game definitely needs a bit of patching and an extra 6 months of polish, but it's clearly lovingly crafted and a lot of fun both solo and co-op! If you're going in with just wanting to have some fun and not get too serious, and not with a mindset of trying to find absolutely everything that is wrong with this game, you're gonna enjoy it, especially if you like Arkane's worlds and "shooterlooter" games.

Vampire bad

[h1] I bought this game again just to leave a negative review on steam [/h1]

Just to get it out of the way, I give this game a 4/10 with a friend but a 3/10 for single player. Me and my friend bought xbox game past for $10 to play this game and give it a try instead of wasting $70 on this piece of crap. In our 9 hours of game play we both realize how bad this game is, without a friend I don't even think I can play past an hour. Don't even think about playing with randoms because there is no public matchmaking, yeah...$70 game. Here are the reasons why this game is good and bad(mostly bad).

Pros:
-Some variety of enemies, some vampires look pretty cool and have unique abilities
-Lots of content and places to explore and things to do so you don't always feel like there's nothing to do
-Environments/atmosphere can be pretty good at times especially when you head into these areas where it would shape shift and morph the environment as you play. 

Cons:
-The biggest Issue....AI! Ai is so bad in this game that you can say its nonexistent in this game. You can literally run around the entire world and punch these guys to death with just your fist if you want without using a gun because that's what me and my friend did. You can even go full fist against these mini bosses they have around the world. The Ai is so bad it makes the difficulty setting pointless because of how dumb they are. They can't shoot at anything even with highest difficulty setting, you can get so close you can lick their ear and they would turn around saying.."whats that." They would run at you backwards and would literally sometimes never know whats going around them until you hit them. 
-This cost $70
-With $70 you will get no cutscenes with animations because almost all of it is just still images with your character narrating the story so you will feel no connection to the story and characters itself. Even during an investigation where you watch the memories of these characters reenacting their tragic moment, were just still frames with no animations or movement
-No public matchmaking, unless you have a buddy that's willing to spend $70(or $10 for xbox game pass) you're on your own
- Gameplay is clunky and doesn't help that the game is unoptimized with frame drops at times. 
-Shooting feels awful, there are roblox games with better shooting than this game. Pistols can't hit target at times and feels like crap to shoot, almost all shotguns feel sluggish and they all feel and handle the same. Assault rifles are the best weapon in the game currently. Sniper rifles are alright but don't ever bother trying to use them on vampires, you won't hit crap
-The characters and their skills doesn't feel that impactful to the gameplay, they can remove the skills these characters have and you will still get the same experience. Sometimes you even forget to use them
-Because Ai are so brain dead this game is very easy even on hardest difficulty, like I said you can just run around and punch people and vampires if you want. When me and my friend got to the second area for some reason everything was easier to kill despite being on the hardest difficulty setting, might be a bug who knows.
-The open world feels very bland, its as wide as a lake but deep as a puddle. There are enemy zones to conquer but their usually guarded by only 4-7 guys and almost always die to one shot, even on hard its not a challenge. 
-The side characters are terrible, they can be removed from the game and nothing will change. Nothing note worthy about any of them. You can try and talk to them but mostly all of them will either have only one line, cough at you, just a "hmm", or nothing at all. 

In conclusion, save your $70 its not worth it at all. They ask for more but deliver less, I wouldn't be surprise if most of these positive reviews are payed for.
Refund. I'll buy it again if they add in matchmaking.
no horror, no humor, no challenge

So, i didnt listen to the bad publicity this game received at launch. I thought it was just the masses hopping on the band wagon following the horrible gameplay footage that IGN released before launch on IGN first.

Let me tell you how wrong I was.
first all, my specs, i am running with a RTX 3080 with 8gb vram, a 12900K I9 processor on a Z690 Hero board with 32GB of ram. its a fairly beefy system and even still i was getting frame drops and stuttering, for the majority of my play time it did run... okay, but the stuttering was just to noticeable during gunfights and just seemed to take what little enjoyment there was out of it. i did run the game on epic, high and mid quality, which seemed to affect the framerate very little.

during my hour of playing, there were many many graphical issues and bugs, the game itself is definitely last gen as far as graphics go, even deathloop looked better than this. the shadows were very.... wavy for some reason, very pixelated. lots of light/shadow flashing for anything further than 20ft. the shutters on the houses would sputter in and out of existence and would only fully render if you were 5ft from them. 

enemy and friendly ai was absolutely horrible. played the game on hard and not once did i ever feel challenged. hard on this feels like easy on any other fps or rpg. i would literally just walk up to enemies without taking damage and kill them, their pathing is abysmal to the point i had an enemy walking backwards to me. enemies barely shoot and when they do, their accuracy is laughable leaving no challenge whatsoever. i had enemies spawn inside bushes, or halfway through flooring, and not once did i actually take damage from an actual vampire.... ya know... the thing thats supposed to be a threat. actually, the only time i died in this game was due to a car exploding with no prior warning. no sound to give it away, no visual effects (although that may have been yet another visual bug), just... bam.

gun sounds seem to all be the same within each class, as in all handguns sound the same, all shotguns sound the same, etc etc. player model seemed to also do some weird things, while holding shotguns i would have the left arm go up waaaay to high for some reason, and during recoil from shooting, it would almost seem like my head/view would be where my chest is and my arms were above my head. .

overall, what did it for me though was the boredom. running through the world felt more like walking through a ghost town than anything else. most of the houses you cant go into, and the ones you can all seemed to require lockpicking or special items to enter. vehicles would be randomly about the place, but again, most of them were non searchable. but most notably... no enemies. enemies seemed to be very few and far in between, to the point that i was actively having to search for enemies. most of the time when you did find them, they would be in groups of 2-5 and sometimes have a vampire with them. when you did find them though, it would seem that the game is set to just keep spawning them in off screen. at one point i was doing laps around a house, and every time i got to the other side of the house, more enemies would spawn on the opposite end and it became an infinite loot spot. other times while searching around, i would hear enemies and see it pop up in the subtitles, but when you look around, there would be no enemies in sight, almost as if they were spawn or glitched in an unreachable area, like under the map or in an object.

so. poorly optimised, poor ai, graphical bugs and issues, player and enemy model issues, and..... empty and boring.

It's basically FarCry with Vampires, although I find this more enjoyable then FC6. yes, it has issues, I won't deny that... But I'm enjoying this game, not a lot of options out there for Vampire games. just hoping for some fixes, QOL updates and hopefully future story DLC. Gun play does feel really nice, Story is actually decent. I'm playing as Jacob and I feel like his scouting ability just doesn't work properly.. there will be enemies around, but the crow doesn't detect them. Hopefully this will be patched soon. 

UPDATE: seeing a lot of people with 5 hour or less saying this game should be $30.00 and that it lacks content. I'll have to disagree with that, After the Hollow Man, the game opens up to an even bigger map with more vampire gods to hunt down and sidequest's. There's plenty of content in this game, still enjoying it.

Bethesda lives down to its reputation.
(1) We "pre-loaded" the game over the weekend so we'd be ready to play on Monday. Nope. We all had to re-download all 77 GB. So... what was the point of giving us the opportunity to pre-load?
(2) My version crashed when I first ran it, then crashed again when I tried to use the Steam overlay to join my friends. All of us have had at least one crash in under 2 hours of play.
(3) My version skipped the 5-minute intro scene, which is minor, but I *like* watching cut scenes so I was disappointed having to sit there in the ferry waiting for my friends to finish the scene.
(4) We finally managed to get to the fire station, at which point the game completely bugged out. There were no enemies, we couldn't interact with anything, and the quest line started progressing as we walked through rooms. "Defeat the cultists?" Check, without firing a shot. "Rescue the captives?" Success! Even though we never saw them. We quit out for the night.
(5) Today my friends tried to start up again with new characters. Nope. The game remembers everything you picked up as your old character, so they couldn't even get off the ferry because all the guns had already been looted.

Long story short, between the four of us we've had six crashes, had to restart the campaign three times, haven't managed to even make it to the fire station with the game working, and haven't managed to go 5 minutes without some interactable object being bugged out.

Dare I say this launch is WORSE than Fallout 76?

==================
UPDATE AFTER FINDING WORKAROUNDS FOR THE BUGS:
(1) To play multiplayer at all, we learned that you need to use the fastest machine in the group. Otherwise if the fast machine loads before the host, the game bugs out and you can't play. Once you've worked that out, it's buggy but playable. It still crashes every time I launch it for the first time (so it's start it, quit it from Steam, start it again), and one of our other players had such a catastrophic crash he had to unplug his computer.  So we have it "mostly functional", but the machine speed bugs, saved game bugs (see below), and nightly crashes make the game painful and frustrating.

(2) Unfortunately, even without the bugs, the saved game system is still hosed. I expect any modern game to allow me to have multiple saved characters and campaigns, and to be able to save wherever I happen to be with minor exceptions. In Redfall, if you quit in the middle of a mission you lose all your progress on that mission. That's unforgivably bad programming. Also, even though you're supposed to be able to play multiple characters, it seems to store all the campaign progress in a single file so you can't host two campaigns on a single machine.
Which, combined with the, "This only works if the person with the fastest machine is the host," puts you in a situation where you simply can't have multiple campaigns going at once. Inexcusable.

(3) Once you overcome all the bugs, you get to the actual gameplay, which is pretty meh. You have a handful of gun types to choose from, a Borderlands-style gun selection menu, and otherwise extremely basic movement, abilities, and skill-ups. Nothing surprising nor exciting. 
The fights are easy, the missions are routine, and it's a fairly boring paint-by-numbers first person shooter horror game. Even Back 4 Blood has a more interesting plot and more interesting NPCs.
In short, the game has nothing I haven't seen before, even in single games, it does its stuff poorly, and it's WAAAAAAAY too easy for its target audience.

[b] TL;DR: Everything you have come to expect from an Arkane Studios production is NOT in this game, and it is also riddled with bugs and poor AI. DO NOT BUY AT FULL PRICE.  [/b]

This game is a big disappointment, especially coming from my favorite game studio of all time. Knowing Arkane, I came into Redfall expecting a decent attempt at creating an immersive sim experience in a small open world map--a distinct atmosphere and mood, memorable characters and dialogue, lots of different types of interactions with the environment, environmental storytelling, and lots of nooks and crannies to explore and discover.

I got...none of that.

The world and characters are lifeless. There are ways to make even a modern setting ooze atmosphere, especially if it's a small coastal town overrun by vampires, and random blood splatters and poisonous red clouds obstructing my path aren't it. The vampire nests are cool, and so was the dollhouse mission--why isn't there more of that in the open world? Why do I have to specifically accept missions from safehouses to find NPCs and defeat certain enemies instead of just encountering them organically in the world? Why do all the NPCs in the fire station hub just say "Hmmm" or cough every time I try to talk to them? Why do the playable characters cycle through the same 3 sets of lines when one of them uses an ability? Why do the common enemies act like mindless zombies instead of real people with emotions and desires? Why aren't audio logs a source of lore in a co-op game where people tend to not wait around for you to read notes and books every 5 minutes? 

The combat is also bland. Enemy encounters are few and far in between, and not much thought has been put into their placements--they're just wherever, hanging out, not really interacting with the environment. The AI also sucks--multiple times I would have enemies stand completely still or shooting at the sky while I unload clips into them, or be unable to hit me because I'm slowly walking backwards. There is no room for creative kills like in every other modern Arkane game because the playable characters have tiny kits designed to work alongside the others, which sucks if you're playing solo or even duo. There is also no incentive for stealth since the "hardest" difficulty of the game is still laughably easy thanks to the shitty enemy AI.

There are also numerous other bugs plaguing the game--UI elements not displaying correctly, keybinds disabling themselves, items and notes unable to be interacted with if another player touches them first.

I plan on finishing the game, but I don't think it gets any better from here. Please just make Dishonored 3 or Prey 2 next time. Thank you.
I requested a refund. It is incredibly disappointing that my favourite studio, Arkane, would release this pile of sh*t.

Hard to believe the same developers that made some of my favorite games (Dishonored 1&2, as well as Prey 2017) are responsible for this absolute garbage. I will probably play through because I spent the money already but damn this is F tier right now. Story is dull, nothing I do feels worthwhile... not to mention the world is 90% empty, and all of the AI run around like they have 3 sets of their 21st chromosome!

Shaking my head right now in disappointment.
Massive L

I haven't put much time into the game at the time of this review, but I feel I can leave fairly comprehensive take on it. I won't comment on the bugs and glitches, there are plenty of reviews on here covering that already. Yes I ran into some bugs, only one major one that prevented me from completing a quest. I don't think the game is as bad as most of the reviews are making it out to be. Don't get me wrong though, the game does needs a lot of work. The best way I can describe this game is its like Outbreak from Call of Duty Cold War. A semi open world where you gun down enemies and grab all the loot you can. The missions and side quests are pretty rinse and repeat - basically kill everything and grab everything you can. The map doesn't seem very large. There's quick travel points you unlock by opening safe houses. And, the main hub (so to speak) is a fire station that you rescue at the very beginning. Beyond that the world seems very empty and bland. There's a skill tree of upgrades for your character, which seems tailored to the character you select at the start of the game - pretty standard upgrade system, nothing new or special. Tons of weapons to find which have the typical damage progression based on rarity/class/special color. Those weapons however seem very bland as well. Shooting the weapons is boring, there's no character to any of the weapons. What I mean is it feels like you aren't shooting a "real" gun, as there is no kick or any simulated realness to the guns. They behave like a child's toy. All the enemies are pretty much rinse and repeat - as is the loot you find. This game isn't worth the $69.99 price tag in it's current state. I'm going to give the game a thumbs up only because I got the game for free and it isn't as bad as I was expecting. I'd suggest waiting for a sale or until they fix the bugs and hopefully add more content.

It's depressing. I really see the potential for such a good co-op shooter in here, but it's bogged down with so many technical issues and unpolished elements. The characters are unique, the atmosphere is good, the controls are smooth (when not getting tagged with visual lag and screen shredding) and I love the city and map design, but the game itself feels like it was taken out of the oven before it had finished cooking. I put the blame on Bethesda for that one. This should have had another 6 months of fixing up and polishing before release, especially given the $70 price tag. This game could have been so much better than what we all got.

May be worth it at a much cheaper price, and/or after the devs get the time to iron out all the technical issues and patch it up to be visually playable. A shame really. I was looking forward to this one for a while as I really want a good, new non-Borderlands co-op shooter.

Apparently a 4080 isn't good enough to run the game maxed out and will subsequently run out of VRAM after 15minutes and crash your entire operating system in the process, and since the game doesnt save you're pretty much rolled back to the womb and have to learn to walk again, go to pre-school, etc, before catching up to the progress you lost.

Probably for the best as the game looks and plays terrible. Even on "Epic" the game looks like a mild improvement of Dishonoured, but only if you ignore the enemies that T-pose and float around the place while the textures shimmer like a Pokemon episode trying to induce a seizure. You can't even tailor the graphic options to your specific setup to alleviate any hiccups since the custom options are so bare bones (aka, can't mess with lighting, textures, etc). The accessibility options are great if you're colourblind or hard of hearing so people playing with their Labrador and Ray Charles glasses can rejoice.

The gun-play is not satisfying and the abilities are weak. AI is dumb, and enemies are spongy on the hardest difficulty. The special encounters aren't even hard as long as you have knowledge of the strafe key existing.

Maybe the downsides of the game are less noticeable in a 4 player party, but overall it still feels like a euro-jank asset flip that arrived 10 years too late.

Enemy health scales way faster than your weapon damage, so expect each fight to become longer and more irritating the higher your level is. Also, for me, the game completely couldn‚Äôt get consistent framerate, making aiming at agile enemies as painful as chewing on nails.

To add insult after killing the main boss of the map, the game announces that you have 2 more maps to explore but doesn‚Äôt introduce new enemies or new mechanics - just more boring errands. You really stop getting new content and variety from gameplay about 3 hours into the game. From there everything repeats and feeling of novelty disappears. Even new maps consist of reused assets and buildings.

Stay away from this even if you get it for free.

I bought the upgraded version. I was expecting a fun game to play with friends but after a few missions, the bosses are way too easy even on max difficulty. With the enemies being way too easy, my need of using my abilities is so far and few in between. Loot is not even special since it's super easy to get really good weapons of higher rarity, since is medkits. This game was super easy mode.

Oh it's not a Bethesda game without all the bugs. Can't always pick up loot, can't use friend's teleport, can't open certain bags, etc. Just so much that could've been fixed early if, you know, the game was properly tested.

All the bad reviews made me a little nervous but the game has been really fun. Had a little bit of lag for a few seconds at one point but that's the only thing so far. It's probably not really worth $70 though but not many games are these days. I'm excited to get back on and play more.

This is a negative review but labeled positive in support for the Arkane Austin staff, I am also going to give this game a second chance in support. 

I've rewritten this review 3 times, my first about 2 days after game release, positive, I actually genuinely enjoyed my first few hours of my experience in Redfall, but admittedly, it was largely because I like the art style and I love are dearly departed Arkane Austin. Then when I quickly fell out of love and received a "jester" because liking the game made me a clown, but at that time I had already began quickly seeing the massive flaws. A game that could of been great, I actually believe that, call it cope, but with time and care, I liked this setting and I really think with smart AI and more content, an offline mode, this could of been special. However, it was a beautiful looking train wreck.

If you have ever played an Arkane game, you know the cut-scenes and layered lore is the absolute best in class, but this game betrayed that. From all their intricate and fascinating animated cut-scenes, we received nothing of the sort. I remember how great the looking glass stuff was in Prey, but no, this game got weird slideshow cardiovascular ghosts and important chapter openings were not much better with characters moved in slideshow. The beginning of this games opening animated and hand drawn slide show of happenings was beautiful, fascinating and pulled me in, and if the rest of the game copied its style in slides, it would of been magical, but it did not.

Not only did the lack of animation for story negatively effect my experience, but also the side quests. I actually liked the safe house to gather quests business, but the lack of side quests, and things I'd call environmental quests was a real let down. There are close to no, if maybe actually no side quests that you just find in the "wild" of Redfall. No survivors hunkered down in houses hiding from zealots and vampires, lots of lore indicating they exist and also, while matching the circumstance with its eeriness, the lack of animals at all, like crows, cats, dogs, etc makes the world boring. There are no allied resistance fighters on the streets, no scavengers creeping along to find food or supplies, just a lonely venture between quests, and not enough quests to keep playing.

There also comes a time in the middle of the game when you leave the first area for the second, but you cannot return to the area before. This is a mistake, it severely limited the playtime, story opportunities and hampered the looter shooter style that was happening. A lot of the best gameplay is in the first half of the game because the town was more interesting, more to do. even if it was a smaller area. 

In my opinion, controls were fine, gunplay was fine, the enemies were in fact braindead as many report but that was also untrue. For anyone who played Deathloop, these braindead AI are familiar. The beginning of the game they might as well be bottle fed toddlers with guns, but at later game(higher levels of character, not campaign), they become single shot killing machines, but both versions of them are still a bit slow in the head and can't seem to navigate. 

There is also a massive issue with how player character kits are made. Some are just better, I play Jacob when I play this, but his kit in my opinion is the absolute worst, especially in single player, the mode I play because I cannot get another soul to play multiplayer with me. He has excellent scouting abilities, cool, that means he must be great for solo right? No, invisibility and a crow reminisce of Bloodwing are alright, but every character has a mobility skill, he does not. His cool alt, basically useless late game, can't even kill most mid tier or high tier vampires with it at a certain point. Ghost sniper rifle is a cool idea but as a scout sniper that can't take high ground without sneaking through an enemy layer or requiring another player with a mobility skill to help, it sucks. Each character feels like they are missing a part of their kit, which yes, help with cooperative play, but as a single player capable game, it hurts the experience, gets rid of opportunities, becomes a headache often.

The world has an awesome art style in my opinion, this is an unpopular opinion I have discerned, I love it, but, and this is a big "but," enemy designs, vampires in particular are repetitive, same 2 or 3 for the normals, and what I believe is 1 design for every other category of higher tier vampire. This is a short complaint but one that really bugs me.

Vampires are both way to weak and too powerful. I too often when I played this game would run into that health leech vamp, or the darkness one, and would get insta-killed because whoever designed the menaces, made them very bad for single, but yet in multiplayer, and or playing as anyone but Jacob, they die super easy sometimes. Rook vampire is in the same boat, having total aggro from them is a pain and often I have to take advantage of the AI stupidity and stand on a truck.

Recurring events with the dungeons/nests/hives are really cool, but I gave up on them really early, takes a lot of ammo, health, time and they spawn way too fast. They become an annoyance more than a fun activity eventually, actually very quickly, the rewards are okay, but not great and the repetitive structure is annoying too. Cool mechanic that needed heavy tweaking. 

Even after all my heavy criticisms I still hold the unpopular belief that this game with some good TLC, offline mode, some good work put in, that this game could be great, or at least better. I had misguided faith in the promise to fix this game and we are now in a place where it has been abandoned, promises have been broken, and a great studio destroyed. At the very least they should of at least kept to the commitment of offline mode, but they did not. Even if it was and is a waste of resources to fix and save this game, I am still disappointed that a promise is broken, I personally think that everyone should get a full refund and keep the game at this point. DRM should be removed, mod tools released, the whole 9 yards. Microsoft caused this game to be a failure, not Arkane, Microsoft is responsible, not Arkane, and Microsoft has destroyed great studios. Redfall was a failure, but Arkane Austin is already missed, bridges have been burned with Microsoft Games. With the possible future of adds on Windows, I hope that the Steam branch of Linux is sooner than later so that I may abandon Microsoft as much as one can in this info technology age. 

I have rambled too long now, I am bored on a Monday waiting on an appointment, I am tired and disappointed, bitter and perhaps even resentful. Goodbye Arkane Austin, your legacy was not this, it was Dishonored, it was Prey, even Deathloop even if I did not enjoy that one, Redfall is part of it all, but it should not be the only memory of something great. Thankyou for years of entertainment, my favorite games of all time and fond memories. Goodbye Arkane.

[h1]I'm dissapointed.[/h1] 

[b]It's first Arkane game, which I don't enjoy and can't recommend.[/b] 
All, usually present, immersive sims elements aren't present (I know, it's not meant to be an immersive sim, but c'mon, can't throw a bottle to distract enemies, or take them silently from behind?) and, since it's Arkane game I was hoping to at least be able to kill enemies in some creative ways (Deathloop/Prey and Prey: Mooncrash? Not even mentioning Dishonored.).

I started the game as Dav (I forgot his full name). The guy who's a 'paranormal things reporter'. Anyway, in the starting sections I found some locked doors‚Äîsome needed a lockpick, some needed a key, so I thought I'll explore the ship a bit. 
Found some meaningless notes scattered on the ground. Also, [i]ino 0451 safe/container found[/i], and believe me, I searched pretty thoroughly, both the ship, and both ways to the first quest mark where you get back to Redfall.

[h1]Performance, optimization and general eye candy stuff.[/h1]

The game has those micro-stutters every now and then, but I thought it's Unreal Engine loading shaders. I've got RTX 3080, Ryzen 9 5900x, 32GBs of RAM, and M.2 NVMe SSD, so the game started in 4k, with Epic settings loadout. I toned it down a bit, because those stutters were annoying. Reduced the resolution to 1080p and to High settings, with some DLSS on. The stutters were still present. BTW even on Epic the graphics wasn't epic in any way honestly. I think, it looks worse that Deathloop on similar settings. [u]And Deathloop runs much smoother.[/u]

[h1]The price tag.[/h1]

The price for the base game is some kind of late April's Fools joke.
Also, not mentioning the Deluxe edition price. I could spend that money on a food for a month, or a bootle of some really good whisky.

Usually, I don't write this kind of reviews. I expected more from Arkane. I know it's probably Bethesda pressure to release the game, though I might be wrong here and Arkane Austin just tried to [i]bite[/i] more than they can chew and they spit it out releasing this mess of a game.

[h1]tl;dr[/h1]

Disappointing and over-priced. Wouldn't suggest buying it (maybe in a year on a -75% sale), unless you don't have anything better to do with your money and you are Arkane fan.
[u]I'll be refunding the game.[/u]

Arkane Studios has (had) a carte blanche from me since I played Dishonored 1. Dishonored 2 is in my Top 10 most played games of all time. I liked Prey and defended Deathloop no matter how much the latter was flamed. So after playing for as long as possible (just below the magical 2 hour mark) my sad conclusion is:

[b]Redfall is overpriced and not very good. It's basically Phasmaphobia with guns and cookie-cutter AI. There's no real passion or effort here. There aren't even animated cutscenes.[/b]

The animations, sound and feel of the guns remind me of a mid-2000s game. The visual design might be interesting but the weapons feel like toys. The human enemies are brain dead, with stormtrooper-level aim and non-existent tactics. The vampires, who were meant to be a real menace, aren't any better. They simply charge at you like a maniac and mainly differ from the humans in that they require a button prompt to be finally eliminated. This could have been a great opportunity to mix the combat up by making the vampires immune to some weapons and vulnerable to others, but no. Just pick any ol' rifle, keep shooting until they start glowing red and Bob's yer uncle. I unknowingly defeated a boss vampire by myself with tier 1 weapons without much issue, so there's that. There are no stealth kills BTW, but it's not like you'd need them anyway.

There might be story in there somewhere but it felt like I missed a bunch of cutscenes because I had a hard time keeping track of who each character is, what his/her motivations are and why my character even bothers to interact with them. The game just starts throwing people at you, forces you to talk to each of them in a very specific and precise order (!!!) and sends you on your way to retrieve stuff and "liberate safe houses". I never met anybody non-hostile outside of these houses so I never understood what the point of them is story-wise. It's not like any survivors started moving in after I cleared them either.

Overall, there's not a crumble of the Arkane magic of past games in Redfall. Despite playing less than 2 hours, I feel like I've already seen it all. 
Big thanks to Steam for letting me refund the game.

Edit: Thank you Arkane for pushing out the awesome final update. Offline mode will ensure this game will be able to be played forever!

I have personally been enjoying my time playing Redfall Solo. The graphics can be just beautiful at times and the audio design is amazing and immersive. I own every Arkane game. 

I've pre-ordered every Arkane game since Dishonored. 

I have over 100 hours on Deathloop. 

I didn't do a $1 GamePass deal because I wanted to "support Arkane". 

I pre-ordered the Bite Back edition of this game via a third party key reseller so I could save AUS$25 off the AUS$165 recommended retail price, which unfortunately means I've waived my rights to a refund, while also incentivising predatory pricing behaviours. I won't be making that mistake again.  

I'll be continuing to play the game as I am currently undertaking university studies in game development, and this game makes for an interesting case study in the failures of modern AAA game development, like, who's fault is this game? Microsoft? Bethesda? Arkane? "The Player"?

For those of you reading this who are not Arkane fanboys or aspiring game developers, the game in its' current state is not something most people would want to play even if it was free. It's a run-and-gun game where the running and gunning is less fun than hundreds of other run-and-gun games. I've experienced more technical issues at launch than I did with Cyberpunk 2077 even though I'm running Windows 11 / Intel i9-13900K / Nvidia 4090 / Samsung 990 Pro / 64GB DDR5. 

I guess keep an eye out for whether the game will be fixed ala No Man's Sky, or promptly forgotten like that other GamePass gem Crackdown 3.

[b]Vampire[/b] is a great theme for this game, very appropriate for the very apparent [b]rush to market[/b] for Bethesda (along with with other triple-A sh*tshows this year). 

[h1]List of Problems: [/h1]
[list]
    [*]Very clearly unoptimized. What the hell is going on here with the technical side of this game? Gone on the cheap? No help available from Epic, Nvidia or AMD?
    [*]Studdering, artifacts, shader compling prompt when it is not happening (thanks for wasting our time).
    [*]Ghost vampires you cannot kill.
    [*]Clipping issues for enemies and your character.
    [*]The gameplay is bland and generic. You've played it before in every Arkane game... nothing new here.
    [*]Game design... where to start. It was clear every recent game this pulls from or mimics, many of which are old formulas, been done, filler, or just phoned it in. Explore, loot, explore, loot.... disposable areas, keep moving, nothing memorable to see here or meaningful to return to.
    [*]Whats with the concept art movies and still shot stories? More phoning it in, rushed work?
    [*]One trick pony enemies. No depth and when it does start to escalate, using gimmicks (shields? really?). Braindead human enemies and vamps that jump around you and claw 'near' you while clearly losing focus on you.
[/list]

This is just a handful of hours into singleplayer. 

Now, that all said there is [b]some[/b] good here and lots of potential.

[h1]List of what they got right: [/h1]
[list]
    [*]Art direction. Congrats to the artists and level designers on creating a convincing environment (minus the glitches and technical issues). Seems like the team studied Cedric Peyravernay and Sergey Kolesov's work to generate an evolution of what we'd expect from Arkane. It is submersive and delivers.
    [*]Audio. Creepy goodness, although off at times for placement. 
    [*]Animation. Convincing and well done.
    [*]Story elements are good and start to hook.
[/list]

[h1]Summary: [/h1]

[u] Like most celebrities that are over-sold to only crash and burn, [b]needs rehab badly[/b].[/u]

There is some potential and great immersion (when not glitching, studdering or having technical issues). 

BUT THAT DOES NOT MAKE A GREAT GAME. I REPEAT... SHINY IDEAS DO NOT MAKE A GAME. [b]Execution and delivery on those ideas do.[/b] This is not the game I was told it was and what I was sold for $100, Arkane Austin and Bethesda. FIX IT. Make good on your promises like CD Project and Hello Games did. Prove everyone wrong. Handle your sh*t. I will gladly come back and modify my review to be positive. 

If not, this will be a sad parting of ways since I was a huge fan of Arkane (along with MachineGames). If I can't trust your brands, will stop buying them....

But this is effectively a Early Access state for $70-$100.... which really is a big FU to us customers from the leaders at Arkane Austin and Bethesda.

For any system performance proclamations:
[i]ACER Predator Orion 7000 = i7-12700K, WIN 11 64bit, 32GB RAM, Geforce 3080 RTX, Samsung SSD 860 2TB, latest Nvidia drivers.[/i]

[hr][/hr]

[h1]UPDATE: After Completing the Game On Regular Mode At 39 Hours...[/h1]

The recipe is apparent, add to blender: equal parts Left4Dead, Borderlands, State of Decay, Far Cry, Dying Light, Generation Zero, Resident Evil, some Max Payne and Stranger Things story (the most obvious core being Salem's Lot) plucking with Fortnite Characters and obliviate on high. This emulates many of your favorite co-op games, some it straight up copies and yet misses entirely and fails. Anything less that 15-20 hours is not going to be an accurate assessment of the game, so good luck getting a refund after 2 hours. 

If you are an explorer and story person, this is going to be a long and painful ride down a slide of barbed wire and rubbing alcohol... I spent 29 more hours doing my damnedest to take in everything. The storyboard or pitch art theme is ugly, still comes across lazy; as do the nervous system ghosts in echos. Was that a money saver on animation and further art? Just recycled the concept work?

[b]4GB hotfix release?[/b] 3 things fixed... what are you slipping me the next DLC? Nothing in the release notes justifies a huge update. I saw no changes this week with 10 more hours of playing with it.

I was going to add 30 other problems/discoveries, but it doesn't fit and after seeing the drama coming to light at the associated companies, I doubt it matters. So I will wrap with my summary.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Overall Summary: This thing really is a mess. So [b]disappointed[/b], especially with the potential and Arkane's DNA.[/h1]

I'll leave you with prophetic quote directly from the game:

[b][i]"It'll turn into a sh*tshow if we don't produce something that lasts."[/i][/b]


[h1]Additional Update:[/h1]

They are now giving credit for the undelivered DLC:

https://help.bethesda.net/#en/answer/65606

Will see if I ever purchase an Arkane or Bethesda product after this... definitely burned me on pre-order and DLC.

-Did the Devs accidentally launch an Alpha on live servers? 
-There is no way that this game is ready for launch, or worth 70 euro. It is EXTREMELY lazy. Did a junior dev click the wrong button and put the sandbox build on live servers?

-Not one cinematic that is not a Powerpoint presentation

I went in positive, really looking forward to this game for a long time to play with my bro, sadly, despite all of the bad reviews, I tried it and I am left feeling like I was ripped off. I dislike fueling any negative hype trains, however there are way to many to mention poor or lazy game design choices which are already mentioned in multiple reviews. The game is just empty and uninspired. The gameplay and AI is just the biggest let down since cyberpunk. Enemies are so incredibly stupid and offer no challenge, even on higher difficulty, the pathing and AI awareness is beyond stupid. The world feels empty and just dead due to the lack of any real AI pathing or interesting encounters. In a sense it reminds me of the division before the bounty system where there is an awesome open world that is just dead. I'm kinda sad about this one. It had potential. A vampire story by Arkane?, I was all in.
Unfortunately, the multiplayer element is way too strong on this one just to be able to actually enjoy it as a single player game as advertised by the publisher.

Most of the stuff you might expect from Arkane is there, multiple entrances to an objective, locks to pick, lore. But it all feels off.
Everything has been simplified in name of multiplayer just to keep things going constantly, which ends up feeling uninspired for a single player experience.
Even the movement feels off (sprinting is just straight up broken).
Cinematics have been reduced to a bunch of still images with some narration over them.
It also suffers from some horrible performance issues on pc, even when meeting the maximum requiriments.
Most likely will be revised in the upcoming updates since most of Arkane games released with poor performance on pc, so hopefully people who enjoy the game will get their moneys worth.

It's sad because its not a bad game, but its not good either.

[h1]Save your self ¬£60/$70 ... for now[/h1]

[i]TL;DR[/i]
I soooo wanted to love this game, the trailers, the hype, the previews all looked amazing but in it's current state I'm struggling to recommend anyone who has this on XBox Game pass let alone pay ¬£60/$70 for it.

I put in a few hours (approx. 12hrs at time of writting this) in the hope that it would somehow change my mind but sadily it's just not ready. Improvements required so far are centered around AI/Performance/Co-op/Graphics so pretty much the core of the game ... not sure how long it will take to sort this out but my fingers shall remain crossed.

[i]Starting with the positives:[/i]
[list]
[*] It's a [b]lot of fun[/b] running around looking for trouble and shiny new weapons when solo but once co-op was working it was so much more fun ... YOLO!!!
[*] [b]Performance[/b] was okay but I am running a 4090 (IKR) @ 3440x1440 with the occasional stutter didn't impede the play through to much
[*] Skills are fantastic and so much fun, especially when combined with skills from other players in co-op
[*] Weapons are great with some decent looks and mahooosive damage (eventually)
[*] The map and ability to jump around is pretty good, especially as you can port when out in the middle no where with no ammo and instantly fill ya boots...
[*] Character customisation and outfits is pretty good and offers enough flexibility (once you unlock stuff) to provide that unique vampire hunter look you want
[*] Co-op on steam with steam friends only is pretty easy to get going
[*] The menu system is pretty intuitive [i](grasping now)[/i]
[*] Short enough missions without the whole go here and fetch, then go there and fetch then go here and find x but instead go here and kill, go there and kill :D [i](grasping again)[/i]
[*] 12hrs with 2 deaths [i](yeah I'm gonna stop grasping now)[/i]
[/list]


[i]Now for the negatives ....[/i]
[list]
[*] ¬£60/$70 for a clearly unfinished game :'(
[*] Visually it's "okay", not stunning but okay
[*] The level of clipping/dsync etc. in this game is just plain annoying as hell... when vamps get stuck in a wall and you can't stake them fine but when a boss does it and you can't get the skull/loot then it's just infuriating
[*] AI is just predictable ... boom headshot ... wait 1 second ... boom headshot as the next NPC walks into your sight and repeat for X
[*] AI is pretty sparse, the world feels a bit too empty even given the storyline being portrayed
[*] Abundance of food/drink but no idea if it does anything or not
[*] There are 1 or 2 really nice textures in the game but overall it generally feels pretty dated when wandering around the open world, most of the detail has been put into the restricted number of buildings that you can enter
[*] Crossplay co-op is janking as hell and didn't work between steam and xbox on PC
[*] Co-Op cannot be started if you're in a game and additional players can only be added by returning to the main menu/lobby and re-inviting everyone again ... plenty of scope here for improvement
[*] [spoiler]The nest heart areas feel like they should be mini dungeons/raids to be carried out with a group of 4 but soloing these is about the only challenge there is in the game[/spoiler]
[/list]

[i]To summarise[/i]
DO NOT PAY ¬£60/$70 for this game ... you will be disappointed (unless you have a 4090 beast and the cash to burn)
Wait for a few patches to come out and see what improvements are made i.e. perf/graphics/ai/co-op
Get it on sale or on a console (friends having way less issues on console)
Its actually pretty fun

Coming from a Bethesda fanboy:

Would've been a good game for a $39.99 price tag. With $70 AA/AAA games becoming the new standard, studios should be doing their best to justify this already hard to swallow pill, but this game is definitely not worth $70 in my opinion.

- The environment is genuinely cool looking. The colors, style, and overall look of the town of redfall feel good to walk around during the day or during the night. A lot of the houses can be entered and there's plenty of clutter to make them feel lived in, and like the inhabitants really did leave on the spot to evacuate the city. 

- The concept is unique and has a lot of potential if the gameplay is tweaked (tweaked might be an understatement) a lot. Is this a contender for a competitor to Destiny 2 or borderlands? Absolutely not. But it could've been.

- Gameplay is okay. As others have said, the AI is pretty bad (I'm playing the game on the hardest mode available in the first playthrough). Not so bad that you're shooting at target dummies, but not far enough away from that than is acceptable. It's still worth it to approach big gun fights with some tactics like setting up abilities, sending in your "tank" friend first, sniping from distance, dedicating someone to deal with the vampires, etc. but the fact that you can run in with a shotgun and mindlessly blast away to deal with most confrontations makes it feel like there should definitely be some smarter AI. Especially from a reputable game studio and a reputable publisher. There also needs to be a lot more diversity in enemies. There's only two factions (the corporate mercs and the cultists) with the only discernible difference being cultists have vampires with them and the mercs have turrets. Other than that, it's basically copy/paste of the same soldier unit but with different guns. It gets old quick having only these enemies to shoot at. The vampire dens were also a missed target in my opinion. They're a little enjoyable, but they should've been a huge staple of vampire shoot-em-up loot heavy events.

- The character options and abilities are a little limited, but still unique and fun for the most part. This game avoids just giving everyone nuke abilities in favor of more utility based abilities which I appreciate. The characters are each unique and have their own narration and backstories woven into the storyline of the game which is a good move. The skill trees feel very limited and need to be expanded in my opinion, along with having a few non character exclusive trees for different gun styles and play styles. 

- The loot system is okay. GOOD loot is found often enough to keep me engaged and make me feel rewarded for activities, but sparse enough that it still is exciting to get a gold tier weapon whenever I find one. The weapon diversity is well done in my opinion as well. There's plenty of options in most of the gun styles (vampire specific weapons like the UV light and stake launcher are super limited though) with the cool and fun design of the guns being their strongest suit. The gold tier weapons do need unique abilities or mechanics though, there's not quite enough to make them feel like they shouldn't just be slightly stronger purple tier weapons.

- Questing in this game needs work. Finding hideouts and doing the hideout missions is pretty fun. Most everything else feels kind of generic in my opinion. It's also kind of hard to be invested in the quests when the story is told in slideshow format and it's not very theatrical doing it that way. I've already forgotten most of the story and I genuinely try to pay attention. The NPCs you do quests for are also super forgettable and lacking character. They need to re-do the NPCs and exposition of this game entirely.

- The map size seems really small. I'm only a few hours in and I've already covered half the map.. And not to say that the map size should be the only factor, but the lack of fun and rewarding random events/global events/etc. means that once you clear an area then you've exhausted the game play for that area apart from going and killing the respawning enemies repeatedly. 

All in all, not as bad a game as a lot of people are saying, but still well below the bar of what I was expecting from both Arkane and BGS. So much potential since the premise of the game is genuinely new, creative, and unique. Maybe with a few more months of content additions, bug fixing, and feature tweaking I can come back and change my review to recommended is what I hope.

We only played 2.5 hours with my two friends because one of the main campaigne is buggued and we cannot progress.
We went into this with an open mind, but all of us with 30 years of gaming behind us, so we're not some incel blue-balled unhappy in their mother's basement.

To get to the gist of it:
Redfall is not a good game. And this is not because of a game-breaking bug that prevent you from going forward. It is not a good game because it is bad and/or mediocre on all of the aspects that should make it enjoyable.

-The gunplay is horrendous. You will simply pick whatever gun do the most damage and frankly, there are not much difference between most of them. The gun which does the most damage will simply be the best. And some guns (handguns for example) dmg output is so terrible that you can stick with a shotgun 4 levels unders and it will still be 10 times better.
There is no complexity to the gunplay, you just shoot and jump around like you are in Duke Nukem 3D in 1996, and spam your abilities. Guns have no "weight", you just spam click.
Ammos is never an issue, unless you forget to loot the ammo box available in every streets/houses around.
The stealth option is laughable since by the time you stealth behind  a monster, you can have shot them down 10 times and went 200 meter further ahead.

-The difficulty is non-existent. We chose the hardest difficulty available at the start (3 out of 4) and at lvl 4, our mates completely soloed a miniboss mission while running around like a racoon on cocaine, while the 2 others were looting random stuff in the basement of a building.
You need to fall from a high rise to start taking fall dmg, and the IA is dumber than a rock.

-The AI is one of the worst. Monsters are dumb, forget you as soon as you're out of sight for a SECOND (Yes, a second), or they get stuck and stop moving just being hit by bullet doing nothing.

-The gameplay loop is terrible because 30 mins after starting you will be full of money, of medikits, of every lockpick/rewire items, and then you will salvage everything (manually one by one, of course) in your inventory, except the best guns you can find, which will not be often, even though you will find 10 guns per houses. And you will realize that you spent more time looking for items in houses than killing monsters.

-The story is not compelling because the atmosphere is frankly horrible. How can you be scared when you are literally  rolling over everything on sight? You're supposed to be scared, but you cannot.Which leads me to my next point....

-Redfall city is dead because even the deads are not there. Enemis cannot be seen for half a kilometer, then you enter  amission point, there are 3 vampires, then further 3 cultists, then further 2 vampires, then nothing for 5 to 10 minutes. 

All of that leads me to a single conclusion:
Redfall is not a labor of love. This is not a good game. This is a game which was released at the very least 1 to 2 years earlier than it should have, and probably because they wanted to sell the hell out of it as a Game as a Service and sell DLCs. The game systems are not good. This is not polished, this game was released 2 years earlier, and thus is probably going to be a stillborn. If you do buy it, make sure you play less than 2 hours and make yourself an idea of it quick, because this is not the type of game we as players want to encourage publishers to release in such a state.

This was such a disappointment. I was really looking forward to this but it is just as bad as everyone says. I normally would hold out for updates but I feel like this game is just fundamentally broken. 

World: A big empty world. More walking then fighting most of the time. Even if you do come across enemies the AI is so poor that more often than not your can just run through them. Even if they start firing they have the accuracy of a storm trooper so you shouldn't have any problems.

AI: Wow.... Just wow, I don't think this was sent through QA if it was then they need to fire the whole team b/c i don't understand how you could overlook this glaring issue. I have had vampires (Super loud angsty vamps that you don't have to see to know they are around) just not move at all on approach. If i spun around them I could keep the question mark above their head and by the time they reacted they where dead. 

Difficulty: I enjoy a challenge. I play a lot of games now adays on the hard difficulty setting. With that being said this hardest unlocked difficulty setting they offers is amazingly easy. I moved it down to normal thinking that maybe i had set it to an easier setting but nope. Honestly did not feel like the difficulty even changed.

Graphics: It really should look better then this. The tree leaves really bothered me since they looked very low res. Lots of pop-in, strange renders and my character looked as though he was run through a beauty filter. Stuttering/ Frame drops.... just so much and it was not even using that much CPU or GPU utilization.

Cost: 70$.... for this much a game should release in a better state (like actually working and complete). I wish I had an answer on how we as gamers could fix this issue but there isn't one that you could get everyone on board with.  

Gunplay: I did not mind this as much as everyone else. I am not a super picky or hard to please person so I was happy with it. Although! enemies died way to quickly.

This game just is not worth it. I played Prey just before hopping in this game and it is truly hard to believe that this is the same studio.
Bland.

(Edit, 8 hours in)

100%ed first area, got to second area and it was just more of the same, literally copy pasted. I couldn't bring myself to keep going. Gg.

This game isn't what I'd expect from Arkane, I gave it a college try but alas, here we are.


Hi! Don't hate me,

Honestly, this game is really dang fun! Not played it for too long yet mark you, but the progression feels great and the gunplay (other than the lack of an ADS sensitivity slider which is OUCH) is pretty good!

Graphics are more than passable, beautiful at times, and the vampire AI is fun and engaging. The story just picked up in a really interesting way too that makes me wanna play more so YEAH!

FPS, solid 120, 1440p but I am on a 4090 and i9 13900k so I'm pretty sure I could run Nasa's space programs with that. 

Few cons though which drag it down, human AI is more A than I, (vamps make up for that thankfully but still bad), lack of ads sensitivity slider, lack of real threat in the overworld (something like dying light 1's nighttime fear would be amazing), enemies respawning immediately after dying, Weapon scaling is a bit weird? A golden level 4 rifle being worse than a plain old normal level 5 one is a bit wack to be fair. 

Other than that, I had a lot of fun, I'm looking forward to playing more, it's a fun game. It hasn't broken any barriers, it hasn't progressed the field, but it's FUN. Games don't need to break barriers. They just need to do what we want them to. Which is pass the time in a fun way.

Painful.  First game I have refunded.  Have been desperate for a new, semi-casual shooter... but this game plays, looks, and feels like something made by a college student making their first game.  Performance on PC is bad, cinematics are insultingly bad, ui seems have done.  I am very confused why they choose to charge more than like 20 dollars for this game as it will be harmful to the studio's rep at this price point.

TLDR:
I can't see that there was 70 bucks worth of development done on this game. I barely see 20 bucks worth of development at this point.   They need to go on a hardcore fixing spree and add something to make the game coherent in what it wants to be, because mediocre(when it works) is all it's managing right now.

This game has all the bones of a game that could be awesome, but these bones just aren't connected in any logical way. you can sneak, but being sneaky doesn't benefit you--every weapon is a gun and every nearby enemy gets alerted the second you shoot. the enemy AI is bad, it feels several generations behind.  The idea of vampire strongholds is great, they just don't affect the environment or enemies around them enough to feel different from anything else.
The classes don't distinguish themselves from each other enough to make the choice meaningful. The best tactic for everything is shoot enemies in the head as quickly as possible. There's no tangible benefit for any class being close or far away, there's no reason to apply any tactics as a group.

Bugs!
It seems enemies don't spawn properly. Scopes and reticles don't load properly, sliding gets you stuck in the ground. enemies get stuck in walls. This game needed a serious playtest before launch.

Critical strikes are too strong, with head shots on a 150 damage weapon doing 1500 damage. This might be a great thing if there was enough enemy diversity that finding the critical spot was a core mechanic, but as it sits, it's shoot everything in the head or they're bullet sponges.

Very poorly optimized, stutters, pop ins, framerate issues. It feels like they didn't playtest anything.

I cannot recommend the game at the moment. That may change in the future, but right now? No. There are pros and cons, however the cons far outweigh the pros and honestly if you're reading a review you want to know what the game will be like so here we go.

Played with friends last night for around 5 hours for day 1. 

1. The bottleneck: I had to re-download and patch the ENTIRE game even though I did the preinstall. This got bottlenecked and took 3 hours... for a game I already had downloaded. This was a bad start. 

2. The boots: During our playtime we had several disconnects, and when one person disconnected it started a chain event that eventually just shut the entire lobby down. This disconnect cost a few of us skins we'd collected, and other progression.

3. Glitches: We ran into a number of them, but I personally ran into a few that were just... breaking. One; I'm playing Jacob I get a cool sniper.. only problem is I can't aim with the sniper because when I do it shows the scoped 'aim fov' but the scope is blinking in and out of existence and I can still see my rifle and in my hand like I wasn't aimed in. This makes it impossible to see because the scope is actually in the way of seeing anything on the screen in front of me. Oh, and when aiming with my other weapons.. I have a scope outline on my screen and they lose their natural crosshair. Fun times. Then another time I'm sliding down a hall way in a Nest and get stuck. Hard stuck. We tried killing me, we tried me staking a vamp, we tried the elevator spell, we even finished the nest and teleported me out of the nest and I was still stuck in the overworld. Sure, it was funny, but oh so annoying specially when I had to exit and it triggered one of the crashes mentioned above.

4. OH GOD THE PIXELS: I'm running this on epic, and when you tag an enemy, specially vampires, they get a red outline and this outline makes them look like they're something from Doom, not the remake, the original. It's horrible.

5. The AI: It's clunky as others have said. Don't think I need to go too in depth on this as it's more of something many people have said.

6. Graphics: Beyond pixelation of enemies when tagged some things just pixelate. Floor boards seem to love to do it, where there are just little black dots around where the game seems to think shadows should be. IDK. It doesn't look good.

7. Skins: Hey guys we can customise our characters! Cept... not so much. If you want to wear any part of your iconic skin, well you can't change any other part. So if you're Jacob and you want to keep the hood but wear a different body combo? Get bent. No such luck.

8. World Design: While the world is 'okay' it's empty and kind of bland. This is not what I expected from Arkane at all, not enough funny ways to do things, not enough diversity in play style. Sure there are multiple ways to do things, but usually it just ends in a straight firefight so why bother doing things uniquely? There is no reward for being stealthy or intelligent in your moves i's just meh. Honestly they'd of been better off just having a hub and sending you on missions and generating those mission maps with unique takedowns and such in mind IMO.

9. Price tag and future updates: So, this is a big one for me and one of the reasons why I definitely cannot recommend the game right now. With everything up above this is NOT a 70 dollar game. This is a 20-30 dollar Early Access game at best and then on top of that they have a plan to make us buy new heroes in place to milk even more money out of this unfinished, unpolished.... thing. Don't buy it, spend your money on something else or wait until they get it fixed.

Absolutely one of the worst games ever made.

I was excited for this game. And now ive used it as a learning experience to wait for reviews. This game is a dissapointing mess, and honestly, i don't think any amount of updates could save it. This isn't just an undercooked game with a blatant lack of polish, this feels like a concept more than an actual game. All the pieces are in the game that couldve made it good, but it doesnt do ANY of them well. 

STORY:
The story is incoherent at best and non-existent at worst. The most part of a story you can actually get is through notes and collectibles. The main missions are literally "go here, grab thing because we told you too, maybe kill a thing, and report back." There are few exceptions, but those are found in boss fights. I haven't completed the game to see the rest, and honestly, i dont think I can push myself to complete it. I know the game itself is short. You can complete everything in 12 hours. And some things are brought into the game that just dont make sense. Theres a third type of enemy thats like a private security, and it is never TRULY explained what their purpose is. Like at all. They exist, JUST to exist. And they play the EXACT same way as the cultists. In the notes, there is a DECENT story. But it is never given proper showing. There arent even actual cutscenes in the game. Not one single, actual cutscene in this game. Just models frozen in settings while the characters monologue over them. 

GAMEPLAY:
Couldve been good. As i said, all the pieces are there, the just do NOT work. Its a generic shooter that doesnt reinvent any wheels. The loot system is NOT rewarding. You can find the highest tier gear with a 30% damage buff and use that for most of the game straight from the jump. The abilities are laughably bland. I found myself not using them, ever. And the skill tree is beyond pointless. It doesnt change things to cater to a playstyle, or do anything interesting. None of them do. Granted, i only played one character, but you only need to play one to see how little thought went into it. The AI is some of the worst ive seen in a AAA title. You kill an enemy right next to another one and half the time theyre not even aware of it. Constantly running into walls or standing in front of whatever theyre shooting only to get obliterated. 

As for the vampires, the main focus of the game, once youve fought one, its the exact same fight. Over, and over, and over. There are a few "specials." and by specials, i mean they do one thing differently, or just have more health. They basically just rush you. In groups, its a little challenging. But more annoying than it is engaging. The CORE element of their game, feels like a chore to deal with rather than a rewarding aspect. And most times you can just avoid them. Just run through everything. Its insane. 

I finished one boss fight, and it isnt even that good. Nothing rewarding about it. I have nothing to say on this end. It was just BORING. I imagine all boss fights feel the exact same. 

There is weapon variety, but it doesnt matter. All weapons feel the same. 

OPEN WORLD:
This is probably the worst out of all the things in this game. The open world is not only relatively small, it is EMPTY. Sure, enemies are fairly placed around, but when every fight feels the same, it doesnt matter. The loot system isnt rewarding enough to care after awhile. If you were expecting to try and search for specific chests that contain great loot, well i hate to tell you, that isnt the case. The "looter shooter" aspect of the game is as bare bones as it gets. There is nothing in this map. Aside from side missions, like "vampire nests." which are very short dungeons with maybe 5 enemies in it that are supposed to give you higher tier items, but again, when every weapon feels the exact same, it really doesnt mattter. No weapon has anything interesting going for it. Even the Highest tier weapons. They just look different. 

ATMOSPHERE:
This is probably the only thing the game does well in. Its creepy. The music is actually pretty good. The setting and set pieces feel like a stephen king novel. And the core of Arkane with enviornmental storytelling is definitely there. If this game took a direction that Arkane was naturally good at, it could have been a decent game, and it shows. 

MULTIPLAYER:
No matchmaking. Havent played with anyone but ive heard its constantly bugged. They advertised it as a 4 player co op and didnt even bother to cater to that. If you cant make it accessible and easy to play with others, then why do it?

PERFORMANCE:
AI, as I said, is atrocious. It doesnt make the game fun. You can steamroll through almost everything. 

Stuttering is not CONSTANT, but it is frequent. FPS drops in almost every area with multiple buildings or enemies. There is a significant lack of polish in this game. It actually makes me question if this product was actually rushed or they just gave up.

Textures take awhile to load in, graphic bugs are frequent. It just does not feel polished.

GRAPHICS:
Not terrible, but for a AAA in 2023, could be better. This studio has other games that came out YEARS ago that look better. Prey, and Dishonored 2 GENUINELY look better than this game. Not to say its terrible, but for those of you that care.
 

OVERALL:
Again, i really wanted to like this game. and I pushed myself to try and complete it before making this, but honestly, it came to a point where I was pushing myself so hard I wasnt having any amount of fun. The first mission feels decent. They tell you to play your way when finishing the first mission, but there is no REAL way to play. The lack of choice at all is masked by the "open world" aspect of the game. Arkane has made absolute BANGERS in the past, and i genuinely cant see how they thought this game was anywhere near ready to come out. Even if they patch it over time and fix things like the framerate, the AI, maybe difficulty scaling, change the perk system, that doesnt fix the main problem with this game. The game has no identity. It has a bunch of elements thrown into it to cater to as wide of an audience as possible and does none of them well. I truly dont believe Arkane is to blame. I think Microsoft made them create the game in the safest way possible, at the risk of the studio itself to make as much money as possible before people realize how unfinished this game is. Ill say it again and again, this game isnt a finished product, it feels more like a CONCEPT of a game.

Rating: 3/10 Bad game, bad time, sad time.

As a casual gamer, I wanted to love this game, but I just can't. It's surprising to me that Arkane Studios, who brought us amazing games like Dishonored, Prey, and Deathloop, could make something like this. I had high hopes, but unfortunately, it feels like another rushed game that was banking on the love players have for the studio. It's similar to Cyberpunk 2077, which was also rushed and promised a lot but failed to deliver.

I'm hoping that over time, the developers will fix it, like they did with Cyberpunk 2077, and turn it around. It's not helping that it's available on Game Pass, as it feels like it's just adding to the list of unfinished games. The fact that Xbox bought this studio is a letdown, and I'm worried that Starfield will also be a disappointment. If it is, it could be the end of Xbox Game Pass and maybe even the console.

Here are some pros and cons:

Pros: The combat is safe but enjoyable, and it's fun to play with friends.

Cons: The graphics are terrible right now, the RPG elements could be better, the AI is lacking, it requires an always-online connection, the frame rate is poor, and the game is graphically unimpressive. The story doesn't have cutscenes, only story panels with moving pictures. There's no matchmaking, which is needed for socially awkward players. There aren't enough weapon types, and there aren't many open locations like buildings and houses. The town seems dead.

Overall, the game is just broken. It needed a delay of at least one or two years to live up to the $70 Arkane Studio Game Title. At best, it feels like a $30-40 game. I'm sorry for the long list of negatives, but there just isn't much positive to say about it at the moment.

Redfall is more of a disappointing game than an actually bad game and your mileage may vary, but the question is "Would you recommend this game to other players?" Absolutely not. If you like Arkane games, don't buy this one. This is certainly not a $70 experience when Prey and Dishonored 2 look and play as good as they did 5+ years ago. 

Now, to be completely fair, I only played 3 hours of this game which isn't enough time to really criticize this game so harshly, but Redfall lacks polish and, in my opinion, the creative care and crafty storytelling nuance of previous Arkane titles. However, credit should be given where credit is due. 

This is a game you can play and there are things to do in it. You can join up with your friends pretty easily and start playing right away. However, there's no polish or direction. Things happen and you float around from objective to objective left-clicking or pressing E until next quest or start new quests via a board. I didn't make it far enough to know whether or not the gameplay gets more interesting, but the shooting doesn't feel great and seems like a step back from Deathloop or Prey. Movement is clunky when vaulting and sprinting feels like all the characters are on ice skates. There's also no climbing animation for characters when you observe them mantling and they'll just sort of A pose up an obstacle. Characters arms bend freakish ways when you're vaulting using an FOV over 90. The voice acting seems fine enough and the performances aren't the issue, but how can you make uninspired drivel sound good? 

Regarding the characters, all of their personalities are the worst. Each of the characters spout the most inane cringe inducing quips while also suffering from a strong case of diarrhea of the mouth. They never shut up. They always have something to say about everything. I'm just not sure who these characters were made for, but it definitely feels like a committee of execs who think "the young people" or "the gen z millennials" will identify with "the telekinetic threat in student debt" or the social media influencer ghost hunter. I can't say I've ever wanted to play a social media influencer character ever. But again, credit where credit is due, Arkane sure hit the nail on the head with how completely unlikable Devinder is as a character. The two other characters, the sniper and combat medic, have heinously insipid abilities and backstories. Jacob and Remi might as well have just been called sniper man and robot lady. Redfall doesn't spend any time getting you to care about these people or their problems and builds zero connection to each character unlike previous titles that built the bond between the player and the character over the length of the game like Alex Morgan, Corvo and Emily, or even Colt and Julianna. Every single character is forgettable. I only know their names because I looked them up. 

Redfall feels like a game that was pushed for release before it had been fully fleshed out. I'd be interested in hearing the experience of the devs and creatives that worked on Redfall because it seems like they pulled a bunch of themes, tropes, and archetypes out of a bag and threw them against the wall with a post it note that said "B Horror, but not funny, interesting, or charming."

Launch Day Review: 

I played with three friends, two of them via Steam and one via Crossplay on PC Gamepass. So far, we haven't had any major issues. We had fun playing together. The gameplay itself is enjoyable, and the variety of enemies is good, with some of the vampires being particularly creative. In tight spaces, technical problems can still make things challenging, and overall, the AI could be made a bit tougher (we're playing on the "hard" difficulty and finding it quite doable). Ammo and interactive objects could be highlighted better as well.

After few hours solo: (i changed it to thumps down)

Playing solo is not as enjoyable as playing with a group of three. Some main missions are poorly executed, to the extent that they would be considered side quests in other games.

Additionally, when playing solo, you quickly become overwhelmed by the constantly respawning vampires. There doesn't seem to be any way to revive yourself upon death. Moreover, there are further questionable decisions: There is never a true pause in the menu, so even if you want to look something up, you can still be attacked in the game world.

Its not fun to explore the world or use the Heores abilitys in a cool or creative way. I am hard disapointed. Missing the Spirti of Deathloop, Prey and Dishonored.
