I refunded the product, I only played for around 120mins on launch. Take this review with a grain of salt.

The game takes Fallout 76 and Borderlands gun play and mixes them together. At times, the sights are clunky and the gun doesn't seem to want to cooperate. Though, usually, the gun play is decent and when it works it does work well. However, the minor issues do tend to build up to a ruined experience such as a shotgun reload not happening if you sprint or climb on the last frame of the action. Small instances like this are frequent as stutters can affect gameplay, and the game stutters/slows frequently due to terrible optimization

The melee, too, is a part of this experience as when it works it makes things enjoyable. When it doesn't, it's frustrating at most and annoying in the least. There is no lunge which is fine. However, what is not fine, is that a leaf from a branch or twig obscuring that cultist's face can absorb your entire elbow's blow that would normally 1-tap the guy. Repeated melee strikes with your stake weapon to trigger the finishing blow on a vampire is also a must 9/10 times. Melee just breaks for no reason because you're not at the right distance.

Skills on characters are bland and limited in my opinion. Get ammo, get health, and follow the same upgrade path everyone else does. It's a game that wants to be borderlands with less character customization/build options. Nothing exciting in the skill tree section.

The map is like a Far Cry map, but smaller. Enemies are everywhere, but they're cultists or vampires. Or there's red mist blocking certain areas. The night-day cycle exists, but nothing really changes. Nothing different or exciting, this is just a Far Cry map with Far cry objectives. It just has vampires in it.

Overall, the game is a 5/10. Not worth $70, not exciting enough. So I uninstalled to get a refund. There's potential here, but ain't no one making use of it from my 2 hour's experience. And if a game isn't fun in the first hour, I won't be spending my time trying to get to the fun bits when there's indie games that are fun from the very start for half the price.

I'll be honest, I bought it because it looked neat and I liked Dishonored. So here are my points:
- Game is NOT worth the price, despite me being one of the few people who are enjoying it
- Stuttering is hell, it took me three tries to actually get the game to start, even with a powerful machine. Frame rates drop when loading in areas as well. But it stabilizes after a few seconds
- Texture loading is slow, and sometimes resets even if staying in an area
- Optimization is pretty standard and basic for a character, but the powers are cool nontheless
- I feel like the aiming is a bit off... even when I'm aiming directly at them. But other wise, the shooting feels satisfying when they do hit.
- The world is empty, but not overtly massive in the beginning, and different enemies respawn if you exit a safehouse, so it's not like there's nothing to do in an area except shoot more guys
- Vampires are menacing, despite how easy they are to take down even on normal mode, they look creepy af and that's cool.
- Music and story telling is cool
- I always wanted an ex-vampire boyfriend to summon 
Do I recommend this game? I'll give it a yes, Only if you got the money to spare and like shooter-looters, otherwise, wait till it's on sale. Hopefully a patch will come or they will actually lower the price.

It's okay

Primary issue is optimization. Before you can get to talking about any gameplay and story problems, you have to address the fact that the game needs to be optimized and figure out how they can make gameplay smooth. Playing on a 3080, having to turn graphics down and reduce DLSS to ultra performance to get a mostly smooth experience just sucks. Even with that, during moments FPS still gets very spikey and drops well below 60 FPS. It shouldn't take top of the line hardware to play this game smoothly.

My experience is as a solo player. I do believe from what I have seen that most of the game was planned around playing with at least one other player if not a full party.

After that, you get into the gameplay and due to the cost of ammo refills  it feels like the best option is to avoid combat. A single multi vampire fight can cost you several med kits and a good chunk of ammo with very little to refill your stock. Just seems to suggest that stealth is a much better approach than taking the world on. 

You get gated on skill progression with needing extra skill points and levels. Just feels like you are almost forced into taking options you would rather not or just holding onto points for several main quests until you level up. Early on this feels very bad. On top of that, the ultimate is a long recharge and I've only used mine once in hours of playing due to the situational aspect of it and feeling like there isn't enough enemies to justify the wasting of it. Plus where there are enough enemies is an area I am sneaking by due to all my other ammo concerns. (See above)

The story and NPCs feel awkward. Story is told with pictures and a voice over when they could have at least used in game models to animate some of it, but seems they went a cheaper/easier way. Story overall is minimal and doesn't have a lot of depth to it. The NPCs don't have anything interesting to say except at a few points where they are talking to each other and not you. Once those voice lines are over if you talk to them they just say "Hello" or "Hey, what's up?" or grumble. Feels rather empty of any emotion or life.

Overall, I think the game is ok, but it is in need of help. I just wouldn't recommend anyone buy this if they are making a choice between this and some other entertainment. If you are good knowing all the above, then it's good for some fun, but if your machine is running an old GPU/CPU or you don't want to deal with some of the oddities, wait for some patches to fix things.
One of the worst games I've played in a long time. Avoid like the plague.

I purchased this game and have already refunded it. Despite the already negative media surrounding the game I wanted to give it a shot. I did and here is why I don't like it.

- $70? Why is this game even $70 in the first place
- The opponent AI is horrible, it is not hard at all to avoid the AI. They just mindlessly chase you and can get stuck on stuff easily.
- If you play Co-Op on another players save you do not progress individually and will have to start over (your level and gear is local, and will transfer, just not your game save)
- The optimization is bad.
- Not enough content, you can speedrun this game, especially if you avoid enemies. 
- The world is empty and meaningless. The only point of exploration is to find locked containers with gear. 
- This is basically borderlands with a smaller amount of content, side objectives, weapons, and features. 

Not worth $70. 

A healthy price for this game to include its current content with the promise that the future updates will fix the optimization, and AI issues would be $30. in my opinion. 

You add more content, more features, more map, more elements, fix the optimization, fix the AI. make your progress carry over. give the world more personality and a reason to explore then maybe it will be worth $70. 

$70 for this is crazy. if you are charging this it better be a game worth playing that will have longevity in the community. I give this game 3-4 weeks and no one will be talking about it anymore

The story was a cool concept, but unfortunately its poor execution leaves Redfall as a wasted opportunity. Bloated with unnecessary open world features Redfall would perform better with a more linear approach. 

Blood sucking vampires won't be the only horrors you will be encountering in Redfall bugs and glitches are ever present in the game if the characters aren't T-posing they're running on the spot stuck in rocks and objects. Redfall is like the first draft of an essay from a first year uni student. Theres good concepts and ideas to evolve the co-op shooter genre with unpredictable vampires in combat, but this alone cannot carry the many problems with this game.

Costing over ¬£50 Redfall will leave you with buyers remorse, and contemplating on how we got to this point in the video game industry. Just go play Left for Dead 2 or Dead Island 2.

Just started playing this morning. The story is interesting as hell, and the gun play so far is fun. I can see the bones of something with potential here. That being said, this game absolutely has issues.

1. Glitches like crazy. Things like the flashlight either not turning on or just flickering and taking multiple presses to get health.
2. Crashing. The game has crashed on me 4 times. It's making it very difficult to play.
3. Graphics. Screen tearing, frame rate drops, and very poor graphical fidelity for a game that is supposed to be brand new.
4. The AI is pretty poor. Fallout 3 and Skyrim have better AI than this game. It ruins what would otherwise be fun gun play.
5. This is nitpicky, but the cut scenes are really weak. From a game like this, I want full blown and gorgeous cinematics. Not these still cuts with very little voice over. Makes the game feel cheap and not finished.
6. Price. This isn't an issue that is specific to this game and in general, it's a worthwhile debate to be had. Personally, I think raising game prices is greedy and lame, but with this game even more so. Specifically, because the game has clearly been released in an unfinished state. If I had forked over 70 bucks for this mess, I'd be pissed too.

I think this game should have been delayed while they polished it up, the bones are there, but they absolutely failed on the execution. Maybe they'll fix it and make it better, but I have little faith in developers these days. My bet is that they will make minimal changes and fixes and eventually just write the game off as a wash.

Game runs pretty smooth in terms of settings and fps, constant 60 even when ALOT is going on. The theme is pretty nice and the gunplay in combo with your powers feels fun to use and experiment with. I will however say that the world can at times feel a bit empty depending on how much you look around and loot and how much you just rush from place to place. Hoping more enemies will be added within reasonable time.

Haven't gotten far into the story but seems interesting too so far. 

Had some hiccups when we tried to play as a trio with Aim Down Sight (ADS) bugging out and one of our friends randomly getting kicked out and such. After I believe it was our 2nd reset. Playing with friends also has a rather unique system that I personally atleast haven't seen before. Staying close to allies when doing stuff like killing a vampire, finishing a mission etc will grant you with essentially friendship which in turn also unlocks more dialog options since your characters basically get to know eachother better in game.

Overall, I'd recommend this for most people that like Borderlands like games, pretty chill and casual game so far playing on normal diff(dusk).

I feel like despite Arkane's efforts, it's a game that's really meant to be played with more than one person. What might be empty streets with nothing happening are set dressings for a character exchange about this or that. Vibe-wise, it's sort of like Borderlands gameplay, with the Secret World's setting (loosely, just WRT the supernatural stuff in an urban setting), and with Dishonored's mission set-ups. 

Give it a try for a while, 'cause it's one of those build ups that are slow at the start, but get pretty cool the farther in you go. And all of it much more fun when played with others.

And, really, the bugs are hardly anything game-breaking (just funny at best and minor inconveniences at worst), and early day patches will definitely be clearing them up.

tl;dr: I'd wait a month or two. It seems fixable, but I can't recommend it at its current price and in its current state.

My Redfall experience started out with the game launching on the wrong monitor with the wrong resolution. I mean, you'd think that this was a solved problem in 2023, but it's not. Now, normally, this wouldn't be a big deal, you just hop into the settings menu etc. But, you see, Redfall has such an integrated "Online Experience‚Ñ¢" that it cannot let you proceed into the options menu _before_ you create your Bethesda.net‚Ñ¢¬Æ¬© Account‚Ñ¢. This is not a technical problem. The game manages let you access the accessibility settings, just not the visual settings. I don't know why I need a Bethesda.net‚Ñ¢¬Æ¬© Account‚Ñ¢ for Redfall, I just know that if I hit "Cancel" I'm back to the start screen.

Now since, the Bethesda.net‚Ñ¢¬Æ¬© Account‚Ñ¢ is such an integral part of the "Online Experience‚Ñ¢", I'd say, it's fair game to include the Bethesda.net‚Ñ¢¬Æ¬© Account Experience in the review.
The good parts:
 + I wasn't automatically signed up for a newsletter (Swiss IP address, might be different for other countries)
The bad parts:
 - Opting out of "marketing campaigns" requires entering the answer to the security question (security questions in 2023? really?). I bet this was intentional to create as much friction as possible for people who want to opt out
 - two factor authentication set up does not offer a way to back up the "setup code" or generate "backup codes"
 - they are trying to trick you into handing over your phone number (for account recovery, allegedly, but we all know that these phone numbers will find convenient other uses)
 - out of the gate, your Bethesda.net‚Ñ¢¬Æ¬© Account‚Ñ¢ username is some random garbage (instead of, oh I don't know, using your Steam name as the basis for the user name). That means that you have to go to the Bethesda.net‚Ñ¢¬Æ¬© Account‚Ñ¢ website, finish your registration and then re-launch the game, if you want a proper ingame name

Ok, now on to the actual game. Let's address the co-op Elephant in the room: PROGRESS IS NOT SHARED. Let that sink in for a sec. Sure, everyone keeps their levels and loot, etc. but only the "host" gets to progress their mission ("host"? What is this 2003?). That means that if (and given the state of the game: big IF) you manage to convince your 3 friends to play redfall with you, you will have to do every mission 4 times. For a game that _seems_ to be designed around co-op (heavy Borderlands vibes), this is absolutely bizarre to me. Just WTF were they thinking?! I just... what?

Gameplay: I don't know, didn't get to see much. Tutorial section is pretty long. Then I went on my first mission, but if you play solo, it's got big dark souls energy in the sense that when you go down, the mission is over. You re-spawn back at the headquarters. I didn't bother to find out how much of the overworld persists. Just the time spent walking back turned me off. I don't have any cool abilities unlocked and only the shittiest of weapons. Doesn't exactly scream fun.

Performance: Big "eh". The game runs "fine" on a AMD 7950X3D and an nVidia RTX 3080 (10GB). I get ~95 fps on epic settings. But it's absolutely not perfect. 
 - There are frequent stutters (things loading in?)
 - The menu (inventory!) takes 3-4 seconds to load (WTF?)
 - Closing the menu halves in-game fps for 3-4 seconds (WTF¬≤?! As if the menu was still running in the background or something idiotic like that). Since this is a "Online Experience‚Ñ¢", the game isn't paused while you are in a menu. That means that when you get attacked while sorting through your inventory, you get to fight off the cultists in "cinematic" 30 fps -_- 
 - Oh and of course: the inventory also sometimes drops down to 15fps

HDR support: yes, but not great
 - You don't get to set UI brightness. The UI is waaaaaaay too bright on an DisplayHDR 1000 display. 
 - You don't get to set brightness in nits (there is only a relative "+1", "+3" kind of slider. Who knows what that really does?!)
 + Looks okay for the most part

Polish: Also "eh"
 + Love the art style
 + Cut scenes are "efficient" slide shows (but if my money didn't go into cut scenes, where else did it go?!)
 - Difficult to tell whether you are crouching or not (other games have different gun stances or an icon. In Redfall, the edges of your screen go a bit dark. Really difficult to tell when you are sneaking/walking around in, oh I don't know, the dark?)
 - Speech animations look shit
 - Foliage looks shit
 - Map "Ping" marker has a pointy end at the bottom, but the thing it points to is not the location of the marker. The location of the marker is in the middle of the marker.

Should face some kind of legal trouble for how actually terrible this game is for a 70 dollar price tag. If you wanted people to hate bethesda more and picture garbage when talking about arkane, then you did a damn fine job.

I got this for free and can't recommend it currently.

"Well with each good thing a little rain must fall, in this case Red Fall" 

I about died laughing so thought I would share.



Gun play is fun, animations for killing the vampires, ect are fun.. the running speed vs leg movement is entertainingly wonky... 

The mechanics are fun so far, and the world is interesting and well pathed. Well pathed out could be a good or bad thing. It's open world, but there are paths and roads leading everywhere so just wandering around still has you going down the same paths it seems. 

There are actual choices but they are limited. You can stealth in somewhere, but not stealth take out an enemy... odd.  Guns blazing in this one is usually the most fun option. 

Separate loot for everyone! That's a good thing!
No story progress even if you all start the game together, except for the host... this sucks.
Multi player is fun, but they have a huge flaw, and that's that a character is an un-moveable wall... you can not push past each other, if you stop, you stop. So if someone is afk in a door way, well... you can never complete that quest until they move. They log out just before you complete or you DC? then the host also gets booted and loses all progress on said mission... it's a very very bad way to have a multi player game coded. 
Dialog can be started by anyone, they just speak into the world... if you miss it you miss it.. to bad. Can't go back and restart it or anything like that. On a similarly annoying note, you can not skip any dialog what so ever, so if you are on a new character play through, you are stuck with it all over again. 

You can skip cutscenes. So +1 there.

Hardly any graphics options at all. Thought this was supposed to be a ray tracing demo of sorts again but there is zero options for it. The graphics options are like console options. "Look good or look bad" and that's basically all they give you.

all in all, the game is fun to play though, and it's fun with friends. For the price tag though (I got it for free...) being as high as it is on the store, hard pass. This feels like a churned out 30 dollar game right now. Maybe if they update it and make some changes it will feel better. 

Current Bugs:
If you Disconnect from each other, you may lose all progress, or just some progress.... but most likely you will lose at least some progress. Have had all three things happen. 

Some items don't spawn for everyone due to individual loot and, idk why I'm not a dev... All I know is I had to run through enemies without a weapon while my friends were blasting away because the initial weapon drop didn't happen for me. 

Audio issues, floating through the air isssues, connection issues, graphical issues and able to glitch through locked doors, the list goes on...

Will I still play it? Yes, it's interesting enough and fun enough with others to get my attention.

So why thumbs down a game I'll play?
 The price, it's simply not worth paying their asking for something as broken as this or with the just horrible game play choices... Some are fantastic, others are terrible. The ones that are terrible are so bad that they over ride multiple up points for me.

It's OK, not great, but OK. Hopefully they fix the progress loss because that is just not something I'm interested in dealing with in any game.

Arkane finally flopped like most AAA studios today, and released an awful game. This game is just sad.

The open world is empty and boring. There's no secret lore and/or side-quests to discover. Exploring is pointless. Buildings might as well be cardboard cutouts you can see, but not enter. 

Combat is terrible: enemy AI is nonexistent, you never feel more powerful leveling up your skills, half your skills are for coop only (sorry solo players), switching weapons is a pain. The game suggests using stealth for missions, but there's ZERO REWARDS for stealth, so you might as well go in guns ablazing.

Storyline is just plain bad. With minimal cutscenes and storyboards instead! Storyboards are apparently the cool thing to do.

Overall the game feels unfinished and like the developers just gave up. This is Cyberpunk 2077 all over again. Save your money. If you want a good vampire game, buy Vampire Survivors or Evil West. Both games blow Redfall out of the water with content and enjoyment.

Coming from a fan of all things Bethesda, and a player of the Left 4 Dead series and Back 4 Blood AND Far Cry series, I have to say I enjoy this game. Is it polished, No, by no means, it has some issues that need to be worked out. Is it playable, absolutely. I feel like people who liked Far Cry will enjoy this game. I've only played as one of the characters, but he's been fun playing as Jacob. The game I think will be even more enjoyable once its polished with patches. I don't have any "game killer" glitches within the 3 hours I've played so far. If you're on the fence, wait it out. If you're a fan of Far Cry exploration, recon, stealth, play style as you want games, go at your own pace...then check it out. I haven't been disappointed. I think this title closely resembles "Generation Zero", rather than robots its vampires.The only thing I was disappointed about was that it didn't have all 6 playable characters available from the start, but I'm hopeful after they drop the planned two that more will come later, but that's yet to be determined so we will see. Fingers crossed a playable vampire character will enter the game.

Excellent so far, let me help you guys.

Turn DLSS Off, stops stuttering completely

I'm sure they will look into patching it in the future I get no issues with DLSS turned off

I have since played a few hours and have now updated my review with the following:
Turning DLSS off did help immediately, but transitioning into any new area per launch of the game gives stutter lag, like incredible amounts. IF you can through this the game works fine but be prepared to have heavy amounts of stutter lag for every new area you enter into, everytime you launch the game.

What has annoyed me is there is still no patch to fix any issues or any communication via steam about this.

This is an overpriced flop so far and I have switched my review to a big thumbs down.

The game is great (when it works) but until compatability and graphical/CPU overload issues are sorted I would wait.

Things that are good:
- Gameplay: Different classes and their abilities are fun! The variety at which I can go at enemies isn't a new formula for Arkane, but enjoyable in this game like their others.
- Freedom of movement: Again, like in other Arkane games, the ability to sneak, climb, and move about freely allows me to decide when and where I want to engage enemies.
- Variety of guns: My favorite so far has got to be the UV gun and crisping up the vamps for shattering! Hopefully they add more later, I think a modified brass knuckles with a stake would be hilarious fun at some point.

Things that need work:
- Loot: finding a gold weapon every few minutes make them seem less special, and I shouldn't find them in random bags that don't require a lockpick/wiring kit. Perhaps tweaking the %'s at which certain loot is dropped can help with this.
- AI: definitely needs improving, enemies run into walls a lot!
- Optimization: I have a 3070, i7 10700K (4.0Ghz), and 32 gigs of ram and on avg I get between 70-80 fps on Ultra settings, but it certainly dips to 30 fps on cluttered fights and looking at the big water wave in the distance (and that's with DLSS on). Definitely needs some work here to ensure a bit smoother gameplay across the board.
- Enemy density: at times it feels TOO empty, but on certain fights feels overwhelming. There should be some tweaking here. I'm not saying there needs to be enemies on every street corner, but also I shouldn't feel like there suddenly an overwhelming tide of baddies because I want to check out a new POI.
- Progression: Give players who join their friends the option to tie progression to the host or not (at least with new characters). 
- Back and forth banter between characters: feels repetitive at times is all, I will have to see if it improves with the "trust" building system 

Overall the game is a great time in co-op, haven't played it much solo though beyond the intro mission. A lot of the extra lore bits feel unnecessary, but I understand it is part of the world building. I would say pick it up, but maybe wait until some tweaks are made, or price drops. I personally don't feel like it is a waste of $70 because me and my spouse are having a lot of fun together in the game, but others who are solo playing or saving money, may want to wait for a sale.

I got this game for free and I still feel ripped off.

The game runs Okay if you have literally some of the best hardware money can buy, but even then it is dire.
Yeah the framerate and frametimes were fine... but everything else just feels so unpolished and bad.

I got through the tutorial mission and just had to stop because it was giving me a headache.
I was playing on ultra, had a solid 120 FPS as 2k with DLAA, but also tried just native (native was worse looking).

Ultra shadows... shadows are pixely and crusty.
Ultra textures... they're fine.

I didn't have any of the stuttering others have had... but the game just feels unpolished and janky.
The models and the animations are ugly as sin.. even for the stylized stuff Arkane goes for, which I typically adore.
The character models look like souless copies of borderlands characters after squeezing their heads in a vice.

And the biggest, most headache causing issue by several miles.
LOD pop in.
It is AWFUL.
Especially with bits of set dressing in the fire station, good lord.
You can be about 20 feet away and it pops between some terrible LOD that has missing faces (the windows were the worst) to the full detail when you take one step closer.
This is in a room that has hardly any items in it, just a corner with a shelf and 2 windows.
Why in whatever gods you may pray too would this happen to this degree on ULTRA SETTINGS

I had to stop playing due to that alone because it made me want to vomit. I have never had this issue before, it legitimately made me feel nauseous.

Next is the animations.
The character animations especially are just Bad.
Some of the worst I have ever seen. Its like freaking five nights at freddies animatronics up in here.
Enemies snap from animation to animation with no perceivable smoothing between each one, they go from running and holding a gun in both hands to aiming with no frames of animation in between, arms snapping from bent downwards to forward in a microsecond.

There are clipping issues galore, I know its an open world game but if I can casually wander around the opening area of the game and see props clipped into each other, floating, or half in a wall... you need to do better. 
That just shows how much the poor folks who had to try to make this were rushed.

This game could have easily spent another 6 to 8 months in the oven.
Give your devs more time to actually finish products jesus christ.

The game is okay.

Not great, or even good, but certainly not terrible.

It has a lot of glaring issue. Textures don't load, AI bugs out, it gets very slow at times, and is lacking a lot of polish. It's embarrassing.

But to say this game is awful, or one the worst games I've played, would be lying. 

The main texture that doesn't load is the pocket map (not the in-menu map), and that's only once every so often. 
AI problems only happen once every, say, 30 minutes. Even then, it's usually just a walk cycle not loading. The combat abilities of the AI are mediocre, but they still pose a challenge.
I can run the game at 60 FPS with most of my settings on high with lag spikes only happening in very cluttered areas. 
And the lack of polish is in places that I don't really care about. Sure, cut-scenes *should* be animated, and chimneys *should* not be copy pasted on top of houses, but I'm not in desperate need of a mini-movie or wanting to inspect every house for flaws.

I'm not here to defend these noticeable issues, but if these ruin the game for you, you're probably not here for actual gameplay.

And the gameplay is fine. Not great or the most unique, but if you genuinely hate it, you should not be playing this genre of game.

While I still cannot recommend this game due to it's price and issues, the amount of hate for what is present is mostly unwarranted.
Completely unacceptable for a $70 game. This IS the norm for all AAA games now unfortunately. How can this be released in this state? The AI is horrible. Hoping for quick updates!

[b]Disclaimer:[/b]  I think it's a bit silly to review a game after spending only a few minutes playing it but such are the times, yes? (and for those that missed it, this is intentional irony)

I was one of those fellas who saw this game from a distance, had his interest piqued, added to wishlist and then forgot about it until just a few days before release.  Like many folks here, I balked at the price - 70 bucks is already pretty steep but I'm also one who likes to spend that little extra and gets some goodies too.  100 bucks is a lot of cheddar to throw down on a game that you know little to nothing about aside from what the devs have released.

Still, I took the gamble and made my purchase.  The premise sounded fun and playing a game that supposedly can be enjoyed either solo or in co-op mode made the choice a bit easier.  Plus, I just need something to tide me over until D4 launches in over a month.

I played until I cleared out and established the first safehouse.  For some folks, this is only a few short minutes of gameplay.  Personally, I took my time and explored.  By the time I encountered my first cultist, I was armed with pistol, shotgun, and sniper rifle, had full med packs, and already a fair bit of what passes as currency.

My immediate impression was that this felt like Funcom's Secret World (anyone remember that?) from way back - but in FPS mode.  Lots of bits and pieces of environmental storytelling - humanizes some of the dead bodies you encounter all over the place.  I like the art and graphics style.  Some folks have called it cartoonish or reminiscent of '90s quality but I have to disagree.  It's a style choice on the devs' part and I think it suits the game just fine.  In fact, my son came in and watched me play a bit and he immediately recognized the Dishonored vibes.  (I never played Dishonored so I am not sure what he was picking up on)

I am typically a cautious gamer so I go slow, peeking around corners, using flashlight sparingly, and taking note of voices and the clearing of throats.  I was a little surprised at the lack of enemy density but again, still early.  I didn't have any trouble dispatching cultists (they are terrible shots) and my little robot buddy kept the basement bloodsucker busy until I blasted him enough times to eventually stake him.  I like the tense moments leading up to the basement encounter and I hope there ends up being a lot more of that.  

Gunplay wasn't bad.  I felt that it was a bit sluggish at first but I quickly acclimated and soon wasn't having any issues. The sniper rifle seems to miss half the time - which could be some of that latency that folks have complained about.  Otherwise, the other guns I've tried (pistol and shotgun) work great.

I didn't experience any technical difficulties or performance issues, though I did have textures sometimes not render fully in some cases.  I don't have an uber setup but am running a 1070 Ti with 32 gigs of RAM - I really didn't have any major issues at all (still early though).

[b]To sum up my list of pros, neutrals, and cons:[/b]

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
    [*]Open World - lots to explore, climb and traverse.  If you like environmental storytelling, this one has it in spades.
    [*]Environment - detailed, beautiful, grim, and ghostly 
    [*]Atmosphere - tense and foreboding (you never know what might be lurking around yon corner - sadly though, it's too often nothing at all....)
    [*]Compelling story - I like a story driven experience and so far I am intrigued.  I am looking forward to uncovering more.
[/list]

[b]Neutral[/b]
[list]
    [*]Combat - It's pretty straightforward. Nothing too fancy - though it might shine a bit more as you get more abilities and such
    [*]Co-op - Haven't played it so I can't comment.  Looks like it might be fun to play off of others' abilities 
    [*]Performance - Though I have had no real issues, small things here and there like texture rendering and such add up and make me think there is room for improvement.
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
    [*]Price/Value - This is kind of a big one.  I've enjoyed the game but haven't been knocked off my socks yet.  Is this game worth the cheese?  I think that this is in the eye of the beholder really but I won't be getting a refund so I expect to get my money's worth.  I don't think the value is there quite yet though.
    [*]Lack of enemy density and jump scares - This may come later in the game but I want my tension to be justified, darn it!
    [*]Brain dead AI - Cultists are just dumb.  Which is a fine representation because cultists in real life are, in fact, dumb.  Still, I hope for more challenging encounters all the same.  Perhaps later in the game or maybe some retroactive tuning.
[/list]

[b]Conclusion[/b]

Yes, I would recommend the game if you enjoy a slower paced, open world, story driven experience that also has a co-op component should you want to play with some buddies.  Plus, you get to stake vamps and murder cultists - all great fun. That said, the hefty price tag is a justifiable deterrent and I expect that they will continue to bring a lot of heat for releasing a game in its current state at such a steep price point.  It's worth picking up on a sale and/or waiting on them to patch with some fixes and improvements though - especially if you like the above noted attributes.

I am enjoying myself so far and hopefully the game will get to a state where more of you can as well.

Before launch, this game received a lot of hate for various reasons , and from what I've read and seen , it just seems like a hate-train without much to justify it. Aside from the console release where the game is apparently locked into 30 FPS or something, I really don't see anything that terrible about the game. Sure the price is higher than what most people were used to pay for until now. But beyond that, I found the game to be quite fun so far, and I've been playing it solo, I would assume that playing it with a bunch of like-minded friends would just make it even better.

I have not ran into any performance issue. My pc specs are as follows :
RTX 4070 TI
Ryzen 7 7700x
32GB DDR5 5600mhz
Samsung 970 Evo plus SSD
27.0" 2560 x 1440 144 Hz main Monitor

My PC build is newly made as of last month, I have every graphic setting to max, with motion blur off.
Games run fine , the overall game-play loop is simple but fun. I only played it about 3 hours so far and will log more hours into it. For now I still fully recommend this game to anyone who likes first person shooter looter with decent amount of exploration, free roaming , and co-operative play. If you think the asking price is too high , just wait for a sale honestly, in the end , the game will still be as fun and will have more updates.

Was really hoping the marketing was just not doing this game justice, but Arkane has absolutely missed the mark here. The gunplay is... fine, but the abilities feels so uninspired that I forget I have them. The upgrades seem okay but don't seem like they'll make that much of an improvement. Movement feels stiff, nothing like how fluid their prior games feel.  And how does this game not have a stealth takedown option?

Graphics are okay. They aren't doing much to emphasize the Arkane art direction besides the bigger vamps themselves. The way they move and look is very cool, but the other 90% is pretty flat. Performance is okay. For the most part on an i7-12700k and 4070ti, I can maintain 120fps at 1080p with maximum settings and DLSS, but there are sometimes where it chugs for multiple seconds. At this resolution, I should not be getting any of those moments.

Audio is another big issue. Sound effects and voicelines just don't seem well mixed and often don't play at all. Some of the dialogue itself is cool, especially the radio transmissions from The Hollow Man, but character to character dialogue is bland bland bland.

I'm not sure this game would be better with friends, but it may distract me from the lackluster exploration, which stings especially compared to how rewarding and interesting exploration has felt in past Arkane titles.  On the note of co-op, let me pause your game while playing by myself. 

I may put more time into it, but I don't see this holding my attention. If I had paid money for it, I would have returned it by now. $70 for a game that feels like an Xbox 360/PS3 AA title is absurd.
constant game crashes, and constant game ending bugs, makes this not fun or enjoyable.

I agree with the majority of the reviews below. Definitely not worth the $70 price tag. World seems empty, AI is definitely bad. I could snipe a mob in the head with one standing 2 feet away from it and no agro. Took us an hour to get into a multiplayer game, frequent crashes for most of us. Refunded.

***6 hour in update***
Its still fun! As the game progresses more stuff to do unlocks. I'm really happy to have another game that allows me to decide not only if I want to do side mission stuff, but different missions are different time lengths. Also, as more unlocks the gratification to clear whole zoned side-missions is greatly enjoyable. Now that all my characters abilities are unlocked (does so with progression) I can better see how each character is best utilized in each mission scenario. The first couple hours in I couldn't see how useful Remi was, but as we got further into large fights or boss fights then I absolutely can see how she is needed as a healer or using the robot decoy feature to give you a few extra seconds to heal up when swarmed by vamps. Oh and Devs teleport option?!  *chefs kiss*  Amazing.  


3 hours in and its great! Some things could absolutely be tweaked (Loot rarity drops seem really abundant. Maybe more enemies while out exploring, but I also could bump up the difficulty right?)   So far the character styles have been fun to try out and my friends and I have run into some serious fights in the missions where we all needed to communicate and assist with our talents to survive it. Over all this is a great co-op  with a fun story line. I am excited to keep playing and continue story progression.

Recommending because it's been fun for me and i've really got a huge amount of enjoyment out of this game. Despite what people think this is very much an Arkane game with lots of their style and gameplay elements littered if you just give it some time and go looking for them.

You can't play this game like its Division. Neither is it Left 4 Dead. Its an Arkane game with some looting RNG. But primarily this game is about the story. It is about finding different ways to aproach a situation and it is about exploring the game world for the huge amount of detail and care the developers have put into it. 

Only then will you uncover a trully wonderful game that falls a little flat of its ambitions. But a great game is still there for those that can look past the few bugs. 

Coop is way more of a mess. I play mostly single player and experience very few bugs. I tried coop and it was filled with all kinds of bugs.

What i see here is Sea of Thieves at launch. A game that has potential and has been crafted with love and ambition but that has fallen a little flat. I believe if the developers are given more time and support from Microsoft they can turn this into something really wonderful. 

That said with many many hours of gameplay, the more time you give this game the more it will give you back. The more i play the more i love it and i'm still not bored. I look forward to playing this at the end of each day when i've finished work and the kids are in bed.

Are there issues? Yes
Does the game feel somewhat half baked in places? Yes
Is it as terrible as the discussions or steam reviews want you to believe? Not at all. 

The main issue is at the price point its horribly underwhelming and from a studio like Arkane people expected much more.

Games like Dishonored, Prey or even Deathloop were unique worlds and instantly fun and different and while its great to see the Arkane style out in an open world and its nice to see them try something new it just lacks some of the stuff that really makes an Arkane game great.  

The environment and atmosphere are all fantastic and the game feels creepy. 
The storytelling is also wonderful but you have to work for it. It's like a big book that is difficult to get into but once you allow yourself to be come immersed the more it gives you back in return. For example, one of the best legendary perk pickups in the game isn't signposted. You may or may not come across a house with some clues and locked doors. You then can choose to follow the clues and read notes to uncover a pretty chilling and grim tale of three sisters who murdered a sibling as an offering. In return you get a really powerful legendary. But none of this is handed to you or signposted.

There are plenty of things like this throughout the game. Nothing is handed to you other than the main questline and even this has pieces you really have to slow down and pay attention to or notes to read or recordings to listen to if you want the full picture. For me that is great. I love it as it immerses you into the world and it all feels very Arkane.

Graphically its fine. Its stylised. Its Arkane through and through. Some have performance issues. For me i get a smooth locked 60fps at 4k on max settings which is just fine. I get the occasional dip once in a while which i presume is the game loading some stuff and in a couple of very wide areas with alot going on my frames might drop but none of this has hampered gameplay in any way. As with all games this stuff will improve over patches and driver updates over time.

At first the class system felt dull to me but as you unlock deeper skill variants and learn how to use them in different ways each character has its own very unique play style. I'm playing two characters and really enjoying both right now. 
I'm looking forward to seeing what the other two characters will bring to the table.

I also hope that they add another map to the game but somehow i don't see that happening as it would be a pretty huge undertaking.

Are there improvements needed?
Yes. Of course. Lots of the broad complaints are valid. The way people are going about making them is not. Its childish and indicitive of a very problematic issue that plagues gaming communites. People have no clue how to interact or behave. This is an issue you see over every game launch and getting worse over time. Steam harbors this toxic behaviour and does nothing to stem it. I'd be surprised if the devs bothered to even read some of the stuff posted here just because of how its being presented. The irony is if these things were presented in a sensible fashion they might actually get listened to.

Right now their behaviour is no different from a toddler who doesn't get exactly what they want so they have a tantrum and then get even more upset because they don't understand why no one takes them seriously.

Regardless i'm happy that Arkane were given the space to try something new and i hope that they are given the space to turn it into something even better.

"Redfall is a pretty decent indie game from a small inexperienced studio priced at $30 USD." That's all I could think of in my head as I played through this game, which is obviously not even remotely true. Gunplay is poor, player characters are kind of annoying and repeat the same lines every couple of minutes, mission objectives are boring, the map is tiny (I'm all for smaller maps but this is pathetic), and the game runs like 30-50 fps on my 3090ti at the lowest settings.

It's not all bad. The classes are quite diverse and the game is fun to absent-mindedly dick around in with friends. I'd say if you can get at least one friend to play this game with and the game price dropped to $20 USD, I could see this being a fun romp.

Edit: I tried to play it, I tried to like it, I truly did.
But it's just so generic and booring.
AI is brain dead, even on hardest difficulty you can just stay still in the middle of the road handgunning guys out. You will have to move to stake the vampires tho.

I got the game for free with my 4090 and I regret not waiting for the next game  that the series will bundle.

I haven't ran into any of the problems others have, the game has performed well for me. I have been hitting a consistent 100+ fps going through the game. There are frame drops in some areas, such as loading places I have not yet been however the FPS jumps back up once it has sorted itself out. 

There is an issue sometimes going in and out of menus that will tank the fps to 10 fps for a few seconds but it increases back to normal levels again. 

For reference,
I'm running a 3070 with a 5800x3d with settings on High and Nvidia DLSS on balanced. 

Game isn't worth ¬£59.99. It's a ¬£45 at best.

Lack of multiplayer matchmaking is insanity. 

I'm leaning more towards recommending, definitely could have done with some polishing. But overall it's a bit above average.

I've been reading the reviews of Day One release and I have to say... I don't know what anyone is talking about. I haven't had ANY graphics issues, and so what if its not super-realistic on the level of Cyberpunk? I love the artstyle being used, perhaps not what folks would expect for a vampire horror shooter. Some people say the graphics are "old" and choppy, but I've yet to have glitches or anything of that sort.

So sorry that AI isn't overtuned to one-shot players who have spent half their lives in COD doing flick-shots and PvP. Starting the game, I had a sense of immediate dread when enemies were 100ft from the opening scene and gave me cause to stealth around instead of just going in guns-blazing. Not that one style of gameplay is better than another, as it all comes down to personal preference. 

If your preference is Destiny'ing your way through waves of enemies until you happen to die and expect to just keep bashing your head against a wall until you win, this might not be the game for you. Maybe try to enjoy the game for what it is and not compare it to other games that it isn't?

The negativity I'm seeing is, frankly, baffling. Is it a perfect game? There's no such thing. Is it broken on Day One? Not that I see. Everyone is entitled to their own opinion and this is mine; Enjoy the game or don't, but don't let reviews guide your hand and avoid this one, play it for yourself and be your own judge of what this is. Every experience in a game is going to be different for each person playing it. I am enjoying what I've played, so far, of Redfall and I hope the experience gets better with time.

World is incredibly empty and game is really buggy. If you try to use a sniper rifle, it put's the sniper sights on any other gun you aim with. The gameplay itself is fine, the abilities some of the characters have are pretty cool, but I can't play a game where the world is so empty that it's 5-10 minutes between gun fights in a single player/co-op open world looter shooter. It's just not fun. If they improve the enemy density, and get rid of the some of the bugs as well as the moderate amounts of stuttering, it will be a 6-7/10 game, pretty much on par with deathloop.

If you're like me and you love bad video games because your parents purposefully raised you wrong as a joke, buy this game immediately. Runs poorly, looks bad, lacks a cohesive vision and feels strangely empty. This game is what would happen if you asked Chat GPT to make an Arkane game with looter shooter elements. A big miss, feels bad man. I'll probably end up playing for another thirty or so hours because I hate myself.

Asking 70‚Ç¨ for a game like this is a joke. Looks like something from 2010. Lighting and shadows are all over the place..flickering, disappearing, etc. The AI is extremely bad even on hardest difficulty. Animations and cinematics are laughable. You are given options of stealth approach but there are no stealth takedown animations implemented, you just sneak up behind enemy and hit them with a melee attack which just turns them into a silly looking ragdoll that flops into the air. When you use a weapon with a stake/bayonet attached to it and use melee attack you will still punch your enemies instead. Performance has been fine for me since I recently upgraded to a high-end PC, but I heard its terrible for a lot of people.

Its a fun game afterall performance is not that good at some places in the city but its not as dramatic as everyone stating

Yeah I'm not understanding the hate for this game. Don't get me wrong there are some optimization issues, but it is still playable and not nearly as bad as another new game that recently came out *cough*jedi survivor*cough*cough. It's also quite a pretty game, I think most people are just thrown off by the art style which is very reminiscent of the first Dishonored game. However, if you put any of the Dishonored games in a side by side with this one, this one is clearly far superior in terms of graphics. Story and gameplay are pretty good and intriguing, about what I was expecting from Arkane tbh. Honestly the one complaint I have, other than some SLIGHT optimization issues, is that some of the voice acting seems lackluster, like the didn't even try. But those are really the only issues I have with the game and honestly rate it 8/10 so far

My disappointment is immeasurable, and my day is ruined.

Pros:
- interesting gun mechanics
- short campaign (13.5 hours on hardest difficulty, including a few side quests in the first half of the game)

Mids:
- Soundtrack (some ok ones, others not so much)
-map design/layout (ok-ish, a lot of railroading for the story, too many mountains to go around)

Cons:
- $70 price tag
- poorly optimized
- mediocre story
- shallow characters
- low enemy variety
- incredibly stupid or divinely intelligent AI, no in-between
- a particular nuisance of a boss called Rook
- lack of UI customization
- pausing the game does NOT pause the game
- numerous bugs
- "cutscenes" are just power point presentations...literally
- cringey dialogue
- repetitiveness of the quests

Rating:
3/10

Summary:
Could've been done a lot differently and a lot better. Wait for a sale to buy it, and don't expect a AAA level of story. You will be disappointed. Recommend playing on high difficulty for a decent challenge, but fight Rook on lowest difficulty. he gets annoying very quickly.

TL;DR dont buy this, just get it on gamepass and then play other games once you give up on this one (for now)

Look at my profile, I love Arkane games. I loved Deathloop through Dishonored. But listen, this game is just not just complete. I mean incomplete as in it  has mechanics poorly tied together, bugs causing frustration, ammo disappearing mid-combat (seriously fun in a shooter), HUD showing wrong ammo counts (if you're weapon isn't firing, this is probably why, you're probably surprise empty), enemies repopulating an area while I clear the area (mid-combat enemy respawns?), and other jank. I think most public sentiment right now is just bashing for funsies, I just want to be clear that this is an Arkane fan moving on.

There doesn't appear to be a lick of "immersive sim" in this game due to the completely lackluster enemies in the game. You have a bit of agency in your approach to a situation (as in... physically what direction you walk up to the braindead baddies from), but the enemies may as well be catatonic which stifles interaction. Even Deathloop's enemies were able to be lethally dealt with in interesting ways. Non-lethal just isn't a thing in this game. Stealth overall just feels like a crouch toggle and an invisibility skill that both do very very little in the face of player choice.

Arkane usually does a great job with world-building and storytelling, those are the MAIN reasons I purchase their games, but this game's lack of cohesion in any of its elements leads to a narrative that gets whispered to you through the noise of all the mess that is the rest of the game.

Very disappointed. Going to purchase Weird West in hopes of getting a taste of "old Arkane". I hope Steam gives me a refund even though I played for 3 hours hoping things would get better.
(If anyone has any Dishonored/Prey-esque games to recommend, I'm all ears!)

[h1] All these reviews with an hour or less play time make this game seem a lot worse than it is. [/h1] 

This is MY experience of Redfall which I very much enjoyed so far despite the mostly negative reviews.
First of all, it runs perfectly fine on my PC (RTX 3060, i9-10700K, 16 GB) with more or less steady 60 fps (depending on the area I'm in) on high graphic settings with a few adjustments. This game is basically what I was expecting when I heard vampire themed open-world co-op fps and I can see myself spending a lot more time on this game.

Aside from a bug with the sniper scope and my crosshair disappearing once during the 7 hours I played, there were no game breaking glitches or bugs that made it unplayable. 
Also, I'm surprised at how well the multiplayer works! We had no big issues with it and even cross play with the game pass worked well. I was worried at first because I expected the co-op to be a pain in the ass like lobbies crashing every other second and my friends joining the game I'm hosting just lagging around all the time, but nope.

The graphics for me, well it looks okay. It's not the prettiest game I played but definitely not the ugliest either. For me the experience and the fun I'm having in a game matters way more than graphics.
The enemy AI is kinda dumb, could be better (give the cultist more aim jesus they hit almost as bad as me in Valorant) and even on the highest difficulty so far, it's not overly challenging (unless you blow up your friend with your c4 charge while fighting an underboss).
The music is great, there's a good variety of guns and an overall nice atmosphere  
Interactions with npcs are, well...so far kinda meh and while playing co-op the characters just repeat the same voice lines a bit too often imo.
Love the different types of vampires I've seen so far and can't wait to find the rest of them. 
Honestly, I could spend hours just exploring the city, for me it's not at all bland or boring like other people say it is.

The game does need a few patches for me to consider it a great game tho. But is it worth 70‚Ç¨? We all know it's overpriced, that's a fact. But for me, I'm sure I'll get enough play time to make it worth the price and if you can't see yourself spending this much on a game you can't get yourself into liking, don't buy it.
Also, some of you had a certain, not so great preconception of the game and didn't even give it a proper chance to prove you wrong.

My conclusion, it is in no way perfect but it isn't awful either. Imma enjoy playing it.

I am loving the game so far, it performs well over 120 fps stable and also has a story. The ai can be a bit janky at times but that can be said of alot of ai. I am unsure why so many are crying about the game as it could be way worse and running like star wars with 45 fps on a 4090, which is totally uncalled for. This runs well, no stuttering or fps drops but i will update again when i have played even more of this wonderful game and will break down everything then and edit this review.

I received a review copy without seeing any of the game's promotional materials, so I went in with no expectations at all.

There's a good concept at the core, especially surrounding the day/night cycle...but then the vampires just stroll around in broad daylight after the second morning? I couldn't figure out if that was a glitch or not, but it certainly killed any sense of tension and pacing that could've been created there.

Many things felt unfinished (the first wave of cultists attacked me by running backwards while i was standing in the open, yelling about how they'd find me - that bug was worth the download size on its own), the AI pathfinding needs serious work (the vampires can fly and teleport, so if im standing on a ledge they cant reach, maybe they could just throw something at the player while hovering there? currently they just kinda freak out, run in circles, then go full-on "it must have been the wind"), the gunplay is seriously lacking feedback and the enemies don't flinch from most hits short of a point blank shotgun, melee is an afterthought, and performance/optimization is abysmally uneven. the option to play with locked framerate (other than just vsync) would have been nice, too, since that tends to work a bit better with streaming clients like OBS.

I'll be revisiting this game once it gets a patch or two, but I simply can't recommend it in its current state.

Redfall - Bite Back Edition ..... is a game.

Oh.  Should maybe say some more huh?  Okay.

The basics of an Open World Loot-n-Shoot with story elements RPGish game are present.  The world can seem empty, but more target rich or loot filled would unbalance the game play.  Leaning to maintain stealth, ADS toggle, and other QoL options would make this game better.  The skill tree may be okay, but have not leveled enough to see how it works.  I wish some crafting, and weapon modding, had been implemented.  Story is interesting, and I am hoping to learn more.  I am not sure if this is a graphic or game mechanic problem but enviromental damage (fire, explosions, etc) are not always easy to notice.  I walk into a burning area that looked more like fluttering dead leaves.  So for this far I remain middle ground of Redfall is a game, and some may like it.

As for the graphics I will say that things did not work as I expected.  The optimized preset for my hardware did not work well.  My rig is okay: AMD Ryzen 5900X, 32 GB DDR4 3600Mhz, AMD Radeon RX 7900 XTX 24 GB, NVME SSD, Win10 22H2.  Monitor is a 2560x1440 144Hz display.  It was 40 - 60 fps with grainy odd looking textures.  Eventually I got this to improve to 144 fps avg.  Turning off FSR/resolution scaling was the first big help.  Then I could tweak other setting to where I tend to run games.  Hitching is still a minor thing.  Also minor visual effects that do not look right (some flames, random item physics).  Not sure if Nvidia problems are for the same reasons.

So I plan to wait and see how things improve.  I will thumbs up, but this is a very minor thumbs up.  Bethsoft and Arkane make good games.  Seems more time for quality will be needed.

It breaks my heart to write this review as a big fan of Arkane games.
To put it simply, the game just isn't fun. I didn't hate it, but I couldn't bring myself to like it either.
Gunplay is fine, and I didn't have technical issues.
My opinion of the game started to drop right after clearing the first base you get. The transition from freeing this building with survivors to it suddenly being a safe haven and immediately apart of some little community you run errands for was really jarring to me on a story standpoint.

You then accept your next quest from a mission board instead of narrative storytelling, further plummeting my current low opinion of the story thus far. Going to the quest location felt very bare and bland. The scenery and setting was nice, but I couldn't find any excitement. The enemies are bad. The humans with guns had horrible AI and the vampires were chumps with easily avoidable attacks. I was playing on the hardest difficulty I could and I felt no danger.

I encountered a few minor bugs, like shooting a still enemy and the bullet not hitting them. I was disappointed to find a major lack of different and in depth character abilities to pick and choose from like previous Arkane games, instead left with a few very lackluster skills with plain skill trees. I didn't bother with the multiplayer, heard it was broken anyway. 

Very disappointed in the game, maybe I'll revisit it in the future after some updates and heavy sales. The game is in no way worth $70 and I'm requesting a refund. Save the money and go play Dishonored or Prey if you haven't.

Updated Review @ 24.5 hours:
I want to love this game, and defend it.. but after seeing the endless bugs, glitches, lack of mobs, repetitive gameplay, bad mob mechanics, and lack of achievement sharing.. I can't recommend this game. I wouldn't recommend buying this game for anything more than $25. This feels like an unfinished game.. There are multiple areas in the map that are clearly unfinished.. I shouldn't be able to walk into a cabinet, or glitch into a rock when climbing.. or not be able to step up a rock because the devs decided not to play the game and make a working walking path.. 
There are some fun parts of the game.. but why is Layla the most worthless character when she is portrayed as powerful in the story? The umbrella is the most useless ability, the elevator is only really good for getting on a roof or hill.. and using the ult takes time and lasts seconds.. 
This game needs updating, which seems like wont really be happening. IF they decide to update this game and fix the issues, I would recommend the game then.. but right now - no. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Original Review @ 3.5 hours: 
Left 4 Dead meets Vampires except the characters can actually perform abilities instead of just standing there shooting.
I have enjoyed this game thus far, gaining access to this game right on release. No initial issues entering into the game - An actual plus considering the majority of releases lately have had issues which seems to be the norm.
Do I think the price tag is high? Yes. 
Do I have performance issues? No. 

I think the biggest issue with this game is the lack co-op story completion and achievements. Story completion should be shared between all players in the lobby. All achievements, stats, and loot should be shared within the lobby. I think keeping everything separate like they are now, is kinda killin the vibe. 
I am still pretty early into the game, so I cannot speak on difficulty as the game may progress to be much more difficult.

Overall I find the game fun and enjoyable. I think that if you're on the fence because of price - wait. But if you want a fun time with friends, I think this is a good option.

Really enjoying this, its a bit buggy but still rmeinds me of dead island mixed with some generation zero.
There are a few bugs that could be better like the grave locks they stop counting in the archive at 81 and start to repeat the earlier ones at random so you dont get to hear the rest of her story, it does at least count to 100 in the skills tab so the achievement pops. 

The unriveled weapons are bugged so that when you load back into the game the secondary perks on them dont work especially with the 10 extra rounds in magazine perks.
It feels like the second part was rushed out, the first map is all about the first vampire god and leads up to him with good story but the second map has all the last three on there and is quite rushed to getting to them and killing them............it feels like it should have been four maps with one dedicated to each vampire god with its own regions and scenery now that would have made it much better with more safehouses and neighbourhoods to clear on each of them. 

Some more collectables would have been nice and alot of variation in weapons not just the same few with the same few unrivaled too.
This could all be added in dlc or patches i guess but its the kind of thing that should be there now as i doubt ill do another playthrough just to see that.

At 50 hours in on my first playthrough I have: 
Achieved 55 ish of the 66 achievements
Completed both maps fully
Gathered all collectables
Done all side quests
Done all safe house missions
Done all main missions apart from the very last black sun mission as that is a job for tomorrow

 So this isnt a content light game unless you speed from main quest to main quest in a cod kid kinda rush way, if you enjoy exploring and collecting items, finding the lore and reading the stories while doing all side content it will keep you busy.

Overall probably a 7/10 for the most time it has been real fun and a good adventure.
I would wait on price though and grab it when on sale.

here's a list of problems with this game that actual humans and not game critics will have;

pros;
game looks great in HDR
hipfire is decent, weapons sound nice and punchy
basic enemies die quickly on the normal difficulty
ONE resource for purchasing everything instead of some ridiculous barter system
movement seems fine

cons;
game looks like a mess in SDR
killing enemies at a museum unlocks a safehouse generator 100m away in a different postcode and NOT in the museum
map markers do not appear in the game world but in a bar at the top of the screen, enjoy getting lost
tons of boarded up houses
enemies don't drop the money you need to buy medkits/ stakes/ guns
game runs at 30fps on a 6950xt in some locations
damage sponge vampires, no regenerating health, medkits cost money
no toggle ads option
tons of shader compilation stutter (because this is a UE4 game)
enemies either stand still or walk into walls
looter shooter weapon levels nonsense
unskippable NPC conversations
pointless and padded skill trees

overall it's awful even if they do fix performance and bugs, just play one of the recent far crys instead

I was going to save my review for after I played some more, but I woke up at 5 am literally angry about last night's experience with this game. Thanks to NVIDIA for footing the bill, I guess, because if I had of paid money for this I would be requesting a refund right now.

First, the release: Like many others I preloaded the 77 gigs ahead of time to avoid a huge download at launch, which turned out to be pointless. I was forced to sit through a 76 GB "patch" the instant the game finally became available. I'm sure my ISP thanks you for that move, Bethesda.

OK whatever, the game has now been double-installed and we can play. I crank up all the visuals and it looks OK. The giant walls of un-moving water are odd but kind of a neat effect, I find a gun, start running out towards shore and immediately headshot and take down 4 of 5 human enemies that are serving the vampires, I guess. This part was insanely easy, but I was utilizing good aim and using cover like I've been trained to over years of shooter experience. 

But it doesn't really matter. The next group I run into I take down just as easily without using cover, and finally I give up trying to be sneaky and just channel john Wick as I sprint into areas and instantly take down any enemy I see with instant headshots while barely stopping to aim. This game feels very easy. I'm playing on default difficulty, maybe I need to crank it up.

Finally, I run into the first boss and he's instantly taken down with headshots from my handgun but UH-OH I need to finish him off with a stake of some sort... Hmmm how to do that? I go into my loadout mid-battle (no pause by the way). The vampire has now recovered and is talking about eating my guts while he gleefully slashes me up as I am stuck in my loadout menu trying to figure out how to equip a stake. Eventually I recall that I had picked up a shotgun just before the battle began. I equip the shotgun and come out of the menu to see the vampire fully recovered and myself at 10% health. No matter, I shotgun that unholy fellow in the face a few time and FINALLY, Oh OK, I can use my shotgun to stake him.

This is TERRIBLE game play. You have me fumbling around for nearly a full minute in menus WHILE the boss is walloping on me, then I have to make the leap of logic, mid boss battle, to equip a ranged weapon so that I can use a melee weapon that is attached to it? After I have picked up several standalone stakes along the way? Why not just give me a button to stake the vampires, or make it possible to equip a stake in the loadout, or at least make it FAR more obvious when I picked up the shotgun that the one and only usable stake in the game is somehow attached to that.

Whatever... bad vampire "boss" is now dead and I get to save our band of trapped civilians and.... Jesus lord. The God of Redfall must really love ugly, because he made a ton of it. The character models in this game are all hideous. The worst affront to our senses being the Reverend Eva Crescenta, who despite having a female voice, looks and acts like a guy who is about to fight you in a bar for spilling a beer on him (her?) by accident. I guess this is some kind of a hamfisted attempt to shoehorn a trans character in the game, but it comes across terrible. For a much better way to do it look (ironically) at Hogwart's Legacy and the Serona character for an example of how to do it right. Or Maybe Eva isn't trans at all and the character design team.... No, wtf else could they have been doing? The character is terrible. The worst. None of the others are much better. Also, why does the pregnant woman act like she's drunk?

Anyway so now I have a base of operations and a rag tag team of support people. The doctor tells me I can come see him for medical supplies but to only take what I need, as others need it too. No problem doc, my backpack is already so full of medical supplies from what I picked up running through town that I couldn't possibly take any more. Got a donation box where I can put some extras? There's also an armory where I can't yet afford to upgrade my weapons and some other random areas. I head to mission overview and get briefed on my next mission, but it's too boring to follow and I get distracted by something on my phone and decide to quit the game and go to bed.

I want to say that I'm extremely disappointed, but I'm not. It's 2023 and this is all exactly what I expect of gaming these days. I was already suspicious when I got the game free with my new GPU, and my suspicions have simply been confirmed. I will probably play this for a few more hours before uninstalling completely, but if I had paid for this, I would be demanding a refund. There's no way that I can recommend it at all at its current price point. 

Terrible, Bethesda, take a lap.

Crazy that they launched it in such a state (just like many supposedly AAA games recently)

In the short time that I have played, Redfall has been a legitimately boring experience. I have no desire to hop aboard a hate train for clout or to go wherever the wind is blowing, thoughts are my own.

The AI is ridiculously stupid, the world feels empty and devoid of any substance, gun-play is mediocre at best and if anything, feels stiff compared to other FPS titles I've played over the years. I don't care about any of the characters because the game right now hasn't done a good enough job of getting me to give a damn about them. I'm not expecting deep characterisation in under two hours, but I expect to want to get invested into the world & characters and nothing about it so far has been even REMOTELY compelling.

Most of my time has been spent running from bland location to bland location, looting cans of spaghetti hoops and cereal boxes that auto-convert to funds, of which I've used to buy lockpicks and re-wire tools to get mostly boring loot. The skill-tree is also uninteresting. I came across a locked door and looked around the property to see if there was a clever or interesting way to break in. Nope, turns out I can just smash the front window next to the door and climb in, then unlock the door from the inside. Maybe there are some interesting puzzle locations in the game that reward outside of the box thinking, but I hadn't found it yet. I came across a safe-house where the power generator was locked in a shed behind a locked door, I saw a small window, climbed up on something and thought maybe I could hit something to turn it on or do something to open the garage door to get in? Nah, nothing at all, unless I missed it and I'm just stupid.

Performance is also not the best. Running an RX 6600 + Ryzen 5600, I kept it on medium settings and found that the game all over the place performance wise. Sometimes it'd run smooth, then it would stutter or hitch, there was noticeable texture pop-in as well. Bugs all over the place, I've walked into locations where the enemies have no health bars and didn't even notice I was there, no reaction, shoot them and nothing happens, I had no idea whether that was a bug or feature but I assume it's the former.

AI is a comical joke, imagine being excited to finally get some in-game action, only to be met with what feels like some of the most primitive AI I've seen in modern day. They aren't particularly threatening, nor do they make me think about how to utilise the environment or skills.

I'm sorry, this needed more time in the oven. Whether it was six months to a year, doesn't matter. 

I'm glad I won this via a competition and didn't fork out ¬£60 for it. Why waste that kind of money on modern AAA games when they're like this, when I could spend a third of that on early access games and end up with better results? I'll continue to play as I have mates that wanna vibe on it, but I don't recommend paying ¬£60 / $70 for it right now.
it's hard to believe this is coming from the same creators as Dishonored, this game feels like a downgrade in every possible way I wanted this game to be good but i'm so disappointed.

Steam reviews are stupid  : ]

Edit: Some of these reviews are just idiotic.

Reviews about Jacob: I see constantly, that the play style is too slow,  the raven's range is poor, or the sniper ultimate should shoot through walls.

1. Its a sniper. If you don't like slower gameplay, don't pick someone who sits in the bushes.
2. The raven's range can be increased. If that's still too poor for you, remember the cooldown is wild, it goes through walls, and can harm enemies. You can kill anything by sitting around throwing a bird at it.
3. The final perk for the ult literally shoots through walls. Read.

Reviews about content: I see people saying they've beaten the main story in 3 hours. Grats. In a somewhat exploration game (though a bit lacking). Spoiler: Also, I'm curious if that means they only beat the first area. There's a whole new map after the first one.

I could care less what anyone says about Redfall, I mean I think that it's not that bad but its not that good either and has several issues which I firmly believe bethesda and arkane will most certainly without a doubt rectify. In the game's current state it is actually very playable and decently enjoyable in my mind so let's go ahead and break out the vampire stakes to plunge right in..


+ PROS + 
++++++++
+ Great Story
+ Decent Audio
+ Decent Voicing
+ Decent Gameplay
+ Characters are Decent
+ Interesting Skills
+ Interesting Loot
+ Interesting Weapons
+ Fast-paced Gameplay
+ Singleplayer Gameplay
+ Multiplayer / Co-Op Gameplay
+ Vampires, it's nice to kill something that isn't Zombies all the time..
+ Non of the Issues (Cons) below have stopped me from playing it so far


- CONS -
-----------
- Game was definitely way overhyped. (probably 95% of the negative reviewers)
- Game can strangely feel much different than the trailer leads you to believe.
- A lot of repetative gameplay that can feel rather boring and unconventional at times.
- Not Very Challenging, I have the game on Hard (Midnight) and I was expecting more of a challenge.
- The AI is pretty dumb unfortunately. You can easily hide behind stuff and kill them while looking for you.
- Framerate does drop out and lag a lot at times strangely even on lower settings that should reduce it.
- Texture Loading Issues so I put the game on Low Gfx and it still loads poorly with Textures spawning nearby.
- Menu can sometimes glitch out when trying to hover over a weapon or point of interest
- Multiplayer is limited to just friends and doesn't let anyone random join up with you or vice versa
- Game World is rather empty and barren of any life aside from Vampires and other Enemies


= VERDICT =
===========

I was excited to play Redfall, I was waiting for a new open-world co-op shooter and it‚Äôs sad to say I was very disappointed. First off, this game has potential but right now at launch its buggy and I can tell with less than two hours of gameplay that the story and the content will be short. The open world is not very large, and the locations have little to search for, in one neighborhood only a couple of houses are accessible. The game is really easy even on hard, the AI either bum rushes you or just misses all of the shots while the vamps usually get stuck, rush you, or plain old leave.

Pros: 
- Location and the story idea is interesting.
- Has potential to be a good loot co-op shooter. 

Cons:
- The game is poorly optimized like most are saying. The downtown area is the worst and will go from 120 fps to 30.
- Enemy AI doesn‚Äôt track well and has only a few actions such as rushing the player or getting stuck.
- Player and NPC animations are clunky or have issues such as player mantling or climbing.
- The skill trees are small compared to many other loot- shooters.
- Resources are in abundance! I don‚Äôt know why games do this but not every house will have a super stash of the highest-level weapons and valuables. I want to struggle for gear and valuables so that I can feel pressure and get excited when I find a good weapon. 
- The shooting, moving, and aiming is clunky.

I would recommend waiting for the $70 dollar game to drop or get fixed before playing.
