Why is this game being review bombed? I can understand The Last of Us Part 1 PC Port. I can understand Jedi Survivor. But so far this game has run good for me (aside from one particular moment). I'm currently playing on single player so take what I say with a grain of salt, I guess. The game runs great on my 2080Ti, i9-9900K, 32Gb DDR4 PC. So far the game runs at a perfect 60fps at 4K High Settings on the AMD FSR set to Quality with the Sharpness at 0.5. 

Remember I'm on Single Player and have NOT tried Coop yet. (insert jokes about not having friends here). The game has one particular moment that tanks the game to 15-25FPS. Its right in the beginning when those helicopters crash as you exit the Fire Station. Whenever I look at the smoke from the helicopter crashes the frame rate tanks. But once that smoke plume was out of sight the game went back to 60fps. Im not an expert but its definitely something effy from the fire effects from the helicopter crash. Which I tested when I got close to the wreckage. Once I did that mission and got to the the fire, it seemed to have dissipated and then looking at the smoke no longer tanked my frame rate. Once I did that mission the frame rate no longer tanked. 

The game is fun. I just finished Dead Island 2 and this scratches that itch for more RPG Looter Shooters. Do NOT listen to the Mostly Negative reviews. Yes the AI is a bit wonky at times, but its no reason to give the game a worse score than TLOU Part and Jedi Survivor in terms of performance. This game actually runs. Unlike TLOU and Jedi Survivor which more like crawled like those Mexican dudes on Breaking Bad.

The concept of the game is okay but the execution is not there. I'm playing on a RTX 2060 Super / Ryzen 7 3700X / 32GB RAM and on medium settings I was getting around 60-70 FPS at best but as low as 15 FPS at worst. The FPS is all over the place with noticeable drops when approaching buildings in the city area as well as the red mist that's all over the map. There are also FPS drops when there are particle effects such as explosions and when staking a vampire.

For a laugh I increased the settings to high and ultra to see how bad the performance would be. I was getting a max of 50 FPS on high and on ultra it was a slideshow with FPS in the single digits most of the time. 

The combat is also lackluster. The non vampire enemies will stand there and let you mow them down or run at you in a straight line or get stuck on objects. Vampires are not much better as they too can get stuck on objects.

Right now there's no way I can recommend this game and certainly not for $70. I'd play it on GamePass if you must play it but honestly it's probably best to wait a few months to see if they can stabilize and increase the FPS.

My rating: 4/10

* After playing for just 1 hour and 37 minutes, I feel like I've already experienced everything the game has to offer, which is disappointing. The Dishonored series, which shares similarities with this game, offered major plot twists and a compelling story that kept me engaged, always eager to uncover more. Unfortunately, this game lacks those narrative hooks and fails to reveal any grand scope of the situation you're in.

The core gameplay's biggest issue is the AI, which poses little to no challenge. It's often possible to take out entire squads with unsuppressed gunfire before they even notice. If they do detect you, they simply switch to 'search' mode. On the rare occasions when they do notice you, their reactions are predictable‚Äîthey either make a beeline for your position or stand in the open, making headshots trivially easy.

I've also encountered several bugs, including terrain holes that lead to a white abyss, sinks that pour water through the sides of basins, and overlapping HUD keybind icons. These issues disrupt the gameplay experience and immersion.

Moreover, the lack of Quality of Life (QoL) features is astonishing for a game that's supposed to be Co-Op based. It offers limited graphical options and lacks basic settings like adjustable aimed sensitivity, which is crucial for a game centered around shooting vampires and cultists. Additionally, the absence of proper stealth kill and healing animations further breaks the immersion.

It's surprising and disappointing that a game from a well-known development studio was released in this state in 2023. Unfortunately, this seems to be becoming a distressing norm in the industry.

So far the game is a blast but a flawed one at that. A bit of a looter shooter shoved into a well crafted world ripe for exploration, both narrative and mechanical. The art team did a great job really bringing locations to life and the sfx and music work ties in to create this wonderfully pulpy setting. Currently playing solo but I am deeply enjoying the writing for Devin, the Cryptid hunter, it's smart and witty with just the right amount of b movie cheese. 

There is quite a bit of jank with the AI that is undoubtedly holding back the combat which otherwise has some serious potential. Ex. As I pushed to the main theater I decided to deploy my relocator to a nearby roof. I then engaged with my shock staff and took out the first 2 of 5 targets. Popped my re locator and from the rooftop used my sniper rifle to take out the remaining targets, two of which I killed by shooting an nearby explosive barrel. Problem is the AI mostly just stand about as I pick them off even on Nightmare difficulty and while the Vamps have some interesting attacks and powers they get stuck on doorways, walls and generally struggle to be a threat as consistently as they should.

The game is also lacking as a pc port and I would also love to see some additional options here on PC for stuff like ADS sensitivity and HUD elements. All in all it feels like an ambitious project that didn't quite come together but I am nonetheless having fun with. If I had to give it a score now I would say a 6/10 and if Arkane can fix up the AI and port issues that would quickly become a 7/10. Not a flawless gem but a fun romp with plenty of those classic Arkane set pieces through a wonderfully atmospheric setting.

It's likely to be a discounted pickup for most folks but if you can wrangle together even just one other friend to play in co-op when that faithful bargain bin pickup day comes you'll hopefully find a slightly more polished game, several patches in and you'll def get some fun out of it.

I would not recommend playing this for the price of $70
Just go play it on xbox gamepass if you really want to play it.

I was waiting for this for a long time. Refunded at the two hours as its not worth going any further for 140 for the two copies. This is the second game I have ever did a steam refund on and I have bought some seriously bad stuff in the past but at least I knew what I was getting at the time.

To be frank,

I loaded up the game and every character in the game was A-Posing. Couldn't even start the tutorial due to the amount of crashing. 

I am sad to say that I cannot play this much less recommend it.

For a studio like Arkane with a host of classics behind them like Arx Fatalis, Dishonored 1+2 and Prey. To have made something like Redfall, something must have seriously gone wrong.

I've been playing on the midnight difficulty, which is the hardest difficulty you can play on without having previously completed the game, and there hasn't been a single enemy thus far, from vampires, cultists, cultist lieutenants to Belwether soldiers and officers, that I haven't been able to avoid by simply running around them in circles. The AI is almost non existent.
At one point I was fighting three vampires at once, and while they were lurching and clawing at me, I simply stepped to the side, and nothing happened. I could take my time and whittle them down with my level 1 gun and then finish them with my level 1 stake equipped shotgun.

I will play a bit more though, get a few more levels to make sure the AI isn't being artificially restricted due to some kind of level scaling, but I doubt it, I will edit the review if that's the case.

Then there's the performance, I happen to play with a 4090 and so the performance is generally acceptable at around 140-160 FPS, however this is with DLSS 3 frame-generation. Without that, I get 30-40 FPS at 4k with a 4090. So essentially if you do not have the latest hardware and are playing at high resolution, do not even bother trying.

The game world feels exactly the same as Fallout 76. You get nonsense missions from npc's that could just as well be non existent. And you loot junk in the open world. There are many buildings, but most of them cannot be entered.

At this point, If I had to bet, they're going to take the wrong lesson from reviews such as this.
Instead of improving the AI, they're going to turn the enemies into bullet sponges, prolonging the fights, instead of making them interesting, they're just going to become even more annoying. And instead of improving the scrap looting, they're just going to make it worth less, so you have to loot even more to get the same amount of currency.

If you think about it Fallout 76 came out in 2017, that's 5-6 years ago. It wouldn't be far fetched to think that Arkane played that, enjoyed it, and figured they could make something similar. Which they have done.
Why they would think that's a good idea is really anyones guess.

Wanted to like it, but multiplayer is bugged. Boyfriend can loot everything while I can only loot one weapon... a pistol. The same pistol in every container that had the weapon. Meanwhile he has an array of weapons to choose from before we even free the civilians in the starter area.

Also kept getting ported back to the ship while trying to run away from it before succeeding in finding a way past it. Definitely do not recommend in current state.

holy garbage, what a disappointment. This game looked so great, and its barely a shell of what they advertised, combat was virtually non existent, and the combat you did get into was unbelievably easy, even on the hardest difficulty. Certainty not worth $70, I may try again in about 2 years when it has actual content and is on a steam sale for $4.99

Overall gameplay is ok. It's clearly a game made for co-op, more like Dying Light than Dishonored.
It's nothing special, and it doesn't stand up to Arkane's previous work, but I've personally had fun so far.

I understand that ¬£60/$70 is a lot of money compared to other games - If you're looking to get value out of your money in a game, this probably isn't the game for it. But compared to other media you can get? It's worth $70.

Lots of nice little details, good graphics, slappy music and yes, kind of bad AI.

A lot of people have complained about performance, but I've found the performance to be acceptable. Max settings, coasting around 70-80fps with occasional dips towards 60 and occasional jumps up to over a hundred. The performance could do with improvement, but compared to something like Jedi: Survivor? It practically runs like butter. (CPU	Ryzen 5 5600X GPU			 Radeon	RX6800, which i believe are very slightly below their recommended specs for ultra)

Again, don't get me wrong, this game is far from perfect and could be improved, but I think all the negative reviews I've seen are being a little too harsh, the game is alright. If it wasn't $70, I'd call the negativity completely unwarranted, but I think it's fair to criticise the game as compared to a many other games on steam, it isn't worth the money. But in its own right? It's ok.
it's not great, which is a shame, because it's the same team as Dishonored and Prey. it's a 6/10 game, what a shame

There's a lot of negative reviews going around and so far that I've been playing on solo for the 2.6 hours.. I've had a lot of fun playing thru. Shooting things feels pretty nice although the down side is the performance of the game.. I have noticed a lot of frame drop issues when I'm running around. Other than that.. There's a lot to explore in the area so can easily get distracted with what you're doing to run to another area to explore. The animations look nice when reloading a weapon or staking the vampires. It is a vampire apocolypse.. so I wouldn't listen to any other negative reviews that are going around. The game is fun. I don't know what type of game people expect to be "mind blowing" but I don't think they know how to have fun when playing a game either. They are the reason why we can't have unique games today that are purely different so instead we get the same type of shoorters ...because of everyone trying to find something wrong with the game. So, the only thing I find wrong is the optimization for it. Play what you want and don't be turned away by bad reviews. I did play Andromeda at first launch and even tho that game was complete wonkiness.. I still played the game from start to finish for what it was and I still enjoyed the story when going thru it despite EVERYONE saying "Don't get this game it is aboslute trash." I still got it bc I wanted to play it for myself.

I'm probably gonna keep playing with my friend but there is absolutely no way I can give this game a thumbs up right now based on the performance alone.  Even if the game ran well it would probably feel mediocre at best.  Absolutely regretting not trying it on Gamepass.

I think the anti-vampire weapons: Flare Guns, Stake Launchers, and UV Guns are cool, but the mods that roll on all of the guns are uninteresting.  It's like Borderlands with boring guns.  Overall I had more fun with Anthem.  Being worse than Anthem makes this a new low for me which I didn't think possible, bravo.

Review bombed right out the gate, Is anyone actually surprised? The game does have a lot of problems however and I suspect some negative reviews are genuine. Human enemy AI is broken and really needs to be fixed. Most of the time they just charge you and die or miss every shot when standing 10 feet away, how this was given the OK is beyond me. Performance on my end is fine but I have a high end rig with a 4090.

I see what arkane was going for and I'm on board for it. The world and atmosphere is great, gun play feels solid and satisfying. The different character abilities really make each character feel and play different. As a solo experience the game is fun albeit extremely rough around the edges. Nothing that can't be fixed imo though.

Very easy, bad ai, no matchmaking, any many small things like no aim sensitivity.

I'll get straight to the point, I bought this knowing It was too good to be true. So many advertisements and CGI trailers for marketing leading up to a pretty disappointing gameplay experience.

AI Is pretty busted, a lot of the time the vampires can't even get down from house roofs. 
Close combat feels super clunky because there's no "dodge" button In the game, so you're stuck running In a circle around the enemies waiting for them to take a swing and miss to then continue attacking.

Optimization Is just non-existent, like I cannot believe this got the green light atleast for the PC version.

Textures pop In and out. Now this Is something that gets on my nerves really quick In games, If you got textures popping In and out because you tried limiting the stress on peoples computers by not rendering things a set distance away from the player that's all fine. Lots of big games stop rendering things that the player can't see anyways, but we got an Issue when you're not rendering things the player CAN see and STILL lag optimization. It's just a disaster honestly.

Gunplay Is fine.

The Eagle dude Is semi okay too, that's the only one I've played so far.

Skill tree Is fine, no Issues there. 

Map Is terrible, I get the artstyle they went for that's fine and all. But the map could reaaally use some love on the Information side, It feels way too bland and just empty. 


Settings could use some looking too. Why does controls under settings not an an option to scale the ADS sensitivity?. 
Game has no fps limiter besides Vsync.


Loot that you can find In the world has NO Indicator whether It can be picked up or not until you mouse over It, this means you have to mouse over everything to find out whether It can be picked up a not. Looking at the artstyle I think It'd have been perfect to have a small white'ish border around Items that's Interactable, this would save so much time and headache. 


Overall for the 70/90$ I gave for this game I would have guessed a lot of the above would have been the most basic things to have In check before release, I cannot recommend the game at all In Its current state. It has a LOT of fixing to do, I'll be finishing the whole game and side stuff and then most likely update this review with further things that could use some work etc If any but that's about It for now.

an overall 2/10 score from me, gunplay Is the sole thing keeping me bare minimum Interested atleast until I've gotten my moneys worth In playtime. 

Take care everyone.

The gripping intro's to the Dishonored series games or Prey have nothing to fear from this game; they didn't improve or outshine those titles one iota. [quote] Please consider following my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41005226/]Curation page[/url]. I cover a wide range of genres both paid and unpaid, providing unbiased opinions as well as regular giveaway events.  [/quote]

[h2]Uninspired & Bland[/h2]
I have no idea what to expect from this game. The negative reviews claiming that the game runs poorly are from machines running the current top gen crap like 4090s bundled together, which don't get as much support as 3080s and lesser. You got screwed.  

The AI is terrible, and the game as a whole lacks a solid foundation for the open world concept. I turned the difficulty up to max and walked up to punch everyone in the face while they shot above my head. 

The characters movements and the key binds feel terrible, there are already good ways to set default keys to something like punch on G or Q or V or C, why is F punch? It's usually interact or flashlight. While T is now flashlight? 

They took no direction in any of these areas, attempting to build any kind of solid foundation that would allow their game to stand on its own. The game is functional, but a game like Atomic Heart trumps this by a mile and that game was a shit show.

[h2]Conclusion[/h2] 
I got the Biteback edition for free and I still feel like I deserve to be paid for my wasted time.

The game is enjoyable for sure. However with an average rig and with a co op friend who has an above average pc rig - we are both barely managing an average of 30-40 frames on medium settings. Unfortunately any time combat occurs or special effects, lighting, smoke, etc., our frames tank down to 12-17. A "AAA" Game charging $70 shouldn't perform this poorly with framefrate - one of the most important functions of any game arguably. After many more hours, the issues and bugs are so much more relevant and reoccurring. There are issues with co op and seeing the friendly models, issues with ammo displaying incorrectly, issues with enemy AI and easily being to get them stuck forever or not even notice you, issues with missions being stuck and needing to restart them to progress, issues where nests (instances) have the final door bugged where you can't leave until the timer runs out so you lose out on "escape" experience, issues with co op balance where the game thinks your friendly is level 1 but the host retains the much higher level and 1 shots everything, and so so much more including still awful frames at the lowest settings dipping down to 7-12 FPS with a GTX 1080. I am only playing still bc im too stubborn and want my money's worth. I am the idiot i know, but this game is a 1/10 for me

Feels like a mash up of Vampire the Masquerade and Fortnite (loot without the building).  Definitely looks like an Arkane game.  Feels like one too.  Gameplay-wise, It seems OK.  I went into this not know a thing about it.  And, quite honestly, I still am not sure what this is trying to be.  Basically, you roam around a city killing some fanatics during the day and then vampires during the night, all the while collecting loot (guns mostly) and completing quests and side missions.  Each character has a skill tree as well, though I haven't explored it yet. The game is pretty easy without upgrading with the enemy AI being pretty brain dead and the maps being somewhat barren.  I'd recommend you crank up the difficulty for a slight challenge.

Seems like people are complaining about performance.

I'm playing at 1440p; 7800x3d, 7900 xtx, 32GB DDR 6000 @ Ultra.  Runs decent with highs at 145 and lows around 100 FPS.  No upscaling.  There is some minor, but very infrequent stutter present.

Always disable motion blur.
The game loads ultra fast; Less than 15 seconds to get in game after launch.

Redfall is an OK romp.  Though, ironically, it's kind of lifeless.  It's not bad, per se, it's just not great.  Is is worth picking up?  Sure.  For $70.  That's debatable.  I haven't tried co-op, so maybe that's where it's at.

I initially gave this game a bad review due to constant crashes on start up, but after some updates the issues have been resolved and I can now give my unbiased opinion on Redfall.  First and foremost, I acknowledge there are many issues with this game, however, I do consider it a gem in the rough and don't think MANY of the criticisms would matter or be as blown up (graphics quality, arts style, etc) if some of the bigger issues (enemy AI, always online, empty world, 30fps on consoles, etc) were addressed.  In other words, I feel the entire game is under a microscope right now and many of the criticisms people hear about should only be taken with a grain of salt, because many of those same criticisms could easily be applied to other games, but arent, because of the glaringly obvious issues with Redfall.  Hope that makes sense.  That being said, I'm enjoying the game!  I really enjoy the artistic style of the game - it's lighthearted and cartoony and it works!  The gunplay is really good and is much better than most give it credit for in my opinion. Vampire deaths absolutely rock!   

A couple things I think the game needs to work on...  Enemy AI really is bad and I echo the sentiment of the community on this one.  They aren't tactical at all, don't use cover, and are basically just fodder.  I also think hit boxes need to be looked at - it feels really inconsistent at times. Original 2023 review:

I have nothing clever to say.  I bought and tried this game, and immediately refunded it.  I then tried to overcome my hang ups with the games performance in order to experience the games mechanics by subscribing to Game Pass for one month.  I spent another 4 hours or so trying to push my way through the main story and quests and ultimately I just could not find any enjoyment or satisfaction in this game.

If the performance issues were resolved, and the AI was tuned/balanced better, this game could become serviceable, but it will never be fun for me... and I will likely never play it again.  I don't see myself buying a copy... If anything, I'll just subscribe to Game Pass for another month if I really feel the need to test these waters again.

I would advise against buying this game, and instead... play it via Game Pass or just give it a skip.

_______________________________

New 2024 review:

Update: Got it on a deep sale.  Yup.  Three patches later, the performance and AI was improved, and the game is now serviceable, but still unfun.  Still... for $18, it's hard to pass up, if for no other reason than morbid curiosity.  The game world is very pretty... but everything else is just as DOA now, as it was at launch.

Update 2: Well, that's all folks.  Arkane Austin has been shut down as of 5/7/2024.  We all got scammed out of DLC and deluxe edition content, fed false promises, and probably will never see our money back.  I wonder how many people will casually forget this tragedy, and buy an Xbox, or whatever live service trash Xbox slings at them in the coming years.

Update 3: They released the final update with offline mode and major game improvements.  I would argue the game is now fun.  It's clear that if the version of the game we have now was the version released at launch, the game would have likely seen more success.  More proof that management is/was to blame for 90% of Redfall's failures.  Hopefully Xbox/ZeniMax was able to see that there is talent to be retained from Arkane Austin, and simply fired management... but I doubt it.

First of all, I would like to state that I have a NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4090, Intel Core i9 12900K 16 Core and32GB (2x16GB) Kingston Fury Beast DDR5 before I continue writing this review and I have to say... REDFALL is a joke. The PC port is unstable as all hell. I have played for almost 2 hours as of writing this review and below I will state EVERYTHING wrong with the game.

[h1][b] What is wrong with the game [/b][/h1] 
‚ö´So to start it off, it stutters. Not BAD bad but... its is unmissable. You can be running around just looting and then SMACK, your frames drop and the stutter hits you hard. 
‚ö´The AI in the game are the most stupidest enemies I have EVER seen in my life. I can hold in S and A and dodge EVERY single attack from a vampire.
‚ö´The stealth... come on.... you have blood in your body... vampires can smell blood... stealth should not be a thing against vampires... right? or is this just me being petty...
‚ö´The game looks like PLAYDOUGH. On max settings, medium settings and low settings. It all looks like UTTER GARBAGE.
‚ö´The "cutscenes" are not actual "video-scenes". It is a picture with AUDIO coming through. Didn't REDFALL get delayed? So what is with the state of this????
‚ö´The gunplay feels off. Its slow, clunky and just a mess. The weapons feel like they have way to much weight to them to actually be good in a fight. Most enemies just stand there and shout out at you and you see their glint of when they go to fire at you.... how pathetically lazy.
‚ö´Online Co-op, Cross-platform Multiplayer but no matchmaking. WHY? SERIOUSLY, WHY.
‚ö´The animations are terrible also. When you go to "stake" a vampire, you will completely miss it and stake mid air but still kill the vampire. 
‚ö´ANOTHER thing with the AI is that they are terribly coded. They get stuck on EVERYTHING. I was doing the tutorial mission in the firehouse and my vampire was stuck in the bloody floor.... it was just standing there letting me kill it and when I went to stake it, it glitched into the floor so the "F" prompt did not show and It regenerated FULL HP. 

[h1][b] My Verdict [/b][/h1]
All in all, AVOID THIS CASH GRAB AT ALL COSTS. It clearly needs more time to be a better game. Atleast 2 more years. THERE IS NO WAY IN HELL that this game is worth ¬£60. NEVERMIND THAT... NOT WORTH ¬£83.99. I will be issuing a refund as this is yet another game that is a complete joke.

Ok, I finished the game on Layla. This game seems good by the cover. But I've had some issues with it. Previous issues mentioned here was my fault. Not getting the "Stake" option to kill a vampire was due to me not having a gun with stake selected (I had it on me) when stepping up to a downed vampire. That could have been fixed by the Devs.. But.. Where's the blood in this vampire game? I didn't see any when shooting enemies? Is there a gore-option somewhere? All I've been through when beating the game was blood on the floor and some set-up death spots.

Problem 1: Performance, the one everyone is talking about. FPS drops, and some places it's real bad. The graphics isn't 2020 even, so why the issues? Did you completely rely on DLSS taking everything so nice you thought you didn't need optimization?

Problem 2: Loot. I've had the same 5 uniques dropping over and over. And this game likes shotguns. Like really like them, you get the first unique shotgun for free, just 4 minutes into the game on a new character. Unique is the best tier of loot btw. Uniques has randomness to them, but has ONE trait that all those named guns have. So the loot is just repeated. There's like 2 of every guntype in the game, except for Stakeguns, UV guns. two flareguns, two shotguns, two handguns,  two snipers, two assault rifles.. And that's it, they drop with RNG stats in tiers grey/white, green, blue, purple and gold. Devs thought that was enough! Hah! And there's no loot tables, everything can drop everywhere, or looted from crates..

Problem 3: Maps, there's just TWO maps. And five bosses. The first map is therefor automatically a tutorial map, with 1 boss. The four others is in the second map. And no, you can't go back to the first map once you've completed that map. Unless..

Problem 4: Endgame. There is none. There's NG+ where you start at your level with your gear and everything scales. Just not the weapons, you still get greys all through-out the game. I told you, everything drops everywhere.. You could do Vampire nests, over and over? Or Play through the game on NG+ and NG++? I don't feel the need to go NG+, as there's nothing NEW, and you're about level 20 at the end of the main missions, and max level is 40. So I assume two playthroughs and you're max level. But why? Game get's easier and easier the more skillpoints you have.

Problem 5: There's clearly some lazyness going on here, a lot of copy and paste systems. All safehouses looks the same once you're in.

Problem 6: No matchmaking or finding a party to play with. You have to add them to a friendslist (there's also a crossplay friendslist). No one bothers to do that, I soloed it all.

Problem 7: Classes and their abilities feels useless. I forgot I even had them. Even at the brink of death, I didn't see a solution with them. They were more of a utility than damage or a save from death.

Problem 8: The difficulty in this sucks, I had it at the easiest, as I don't want bullet-spongebob enemies. And yet I had a hard time at parts. The vampires overwhelm you, and you get a Rook storm on you at the same time, due to the randomness of it, while already fighting a vampire boss.

Honestly, if you came expecting a slighty spin on left 4 dead type of game this is not it.

UPDATE: IT'S DEAD. Arkane Austin is now defunct and the promised DLC has been cancelled. If you bought the DLC with money, expect a refund or compensation of some kind. Servers are up for now but they will be shut down at some point. I think offline mode will be added, but you're better off playing any other singleplayer game.

If you weren't sold on this game during the previews, your skepticism was well-placed. This game falls flat in a lot of areas. The promise of epic vampire slaying is, in reality, mostly dealing with human cultists and getting swarmed by vampires when you enter a house and trying to not run out of ammo.

>Characters

You get to pick from four (with two more on the way that will be available for a price) characters. They each have their own backstory, abilities, and unique lines when interacting with characters. This aspect isn't terrible, although I feel like these characters don't offer much introduction and found it difficult to find them likable.

You get several skill trees but there are only so many points in the game. Want to re-spec? Not an option. Roll a new character and do it [i]all over again[/i]. This is not helped by the fact that XP is not awarded for killing enemies but rather completing quests, furthering the disconnect between what the game is trying to be.

This is also a HUGE issue when you have skills that are worthless if you are playing solo, only providing benefits to interacting with other players.


>Weapons

Meh. They shoot but they don't feel particularly meaningful. The vampire-slaying weapons are cool but you run out of ammo easily. I saw footage of the UV-blasting weapon and it seemed... boring. This isn't helped by the fact that the game seems to be stingy about not giving automatic weapons to low-leveled players, which are the most fun.


>Open-World

This is the weakest link of the game. Enemies are scattered about in weird places standing around or coming out of the trees, almost like the game is actively planting them in your way to throw you off. This is not helped by the fact that the game's world is tiny by open-world standards.

The experience is similar to Far Cry, where safehouses are the default location to pick up new missions that will progress an area and unlock more content. Unfortunately, it falls flat where Far Cry normally succeeds in gameplay.

>User Experience

This game did not invest heavily into good player design. From the moment you pick up your first gun, the game will pause and force you to read a wall of text on how to shoot. This happens several times whenever you discover a new mechanic. At most, these should be brief text boxes that show up in the HUD for a short time. In short, a lot of telling and not much showing.

Even before getting into the menu, being hit with a character select screen was not something I was expecting. I just got the game, why am I being asked to pick a character? I have options to set first!

Outside of that nonsense, the main menu's design felt bland, which was actually my first red flag while I was setting the options. Boring font, boring menus, etc. Something felt off for sure.

>Story

Aside from the basic intro and a few missions, I did not get far into the story before calling it quits. I just wasn't into the game enough to care.

That being said, the story feels watered down by how cheap the production feels. The intro cutscene is a slideshow and voiceover. The same happens later in the game but with still 3D models. That's right, no animated cutscenes in a $70 game.

I knew something was wrong when the entire firehouse was being rebuilt instantly by characters that I had never met moments after clearing it. While this is a thing in Far Cry after clearing a major location, it feels cheap to do this for what is essentially your main base of operations.


>Music

I don't like trap music, even if it's mixed with church bells. I don't think it works but that's just my opinion.


>Multiplayer

You can do this game solo, if you wish. The game has a way of balancing difficulty with more players if you choose to bring friends. Just be warned that any progress you make in someone else's game will only progress the host's main story.

This is not something I would like to see as it disincentivizes co-op gameplay and may potentially be used as a way of padding out game time, forcing players to complete the same content again.


>BUGS

I didn't get much time in before calling it quits but I saw a floating object in a cutscene and a vampire that was in a state of undeath, moreso than usual. Stuck vampires seem to be a problem a lot of other views are reporting as well.

I did not have major framerate issues, but I am running on a 4090. Consoles have not been so lucky, being stuck to 30 fps.


>Final Words

I wanted this game to be good, I really did. I like the idea of fighting vampires in the modern age with homemade implements of destruction, but something must have happened in development. If this is the product we got after a year's delay, I shudder to imagine what it looked like before.

In short, this very much feels like something that would be given to play testers instead of a finished game. If you waste $70 on it, I will be sad. If you got it from a promo like I did, don't waste your time playing it. Do whatever you can to let the industry know that games of this quality are not worth this much money.

So far it feels very uninspired. It combines a lot of looter-shooter elements but doesn't excel at any one area. It has scaled loot like Borderlands, exploration like Far Cry, and a more grounded feel of Dead Island, but it feels like it does each one poorly. Gunplay is... meh, guns sound very poor and don't feel impactful, accuracy seems to be randomized somehow even when you are aiming down sights? No point in stealth because none of the enemies pose any threat, due to the AI being bad.

Not worth 70. If I don't see it picking up by the two hour mark, I'm going to refund.

I'll update more when I get further in, but first impressions are not good. It does run pretty well on high settings though, with my specs:
CPU R7 3700X
GPU RX 5700 XT
32 GB DDR4 RAM

EDIT: After playing for another hour, I have run into some performance issues. The game drops frames hard when particle effects are on screen, usually from skills. 

The game itself is just, boring. Go here, kill enemies, mark a thing for pickup, repeat. Most enemies are not challenging at all, the ones who are just have annoying abilities (Pick you up and keep you from playing the game for a full 10 seconds while you watch yourself die, limit your vision to a small sphere, etc.). Low-level vamps just run in a straight line at you and die.

Item rarity looter shooter cookie cutter mechanics. Gotta love how every co-op game implements this nowadays, without fully realizing why games that have successfully implemented this system works well (Destiny 2, for example, might be a bad game in most people's eyes, but it's itemization is pretty good, and there's a reason why the game has millions of players. Marvel's Avengers, another looter gear score game, flopped and failed hard for failing to implement well, among other factors. Same case here.) It feels like they just put a gear score system in without any thought behind it besides: "Other looter shooters have this, we gotta have it."

I'd rather be able to pick the guns I want and put attachments on them as I see fit, and upgrade them over time, rather than relying on random drops to give me 50 handguns, 30 shotguns, and maybe 2-3 assault rifles. That don't even have scopes. Gotta be lucky to get a scope!

On a less serious note: How did this town get overrun if I can kill a horde of vamps with a shotgun with a stake mounted to it? Like, from the abundance of ammo and weaponry I'm finding,  it seems this town could have taken care of it pretty quick.
This is not an Arkane game.
Fucking joke.

Positive: 
The game has promise.

Negative: 
This feels like a $20-30 indie game.
The world is super empty and not even that big.
The guns and gunplay are very generic and boring.
The AI is absolutely terrible; you're killing enemies that barely move around and are super easy to headshot and kill.
The graphics aren't great due to poor detail- that's on 4k ultra everything with a 4090.
No multiplayer progression, which is outrageous.
No multiplayer joining midgame; if someone disconnects, the host has to relaunch.
No multiplayer matchmaking; no friends or friends offline, no multi for you.
Swaths of unfinished sections of the world with stock asset reuse rampant.
The story and voice acting is soulless.
The dialogue is often cringe and childish "Bloodsuckers? I think you mean BUTT suckers!" 
This game genuinely feels like an FPS with training wheels for 10-12 year olds.
You will not have more than 1 ability, which is nearly worthless, before you are at the 2 hour refund window.
This game is ostensibly priced at $69.99 when it feels like it's not even finished; this is not the right game to raise price on.

In only 28mn you can already see what is wrong with Redfall ... terrible AI, when you move your character you feel like you're floating, the performance are terrible already 2 crash in less than 30 minutes of gameplay (I have an rtx 3080 and ryzen 7 5800x) I do no reccomend to buy this game right now at all and i would like to reccomend it 'cause i love Arkane games, I love this studio but the game is juste not playable right now, and i'll play it in ten month when it will finnally look like a finished game.

(Final edit will not be updating further except to fix if there are mistakes)

PSA: Please don't review bomb games just because they are not perfect and just because every triple A game has not even run recently. And please don't give games positive reviews simply because they run.

[h1] Short version [/h1]

FINAL THOUGHTS (some spoilers):
For $100 (CAD)/ 76 USD/ 70 EUR  I'm really on the fence at this stage after playing 2 hours I can see the gameplay becoming repetitive quickly. It makes me sad to say because I have enjoyed each of the Dishonored series and Deathloop; but I am not convinced it's worth the price at this time. 

I do enjoy the gameplay despite it becoming repetitive after only 2 hours.

My opinion is to wait for a sale.

[h1] Long Version [/h1]

FACTS:
-Yes the game works even though some people are experiencing issues.
-It does launch unlike Jedi Survivor, and does not put you in an infinite loading screen unlike The Last of Us
-It does have localised issues. I even had to close and reopen the game on first launch
-There is some stuttering, mostly minor and not all the time but it is there.
-A game simply working is not a reason to give it a positive review
-A game not being 100% perfect because every triple A game lately has barely worked for anyone is not a reason to give it a negative review.

OPINIONS:
-I appreciate making games is expensive but I find it overpriced.
-Gameplay is kind of repetitive
-Gameplay is a bit easy once you get the hang of it
-If you are lucky enough you can find top tier yellow weapons early on which will mow down bosses pretty easy which kind of ruins it [spoiler] there are also only 5 safehouse bosses so even if it scales if you find a yellow shotgun or a 90 damage sniper you can pretty much zerg any of the big enemies [/spoiler]

PERFORMANCE:

While having Discord on and streaming Netflix over discord to someone:

-Playing on 1440p
-Runs very well so far i9-9900k 35% usage 
-GPU 50-60% on RTX 2080
-Average PC latency does seem a little high even after not streaming it is around 80-120ms regardless
-For some reason my FPS will not display but so far runs pretty smooth roughly around 50-60 most of the time on both epic graphics and high only the occasional stutter when loading an area but it's minuscule
-I believe most of the performance issues people are experiencing are likely case by case. 

Performance summary:
So far the game seems good and runs pretty well. Small stutters occasionally only one time was there a big stutter where I sprinted at a large group of enemies that I think were on the border of an area so the game tried to load the area, have all of them attack me, cancel them all attacking me because I shotgunned them all in the head. One ran away I blew up the ATV he was behind.


GAMEPLAY (WARNING small SPOILERS):

A lot like Far Cry especially the newer ones (all of them?) where you take over a neighborhood in this case. Fight a boss get a skull from the boss where you can use it to fight even bigger bosses (gods) or find special loot so the game tells me.

The gameplay is similar to Deathloop but with Deathloop you had the mystery and the progression where in Redfall so far it just reminds me of Far Cry 5 which is just the same thing over and over. Yes the story missions are different but I expect a bit later in the story you'll have to do all the safehouses. Yes (SPOILER) there are only [spoiler] 5 safehouses [/spoiler] but apart from [spoiler] supply drops [/spoiler] and the [spoiler] boss fights [/spoiler] I do see it becoming repetitive.


AI no is not the smartest but the vampire as well as many of the enemies did actually attack me and the stealth definitely works fine for me including the noise alerts etc. Very much like Dishonored reminds me of the guards in the first game but we were fine with it then so not sure why it's a problem now.

-More similar to Deathloop than Dishonored I would say but with a few takeaways from Dishonored if you want to compare Arkane's previous accomplishments.

Gunplay is good not great but good. Headshots do count and hitboxes are pretty tight. Half a head you can hit but a sliver of a head is a bit too small. But its a CO-OP fps not Apex


VISUALS:

Visually it has comic book style damage numbers and stuff. Graphics/art style more reminiscent of Deathloop than Dishonored except for the consistent character style across all Arkane games (which looks great.)

Graphics are a tiny bit underwhelming considering I am playing on epic. They definitely went with more of the pop art candy flashy style that Deathloop had rather than the really nice heavy detail of Dishonored but Deathloop was more stylised than RedFall and I think it was a little bit of a missed opportunity but that's a personal preference more than anything.

Pretty much updated as much as I can at this point still considering whether to refund or not but feel free to ask questions.

Bought the game with my brother to play the game co-op, co-op on launch is broken. No big deal, I will launch a game of my own and then invite him after the fact, nope. Can't invite once the game has been started. You either start together in the lobby or you start solo. Not all bad, at least the frame rate is good, right? Yeah, no. The game runs very poorly even from a very optimistic 1080p, 2080 super, 32GB of RAM and a 9900K. This is the second game that has come out recently that I have genuinely been excited to try out based on what the developers have done before, but I have been burned twice in less than a week between this and Star Wars: Jedi Survivor. I sure do love being a gamer in 2023 that gets fully baked games on release with lots of polish and no notable bugs :)

Do yourself a favor and wait on this and see what reviews say a few months from now.

Do not buy this game.  It is an Alien Colonial Marines fiasco all over again.  There is no matchmaking for coop, you either play with friends who have this game or you play it alone.  This means that you pick one class at the start, and the others are only available to you if you start a second play through by yourself.  The classes however seem designed around multiplayer, there is a healer for goodness sakes.  Pointless if it is single player as you carry medkits.  

Graphically this game is very poor, lacks any polish whatsoever and is being put forward like its a AAA game that's had 10 years in development. 

This game is not worth ¬£30 let along ¬£60 or more if you have been enticed with the bite back edition which is ¬£80.  AVOID THIS GAME!  No amount of post release patches can save it.

I played and beat this game before any day 1 patch was up, I don't even know (if) there was a day 1 patch. The game ran pretty alright, it hitched every once in a while on high and medium, so i nuked it down to low. The game itself is a very uninspired amalgamation of many different co-op shooters that manages to not get any of them right. It has no idea who its target audience is. That being said the exploration is bland, the shooting is blander, i see more variety at the baskin robins than i do in the enemy types. Story and characters exist as much as my self worth does.

tl;dr it's a game with a neat concept that ends up disappointing. While i don't recommend it, i wouldn't talk you out of it

I WAS SO HYPED TO PLAY THIS GAME TO BE SUPER DISAPPOINTED , ANOTHER UNFINISHED TERRIBLE PORT.
First 9 minutes of the game. Found a spot to look under the map and slid to a branch and got stuck forcing me to close out of the game. I rate this a solid 10/10

---> One year and 5 days later and what do we have? Nothing in the way of updates, fixes, content, or even word. The last was in Nov 2023 which wasn't anything special. At this point why are they not just shifting it to a single player game and taking that always online mess out? They could also lower it to sub 40 because it's still not worth the asking price.

2024 despite the few updates things are roughly the same. Were in the new year and we don't have much if any word on what they plan. So I'm not hopeful. If you're thinking about getting this make sure it's on sale and really discounted. Server stability seems to be somewhat worse but that could just my experience.

--Release Review--
I have seen a few bugs in this game. I haven't had any performance issues with this game even on my Lenovo S7 laptop that has a 3060ti. I don't mind the stylized graphics. I prefer a game looks like a game. I don't need hyper real graphics. -- SCRATCH THAT ABOUT THE PERFORMANCE. I finally ran into textures taking forever to load and tree's are really scuffed for some reason. 

30 fps is the least of their worries at this point. Where is the complex level design? Where is the character details? Where is the story? I know there are the scraps of paper in the world but that is all suppose to be supplemental I thought. Slide show cut scenes and where is the pace? Story isn't good. This is a far cry from Dishonored and Prey in every single way. Uninspired skills in the tree. 

The AI in this game feels terrible. They aren't a challenge and don't seem to path correctly at times. Sometimes they don't even walk they glide along the surface of the ground like Frozone from the Incredibles. 

Navigating the world is boring. Some say flat. Just feels generic and uninspired. You're not rewarded for exploration. I had to jump on console to play this and have a better experience. 

Stealth doesn't matter at all.

Gun play needs to be improved. I mean what happened here with gun play?

Some of the voice acting really hurts to listen to. An what's up with some of these character models. They are really trying to make people hard to look at in modern games to appeal to some portion of the audience that probably doesn't play their games. 

The world feels a empty.

I like the music on a high note. I don't mind the stylized graphics.I think this game isn't a total loss. I think it is serviceable and you can have fun in it. But really you are only going to get about 12hrs out of this game.

I think this is terribly priced. 70 for the base is laughable. In this state it's not worth it. An the extra 30 BUCKS for the pittance of extra content you get with the Bite Back edition is just a slap in the face. 

If you want to play this game. I suggest you GAMEPASS this title. I don't suggest you buy this at all here on steam until the issues are fixed and it's or its on sale at a reasonable discount of lets say 45 percent. Because lets face it. They are serving you an unfinished product just like JEDI SURVIVOR was an unfinished product and it's like asking you to buy an bran new but incomplete car from the dealer and telling you to limp around in it until they decide fix it up the way it was marketed to you.

You can have fun in this game don't get me wrong. But it's not the experience we were sold in trailers and media. Get it if you want to have it. I love Arkane and think they will turn this around. At least I'm hopeful.
